It's really too bad they don't serve it all the time.

Now I can really understand why the lines are always super long for Curry Up Now.  Their food is very filling and flavorful (when not super spicy) and they always have friendly service.  Plus, they serve Mexican Coke =)
author: Rodney H.

description:
Sexy Fries with Desi Hot sauce. 

I have nothing else to say - too busy drooling.
author: July N.

description:
One bite into a hot Tikka Masala Burrito and you'll know why this place is one of the most popular food trucks in the SF Bay Area. Chunks of meat, rice, and a small helping of garbanzo beans, all flavored to perfection with a mixture of spices in an amazing curry sauce -- everything that is good about Indian food, all rolled into one!

We were lucky enough to have these guys cater an off-site for work, so I got to try the Tikka Masala Burrito, the Sexy Fries, and the Samosas. The Sexy Fries were also quite good, but just reminded me of a Tikka Masala Burrito poured on top of criss-cut fries. Chunks of meat, fried potatoes, curry sauce, and possibly some cheese (?). It was good, but since it was so similar to the burrito, I would either get one or the other, not both. The Samosas were just okay in my book. I'm not usually a fan of potatoes, so since it was filled with diced potatoes, seasoned, and fried, I wasn't too imporessed. I took one bite and then passed on to the next item.

Even though I was only really impressed by the burrito, it's soooo good that I still have to give this place five stars! It's huge, so there's plenty to share, but it's also so tasty, you may not want to share! Definitely a treat for me!
author: Leana L.

description:
I have gotten lunch here a handful of times....

Today's experience was the worst. I was excited to try the new Thali option and boy am I so disappointed. I ordered the veg version with Gobi and what I got was raw white Gobi with the Tikka sauce (which was watery) poured on top. The chana masala had a burnt after taste. For $11- I guess I have to settle and enjoy the rice and pickle. Kasa Truck does better rice plates..And No raita... its no thali.

In other experiences, the fried ravioli is the bomb- wish they would give you the sauce in a container vs pouring on top. By the time I get back, its like Tikka Masala Ravioli pasta and soggy...

Burritos are decent.

In my opinion, the best item is the Decon Samosas. 

For the price, the hella long lines and the extremely slow service for a food truck, Meh, try some others at the Truck Stop.
author: Jayashree S.

description:
I've been to Curry Up Now for lunch a few times and have tried the Sexy Fries, the Naughty Nan (cringe), and one of the wraps. 

The food is pretty tasty, but it's not for the health-conscious. Everything is drenched in oil and, more likely than not, covered in melted cheese. It's the kind of food that you enjoy while eating and regret afterwards.

As far as authenticity, don't expect much. Everything they offer is pretty much a fusion of Indian and American junk food. The food relies more on its ability to satisfy our fat and salt cravings rather than the average San Francisco foodie's "discriminating" (read: judgmental) tastes.

Overall, worth trying, but you'll probably feel the need to work out after your food coma.
author: Bryce A.

description:
Oh my goodness. That was so good.

I went on a Thursday & the special for the day was the "Lusty Lamb" burrito, which was so freaking delicious. After finishing one, I was ready to go out & buy another one to eat. (Not to say this burrito wasn't filling at all. In fact, you might even get food coma after eating one.) Everything about that burrito was just right - the lamb, rice, chickpeas, and assortment of spices just all fit together perfectly. In a city where I've tried all kinds of burritos, I think this was on of my favorite! Also, the line was kind of long, but the wait really wasn't too bad.

Note: You can check where there truck is going to be at http://www.curryupnow.com/truck-schedule
author: Alice H.

description:
Empty Fridge + SOMA StrEat Food Park + No Line + Clueless Food Truck Order Taker + 

Flavorful, Medium Spiced Chicken TIKKA MASALA BURRITO + Garbanzo Beans + Rice - Onions + $8 + Crispy Sweet Potato Fries + $3 = 

PRE COSTCO RUN FUEL
author: Amy C.

description:
I am reviewing this in comparison to Indian food and not in general. The food is good but not too great. There's always long lines which is a sign of great food but for some reason I find it average.

The servings are large so it's good value for money. The flavor is strong as you would find at any other Indian restaurant.

Took off one star as the food is heavy and difficult to digest. It sits in your stomach like a log. They lost another point as they didn't have spicy sauce which I think is mandatory for Indian food truck/restaurant.
author: Jay M.

description:
Off the Grid- Fort Mason Center

Deconstructed Samosa- "An inside out phenomena, chana, pico, chutneys"
It comes with your choice of paneer (cheese), chicken, or keema.

At first, I thought it was just going to be a regular samosa but $6 is a bit pricy for a regular samosa. Instead, it turned out to be a whole meal in itself. I only managed to take a couple of bites because I was full already. I loved the miniature samosas that they placed in the corners of the box. I don't like chickpeas (chana), so I barely touched any of that. Overall, it was a bit spicy. Don't order this if can't take the heat. 

I took it back with me and stuck it in the refrigerator. A day and half later I gave it another go. I was surprised to discover potatoes and a fried pastry shell buried underneath the layer of chickpeas. A little bit of the edges on the fried pastry shell was still crispy but most of it was now soggy. I think I would like the whole thing more if there were more potatoes and less chickpeas.
author: Helen H.

description:
I got the the Tikka Masala Burrito. worth it. I was with my indian friend and he gave me this wtf look. "Indian food in a burrito"?!? I told him to shut up because it's good and he's just pissed he didn't think of it first. after some thought he just nodded his head and we moved on...

p.s. if you can't take spicy food then TELL THEM. otherwise it is a mid to high spicy by default.
author: Norris T.

description: Ate here last friday night at "Off The Grid" Fort Mason. I'd been craving Indian food all week and was excited to see the Curry Up Now truck. I ordered the Chicken Tikka Masala with Naan. Within hours I felt sick and was up all night feeling ill. DON'T EAT HERE! Seriously folks, this place gave me food poisoning.
author: Anne S.

description:
Two words: Deconstructed samosas.
Four follow-up words: Party in your mouth.

... and everybody's invited.
author: Joanne W.

description:
Curry Up Now, is one of those cool fusion places, they have places all you could want from a curry dinner into a burrito!! Right, everything is better when you can hold it in one hand and use your phone in another! Curry Up Now, was originally a food truck, but it has branched out, they have several locations; San Francisco, San Mateo, Palo Alto, and San José soon! 

I used to order their pork belly burrito, but they discontinued that for some reason, which is heart breaking. It's okay though folks! They replaced it with lamb! I will warn you though, that it can be pretty spicy and pack heat if you eat it all at once!

Check out my profile to find my official blogs as well as more food reviews
author: Food G.

description: Food is delicious but portion was surprisingly small which was disappointing as my friend who had visited before said the portion was bigger before. They might have been running out on the food, so they cut the portions smaller. Delicious anyway tho!
author: Fiona J.

description: Yes. That's all you have to say to what you want in their menu - it's all so good! The tikka masala (any type) burrito is amazing and and particular favorite are the sexy fries with paneer tikka masala. Serious goodness man. I've had this many times but a recent stop at OtG the other night inspired me to check in on the curry up now game and they are still on fire!
author: Derek S.

description:
Good food when you're really craving Indian spices, being an Indian. But, it's not always consistent. The spice levels of the sauces is what I am talking about. 
I really like the size of the kathi roll now-a-days. The Indian Burrito is good on some days and just doesn't do it on some other.
author: Twinkle T.

description:
Lunch time in SF is difficult and having just moved here I didn't know where to go. Someone mentioned this food truck to me so a friend and I went to check it out. There was a decently long wait.

I got the chicken tikka masala burrito and a side of sweet potato fries. I had to walk back to work with it, so I blame a little bit of the problems on that, but the fries were pretty soggy by the time I got back (a few minute walk at most). The burrito was good, kind of wish it had some more spice to it but it did taste very good.

I'd definitely recommend this to a friend, I'd love to try some of their other options as well!
author: Matt B.

description: I've been to the food truck a few times and always enjoyed the food. I just ordered delivery and it took almost 2 hours to arrive. When the food eventually came, it was the wrong burrito and they forgot the Sprite that I ordered. Never again. And I don't think I'm ever going to the food truck again just on principle for how much this sucked.
author: Derek B.

description:
I have a lot of friends who have left reviews for this food truck, but I decided to write something more for it as well.

I normally come here on Tuesdays and get a CTM burrito with ghost chili sauce. The food is very tasty and fulfilling. I don't actually feel food coma/sleepy after eating a whole burrito, but some people have said so. Also expect a somewhat long line.

One time, they ran out of the chili sauce for a couple weeks, I was not happy :/
author: Cheng C.

description:
Meh to Nay!!!! 

Food is good...but whats with the size of the Lamb Burrito Bowl that keeps diminishing each time I go. Not worth a trip all the way to Mission for such food.

The contents in the newly introduced smaall take-out box is barely filled to half for 12$, plus no  extra meat for paying 2$ extra. Nice rip-off...not going back again. 

Mango lassi take-out here is half the size compared to Pakwan, for the same price.
author: Su R.

description: Loved the "hella vegan" burrito option. Good price, online ordering saves time, friendly proprietors!
author: Stuart F.

description: Had the mild deconstructed samosa with rice. It was saucy spicy goodness. Glad I got it with rice to go with the sauce.  It is a good size for the price.  Only complaint is I wish there was one or two more baby samosas.
author: Lacy C.

description: I'm new in town so at lunch time I search on Yelp to give me some lunch idea... This was a great find, I had the Chicken Tikka Burrito. Order it you won't regret it.
author: Phil L.

description:
Decided to give into a lunchtime hankering for Indian food this afternoon. The truck is pretty close to my office so I decided to check it out. 

The menu was a bit more "infusionesque" than I expected. Opted for the carne naan sandwich, which was ripe with flavor and massive in size. Also added on a samosa, which was a bit bland and twice the price of the ones I get at the Farmer's Market. 

The staff was friendly and it didn't take too long for the food to be ready.  Seems like it would be hit or miss with long lines. 


Food was good, but super oily and a bit too much for me at lunchtime. Perfect for a "hangover" lunch.
author: Amy Z.

description: Ordered the chicken tikka bowl and was not impressed. The food lacked flavor and did not taste fresh (atleast according to me). I would rather have food from the halal cart any day. Might go try the samosa next time.
author: Yamini K.

description:
Mmm... gotta love that CTM.

When I went to the Off The Grid in Larkspur, Curry Up Now was the truck I wanted to check out most. I just loooove Indian food and when I found out they have curry BURRITOS I was sold. 

I ordered the CTM (chicken tikka masala burrito) and I didn't have to wait long for it. It's a hefty medium size burrito, but I can imagine some people expecting more considering the price ($8). It tastes pretty good--sweet, and a distinct tomato flavor. It's mildly spicy with chunks of chicken and some chickpeas. A bit different from the tikka masala I'm used to, but I really liked it. It also tastes just as good the day after, aha.

I would visit this truck again. Maybe I'll get another burrito or try out the sexy fries. Totally recommend.
author: Adri A.

description:
I have always love this place, and often go there, but the quality of the burrito is just going down! I had a CTM and literally there is 3 piece of chicken in the whole burrito. The rice are in chunks which has no flavor and before, the rice and chicken has this beautiful orange color which is so delicious, and now the burrito is like this brownish color which is not appetizing!!! 
I am so disappointed!
author: Lijia W.

description:
Let's be clear: this isn't your traditional Indian food, so don't expect as much. While the flavors are very similar and true to taste, the presentation of their food is anything but, putting a more modern/fusion spin on a lot of the traditional Indian dishes.

Having their food delivered to our office via Seamless a few weeks ago, I had ordered their deconstructed samosa, and M.E.A.T. burrito with lamb, both of which were very very tasty (although I feel their samosas could have benefited from more of the fried samosa skin, since I ran out of those fairly early on, with plenty of filling to spare).\
author: Johnny W.

description:
Deconstructed Samosa with Chana (samosa topped with chana - curried garbanzo beans - and sweet tamarind, sour cilantro, mint chutneys, and a garnish of onions, jalapenos, cilantro and mint) - Yum! Legitimately spicy. Loved the soggy/ mushy broken down samosa, still with some nice crunchy parts.

Paneer Tikka Masala Burritos (paneer tikka masala, onion pulao, sweet tamarind, sour cilantro, mint chutneys, jalapeno) - Very delicious. Wrapped nice and tight so no messes.
author: Ziyan C.

description:
I hired the Curry Up Now Food Truck to come out to my wedding. The first person I was in touch with was Blake, and he was pretty much non-communicative throughout the booking process. I sent several emails and never received any response. My frustration prompted me to hand over the responsibility of confirmation to my wedding coordinator. She contacted Blake several times to no avail. We just wanted to pay Curry Up Now and be certain they would show up at my wedding venue promptly at 5 pm. 

After receiving no response from our initial contact, my coordinator reached out to someone else who worked for Curry Up Now. Rana, was prompt with her responses and immediately send over confirmation and invoices. Wonderful.

The day of my wedding the Curry Up Now Food Truck was almost an hour late. My coordinator was frantically calling and trying to figure out where the truck was?? She had a lot of difficulty getting someone on the phone. Apparently, the truck was lost or went to the wrong venue. My guests were starving!! Once the truck arrived it took them a while to set up, so all in all my guests ate almost 1 1/2 hours late. Bum Out. 

On the brighter side, the servers in the truck were very nice. The food was delicious. We had mini tika masala burritos, sexy fries and samosas. They offered vegan and gluten free options as well. My guests liked the food a lot and we were sent home with about 10 burritos that were extra. 

Curry Up Now, I think if you plan on continuing wedding catering you need to tighten up the game a bit. Weddings have fairly strict timelines and being as late as you were definitely threw a bit of a wrench in our plans. Also, make sure you have your point people be less like Blake and more like Rana.
author: Amanda S.

description: I wanted to like this place. It was wholly mediocre, I'm afraid. Food was dry and not super fresh. I had the naughty naan vegetarian option and my friend had the fries. Both were meh.
author: Sandy G.

description:
Take it easy on the salt!!!

Just ate there for dinner and now feel dried out, bloated and have acid reflux after eating here.

No reason to cook with this much salt.
author: Laurence S.

description: Today was my first time trying Curry Up Now and my coworkers took me to the truck on Bush St. When we got there the line wasn't terrible but it built up really quickly. I ordered the chicken tikka masala bowl, a samosa and one of their ginger mint lemonades. ALL of it was AMAZING! I'm just starting to get into Indian food and there was just the right amount of spice in the sauce, the rice was great, the samosa was SO GOOD. If you want just a snack, get the samosa - it even comes with a sweetish side sauce. The ginger mint lemonade was also nice - not too sour or sweet and there was real ginger in the bottom. Best part is I waited less than a minute to get my food, negative is that it was almost $16 for all of this. But, five stars!
author: Our Forks In The Road ..

description:
(See pics) Updated review. With all the food trucks I have tried so far, Curry Up Now is an excellent choice for its quality and quantity. For $10, the pork belly burrito was so much food even for lunch and dinner.

The long grain rice was flavorful but be careful of the small bones inside the burrito.

The meat was a bit on the fatty (the belly, of course) and it was more on the sauteed and not grilled crisp.

And as similar to many other trucks, the food was on the saltier side.

The mango lassi was also pretty good.
author: T L.

description: No entirely legit Indian food. A little too fusion for my liking. Portions were good. Curries were decently spicy. I expected more food for a thali though. The rice didn't quite sit well with me.
author: Han Teng W.

description:
Came to this place because a friend wanted to try it. I saw the yelp reviews..755 reviews and 4 stars..gotta be bomb.com

I looked through all the reviews and everyone is raving about the CTM Burrtio. I was like DOWN!!. I got it with the "hot" (eerrrrr not so hot at all) on a wheat tortilla. First mistake was it was on flour..mehh already walked back to work I would just have to make due. The burrito was extremely flavorful. Chunks AKA Boulders of chicken breast mixed in with a great sauce and rice. The beans were also good. But I must say I was very dissapointed with the heat aspect. I dont like EXTREME spicy food but I do like it with a kick. There was no kick at all and that really cramped my style of this burrito. Maybe next time I will go up to the top level
author: Johnny G.

description:
I was beyond happy after learning their truck was in SF for the day.  I told my coworker and together we made our advance orders online for pick up at noon.

At the truck, the line was long with people waiting to order. We thought "HAHA suckers" as we walked to the short line for pick up. But the joke was on us. We waited a good 15 minutes before finally getting our order. And that only happened because we got tired of waiting and practically screamed at one of the guys to give us our order. 

TIP#1: be aggressive! Go up to the window and yell for their attention. They're super busy. Don't expect them to come to you like we did.  

Chicken Tikka Masala burrito. What a disappointment! It had great tikka masala flavor, but it was terribly dry. The tortilla was soggy as if it was sitting for a long while. We both ordered our burritos with medium spiciness, which was the less spicy option. But our mouths burned from the intense heat. I gave up after half of the burrito. 

TIP#2: get the yogurt from the condiment section. Lots of it!
author: Marti L.

description:
Ordinarily, Indian food puts me in a mood of great tranquility and peace as the lovely mix of spices remind me of my East African roots where Indian spices are items of necessity. This past Friday at the South San Francisco food fest off of Gateway Blvd I was disappointed by Curry Up Now's Chicken Tikka Masala Burrito. 

Price : 

I have contended that SF foodies have to pay more for food so the $8.50 for the burrito wasn't a biggie for me. 

Service: 

I am automatically suspicious when my food is ready in less than 2 minutes from a food truck especially a food truck with a long line to boot. I am all about speedy service but you can't tell me it took you 2 mins to create your burritos. That being said, we know now they are pre-made and not that warm upon receiving your food. 

Food: 

The chicken used is dark meat. I know dark meat tends to retain spices and tenderness better but I am not a fan. The chicken was cut in huge chunks so when biting into your burrito you practically are choking on the sizes of the chicken within the burrito. In addition, curry sauce is made with a multitude of spices including a bay leaf but should be taken out of the stew prior to serving!!! Can someone please tell me why I bit into a whole bay leaf in my burrito? Last time, I checked I wasn't a herbivore so wtf Curry Up Now?! I shouldn't feel as though my food is a mystery every time I bite in or worry if I'll choke on the chunks of meat someone was too lazy to cut into smaller chunks. 

I suggest threading with caution whenever ordering from curry up now.
author: Ramla J.

description:
Holy crap! When they say "spicy", they really mean it! 

If you have any kind of office job where people will make fun of you for sweating like a swine once you tear into one of their Chicken Tikka Masala burritos, I highly suggest you either eat in private. Or at the very least, have a tall glass of milk at your beckon call!

Besides the 3 pounds I just lost in water weight from heat-induced perspiration, the burrito was fantastic! It's such a novel concept to wrap some homemade Indian food in a Mexican flour tortilla and serve it up on-the-go styleeee... you'd think someone would have come along and thought of it sooner. Stoked they decided to set up shop just minutes from my office around the Financial District!
author: Ruggy J.

description: My goto place to grab Indian lunch during weekdays. I always get the same chicken tikka masala burrito or bowl with rice(spicy). The tikka sauce and the channa tastes authentic and not just another Indian look alike fast food in SF. Burrito is equally good. The desi hot spice is really really spicy so beware. Although their spice level is very inconsistent and sometimes I get very mild even though I ask for spicy. My friend once ate deconstructed samosa and heard it was good too. Line becomes very long during lunch time, so either go early or very late to skip the crowd. They have limited menu (which i like).
author: Nirmal D.

description:
I don't know, I've been here two times and still am not impressed. Tried to the bowl the first time and then the burrito the second. 

Their hotsauce is CRAZY SPICY!! I think they said they use ghost peppers. I asked for it slightly spicy and was still crying and I'm pretty good at handling spice.

I think curries and naan are more enjoyable.. but this is better if you're on the go I suppose.
author: Angela L.

description:
I love their burritos and deconstructed samosa -- it's very flavorful, and the "spicy" is really pretty spicy. I'm vegetarian and love their paneer tikka masala. They messed up my order once (which was sad since I don't eat meat), but I've been a regular and they only did so once.

Despite the excellent food, I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5 because the price is so-so and the lines are long, unless you come off-hours (it's reasonable at 1 pm, not so much at noon).

As far as their occasional specials, the Naan was great (I love the onions), but the cauliflower wasn't the most special. The fries are relatively greasy; if you want a bunch more calories, I'd suggest ordering the side of fries rather than the dish, since the tikka masala sauce tends to make them soggy. The samosas and mango lassi are decent but nothing special.

Anyway, I hope they get another storefront in the same location, so they can serve their large-ish crowds faster.
author: Gatoatigrado A.

description:
Another one of my favorite lunch spots to hit up in FiDi. I like how it's basically an Indian Fusion spot and they have a unique twist on traditional Indian food. The line can get kinda long during lunch but the wait for your food isn't too bad.

 I'm not very adventurous so when I had the Chicken Tikka Masala Sexy Fries for the first time, I loved them and have been too scared to try anything else out of fear of disappointment. They give a good amount of chicken and fries. The portion size is good for lunch. I have a low spiciness tolerance and these are a tad spicy so I need to make sure to have a drink nearby. You also have to make sure to eat kind of fast since the fries get pretty soggy soaking in the sauce. I try not to eat this in the office as the smell can be kind of strong.

Overall a solid FiDi lunch spot and I'll definitely be back.
author: Tiffany S.

description:
During my first trip here I had their Chicken Burrito and this time I opted for a different item - the Deconstructed Samosa.  This was great actually...it arrived almost like a thick stew, filled with vegetables, meat and small "samosa" dumplings.  This was a creative and tasty dish.  

This place is definitely worth visiting if you're in the FiDi area for lunch.
author: Ken G.

description:
First time trying Curry Up Now was at Off The Grid - Alameda. I remember reading something and it mentioned Curry Up Now, so I decided to try it. 

I wasn't sure what to get so I just guessed. I ordered sexy fries and deconstructed samosa. 

I had the deconstructed samosa with beef. It has garbanzo beans which I picked out since it's not my favorite thing to eat in the world. It had 4 triangular shaped samosas. Together with the chutney it was delicious, even though my boyfriend didn't like it much. 

I love their "sexy fries" (awesome name), but it's far from being sexy. The criss cut fries with carne & topped with onions and cheese was yummy goodness! It tasted like chili cheese fries. 

I'm not fond of many Indian foods but this caught my taste buds!
author: Karla Marie D.

description:
Tried the Kathi Roll at the SF StEAT food Park. The pratha bread layered with egg and filled with chicken curry. It was delicious but even more so with the super spicy ghost chili sauce!
The guys are very nice..I am definitely going to track them down for another visit.
author: Mimi T.

description:
I think this city just likes stuff turned into a burrito, but this wasn't that good. (Paneer Tikka Masala burrito)

Flavors are somewhat one-note, or, rather, it's clear the burrito is made without any attention to what an indian food palate ought to taste like.

It's heavy but bland, and altogether unimpressive. Many places do Indian-style burritos better elsewhere, outside of SF. They may not be as hip or glamorous but they're just better.
author: Joe S.

description:
Wish I could be "a fan" but it was almost inevitable that I wouldn't be considering that I can't really eat spicy food.  However, this fact doesn't always communicate with my taste buds.  I always want to try everything just to say that I have, and Curry Up Now was no exception.

We ordered the Tikka Masala Burrito and the Veggie Samosa at the 2010 Eat Real Festival.  I have no idea what either of these things are so I thank the person taking our order for being extremely patient with us.

They were both delicious!  I like the burrito better than the samosa, but both were just too spicy for me to finish.  So I reluctantly handed them off to be devoured by another.    Oh, and if their food isn't spicy enough for you, they have even more hot sauces for you to add to your order.
author: Ninja H.

description:
Soooo, I got the Tiki Masala Burrito for lunch yesterday.
I love curry but to be honest, my stomach just wasnt the same for hours after.

I  think I need my curry to be over rice or something, but this burrito is no joke. Definately for the stong willed stomachs for sures. 
Lots of onions in it too, maybe too much. 

Sorry, but I wont be going here again.
There are plenty of food trucks that I can go to where I'm not hating myself for hours after :x
author: Cicely T.

description:
This place is awesome.  Food truck deliciousness now available in your local neighborhood.  

I'm very bullish on their Chicken Tikka Masala Burrito (CTM) but I have to admit their kathi rolls are really delicious and probably don't get the love they should.

Pro tip: if you want to really spice things up ask for some of their HOT sauce on the side.  It is very spicy. 

 Only real dig on this food is there are not a lot of really "healthy" options.
author: Mike I.

description: Raw grated crunchy potatoes in samosas, really .  I mean if u are too lazy to boil potatoes then dont serve samosa.
author: Shivani S.

description:
This one of my favorite food trucks in SF, coming second to only Senor Sisig. 

CTM Burrito - Chicken Tikka Masala. My staple/go-to option whenever I frequent this truck. It's a heavenly concoction of protein and carbs, oozing with delicious curry goodness. If you're looking for a proper food coma, this baby sized burrito is the one for you. 

Sexy fries - CTM on top of sweet potato crisscut fries. omfg. It almost made me kiss a random old Indian lady walking down the street. It's that good. And that sexy. 

Samosa - SOLID. 

Bring a pair of extra underwear after eating at this place. It's so good you might soil yourself. Just kidding! 

But seriously though.. bring a pair just in case.
author: Eduardo R.

description: Where the curry do I begin? I just hopped on the whole food truck thing and I love it! I ordered the chix burrito and ate it for lunch/snack/dinner for only $8. The food was super hot and fresh. The line was kinda long because everyone must know this truck is the hot spot for lunch break. The man working at the window was very nice and friendly. I mean, I would be too if my pockets were loaded from my food truck business.  Annnnnnd they accept plastic!
author: Court S.

description:
I love the plum chutney that comes with the samosas. I always ask for more so I can put it on my chicken tikki masala  burrito. These burritos are really filling so I usually split it with someone else or take it home. 

The staff are really nice but my only complaint is that they tend to mess up orders. My burritos came out late because it was put under to go while we are dining in. Luckily it's not a big deal but if I was in a rush I would be mad.
author: Ashley N.

description: Very good Indian food, only problem is long queues and waiting time. If you have good amount of time, and hungry for indian food, this place worth a try.
author: Kash S.

description: There is usually a line to Curry Up Now (food truck) but it's totally worth the wait. The person who took my order recommended the Chicken Tikka Masala (CTM) Burrito. This FAR exceeded my expectations! I like how unexpectedly SPICY this burrito is. The chicken is tender and fresh, though I didn't like how big the chunks were. The stuffing inside the burrito is of generous proportions so it definitely hit the spot. Hooray for food trucks!
author: Stefanie C.

description: Never disappoints! Tikka masala burrito + sexy fries with a friend or plus one is always a good time.
author: Will K.

description:
I've been wanting to try this truck for the longest time and decided that today would be the day to do so. When I found out that Curry Up Now was on the OrderAheadApp I was thrilled! I thought, "Awesome! Now I can order lunch for myself and the office and NOT have to wait in that crazy long line.. done deal." So, I placed my order at 10:10am for (6) chicken masala burritos, a free range chicken plate, (2) sexy  fries and a mango lassi for pick-up at 11:40am. I figured well over an hour and a half before the FiDi lunch rush would be ample time for that size of an order, right?

Wrong. 

I showed up at 11:45am and proceeded to the window to pick up the order and this is basically how it went down-

Me: "Hi, I'm here to pick up my OrderAhead order, under the name Cara"

Guy Behind Counter: "Oh.. I haven't even checked my phone at all today (takes his phone out and opens up the app). Let me just check something, hang on a sec"

Me: ..........Okay........ (at this point, it was pretty evident that he was just now seeing my order for the first time)

GBC: "Ohh.. Cara. Okay, here's your order... Okay, it'll be just a few minutes. It's pretty slow right now so it shouldn't take too long".

Me: "..........Okay.... No worries, I can wait, thanks."

5 minutes later...

GBC: "Ohhhh.. actually we're all out of fries, so we can't make any of the sexy fries. How about we give you some Samosa's instead?"

Me: "Oh, okay.. that should be fine, thank you."

15 minutes go by.........

GBC: "Here's your order.. Sorry, we ran out of Samosa's too, but here's $8 back". He frantically walks away and begins to help the rest of the folks in line. Um, yeah thanks guy. 

First off- if you're not going to check your online ordering app DAILY, then what's the point of even offering such a feature? "You haven't checked you phone all day"? More like, you're not doing you're damn job at all. I placed my order well in advanced and still had to wait another 20 minutes for my order; it completely defeated the whole purpose of "ordering ahead".  

Secondly- everything was sloppily put together and not very appealing to the eye. A burrito should be neatly and tightly wrapped, not falling apart inside of the bag. I received a sad soggy container full of greasy paneer masala (sans fries) since they were out of fries. 

Third- if you're going to attempt any sort of apology for YOUR screw up, at least offer a better incentive rather than throwing a sad $8 my way. 

I really wanted to like this truck, since so many people have nothing but great things to say about their food, but unfortunately, this first experience may very well be my last. If it's not the product itself that will dissuade me from going back somewhere, it's the service and sad to say, this particular truck in the FiDi is lacking in so many ways.
author: Cara C.

description:
"Chicken Tikka Masala burritos! Why? What? OMG. DELICIOUS. SPICY GOODNESS." - What happened in my brain when eating at Curry Up Now at Off The Grid.

I'm also a fan of their Samosas, although not as crispy on the outside as I would have liked. Flavor on the inside is lovely and creamy - as all Samosas should be. I recommend pairing your meal with Topo Chico, Mexican Coke or Dublin Dr. Pepper to cut the spice (if you aren't a fan of the spicy).
author: Tara H.

description:
A long time coming is this review. I first discovered Curry Up Now Truck at SF's Off the Grid event Ft Mason in 2010 I believe. What got me going was that my love for SF Burritos and Samosa Chat had finally collided in the perfect blend of mischievous decadence. The Decon Samosa Burrito was born and I could not get enough! Jesus, it's flawless. You get the crunch, savory sensations, perfectly chutney'd the fuck down, chickpea champion flavor that I'm craving as I type this. Man do I miss it!  I can't even imagine asking for this in LA. Who does this sorta' thing here? Either way, I would seek this truck out on a regular, they even respond on twitter cause they're cool AF.   Service with a smile and delicious as all hell. What more can I say?
Thanks for the memories folks. Sorry I didn't review sooner.
CV-
author: Persnickety P.

description:
UGH! Every time. Every single time. I think about this place my mind begins to wonder and I drool. 

The chicken tikka masala burrito is just o my goodness gracious amazing. Its a burrito. Its chicken tikka masala. Wow. Why couldnt I have thought of this??? 

Its golden. Pure food gold.
author: Michelle I.

description:
I have stop by this Indian-Mexican fusion restaurant twice now and the one thing that stands out is the wait. I usually don't mind waiting for some delicious food, but that line felt ridiculous considering most people only ordered a burrito.

The menu consists of typical Indian fare (chicken/paneer tikka masala) in burrito form. They have some interesting dishes like the naughty naan or the sexy fries. I love chicken tikka masala, so of course I had to get the burrito.

Since I decided the moment I got in line, all I had to do was wait. The line was pretty long (about 15 people ahead), but nothing compared the lines at Chipotle or Sushirrito. 30 minutes I finally got to order. The people in front got their burrito  within minutes of ordering so I knew mine would come out any second. Well 5 minutes went by. Ten burritos were made, but none of the ten people waiting got called. Those ten burritos were just put in a bag and set aside. Did people call in for to-go? Or was it catering? If it is, it seems a little unfair for the people waiting 30+ mins in line to get their food after.

By the time I got my burrito 45 minutes of my lunch break had past. As soon as I got my burrito, I sunk my teeth in and I have say it was very tasty. 4 stars alone just for the burrito, but if the wait is this long every time it is not worth it.
author: David C.

description: Delish. One thing I can't figure out is: is there supposed to be a samosa inside the CTM burrito? It's happened to me twice, but I guess it's nothing to complain about :)!
author: Lauren D.

description:
Punjabi by Nature burrito with chicken.  Done.  I'm hooked! 

This concept is truly brilliant.  Who would've thought putting curry into a burrito would be such a genius idea!?  No wonder people are always patiently lined up here - rain or shine.  Their curry is fully charged with spices and deliciousness, and I promise after one bite, you're not going to want to eat anything else but this.  I find myself craving Curry Up at work, on the Bart, at home, after a long night of drinking (wow, if only they were there during the wee hours), etc.  

Try their Deconstructed Samosa.  It's not as filling as the burrito, but still quite filling for its size.     

Great, I just made myself extremely hungry....
author: Cecilia S.

description: Food truck Thursday on Haight street! The Thali Combo Plata with LAMB Tikka Masala was soo good. I love me some lamba tikka masala and they delivered! Wish it came with more naan!
author: Mallerie V.

description:
Some colleagues recommended this place and they were absolutely right when they said it's delicious.

Service is fast and friendly although they only accepted cash. No idea if that was a temporary thing, but you should get a burrito here anyway.

I had the Chicken Tikka Masala burrito and it was amazing! I like spicy food but only went for medium so I could try it out first. They have hot sauce on the side so you can get that as well.
The medium ended up being pretty spicy and it might be a little too much for some people but it was just right for me.

They're pretty cheap too so that's a plus. Enjoy!
author: Thomas D.

description:
A little westernized rendition of indian food -- and by that I mean there's plenty of sugar in lots of dishes with the spice level turned down.

I'd have to say some excellent food though. Chicken curry burritos are especially tasty!
author: J S.

description:
Just ordered a chicken tikka burrito and some paneer sexy fries from here via Postmates.  Happy to report that everything is as good as the first curry up now truck I tried years ago.  Great quality across the board. 

*Now a minor complaint that I won't put against their review because I get it.  I ordered everything "desi hot" per their menu.  The heat just didn't deliver like it did the last time I got this option at one of their food trucks.  They once mentioned that some people will order this and then demand their money back because it was actually properly spicy.  Hopefully they've not toned down this option to appease these people.

Either way, the food here is fantastic and you're doing yourself a disservice if you've not tried it.
author: Joshua W.

description: Awesome chicken Kathi roll. I can tell its a very authentic Indian taste, unlike other 'SF tailored' indian restaurants or take aways. Keep an eye on the packing though, it can drip oil so ask for double packing. No place to sit nearby so best predecide where to eat this.
author: Zaki S.

description:
Where to eat today?  checking website for schedule @ http://www.curryupnow.com

It's here...

The food truck is usually on Bush Street near Sansome. You can spot the distinctive yellow and red painted wonder wheels with a line averaging one-dozen peeps long.

Highly-efficient operation with folks who know how to crank out the food quickly.

Quality? oh yes!

Chicken Tikka Masala (or commonly referred as CTM) Burrito had great Indian/Mex flavors...creamy sauce mixed with the rice and beans. The chicken breast was quite plentiful and came in chunks. I woofed it down so fast.

Mango Lassi - not bad...sweet and creamy.

The dilemma of being a sales rep with no headquarter office is that if you frequent a foodie truck, finding a spot to chow down needs creativity.  There is a fountain spot off bush/battery (?) with benches, but comes with a lot of homeless - no thanks.  I could eat atop the various newspaper bins - kinda ghetto. My car? Naah, that's no fun. I decided to pre-burn some of this food off by walking six blocks to the union square "quad". Ice skating rink up...lots of pigeons hovering around my burrito. Eerily feels like Hitchcock "The Birds"...Don't eat the chicken bits.

Sorry for my yelp app draft rambling...These...food cart folks shows how it's done

Next time:  it's the sexy fries and the DC samosas
author: Derek N.

description: If someone takes the time to order online they should be able to walk up to the window and pick up that order without having to reorder the item. When I re-ordered I had to re-order twice. Then when I got my food they made it spicy. Now I don't mind spicy, however, this was so spicy I could not eat it. I would feel bad feeding this to someone that I hated because it was that spicy. I feel like they tried to punish me for their mistake by how spicy the food was. Overall the flavor was good if you could get past the feeling of death from the hot sauce.
author: Ashley E.

description: That deconstructed somosa was amazballs!!! Great friendly service and such good food!! Totally worth the wait!!! Keep it up yall!
author: Brent C.

description:
Awesome, delicious Indian food...not exactly traditional, but oh-so-yummy!  We saw them at the Pleasanton Food Truck festival over the weekend.  Service was fast, prices are reasonable, and food is hot and delicious.  We were quite surprised that there was hardly any line.  Maybe that represents how efficient they are.

We tried the deconstructed chicken samosa.  It came in a small box, but it was a generous amount of tender garbanzo beans, samosa wrapper, savory meat, and peppers.  I'm a fan of garbanzos...and these were among the tastiest I've ever had.  Super tender and creamy.  Nothing like the stuff out of cans.  I loved the combination of Indian spices.  The hotness level was a tad intense for this spicy wimp, but I'm sure most people would find it acceptable.

The other thing we ordered was a ground beef keema.  The savory flavors of the ground beef and Indian spices played well together.  The intensely meaty juices were kept in check by the egg-based wrapper.  It was sort of like eating an omelette burrito. It warmed my belly on a cold Pleasanton night.

This food truck beats out the other Indian food trucks we've tried.  Even better than a lot of sit-down Indian restaurants.  I highly recommend you to Curry Up Now!
author: Kari C.

description:
3.5  Stars

Got it at Off The Grid.

I was debating whether to get the paneer tikka masala or the chicken tikka masala, but the cashier suggested chicken since it was the most popular. I got the mild, since I've read some of the reviews that spicy is quite HOT. 

Well, the mild is quite spicy too. I did not expect it to be too spicy since it was mild. It's bearable for me, but I would have enjoyed it more if the spiciness was a bit toned down. I think they should have their mild lower in spicy since some people can't take the heat. 

I think I'll get the paneer one next time. Hopefully the cheese will balance out the spiciness.
author: Mandy D.

description: paneer burrito was good.  but the SEXY FRIES.  NOMZ!!  The Gulab Jamuns are basically friend donut holes with glaze...meh.  But the Ras Malai, a sort of sweet cheese like....somewhere between cream cheese and ricotta?  texture is firm, and delishly paired with the kulfi ice cream.  Chai is aight.
author: Zachary S.

description:
Not my favorite indian fusion food truck, but they are not bad. They were one of the first indian fusion trucks around. Their best dishes are probably chicken tikka masala burrito and sexy fries. The first few times i had it i loved it, and if you didn't have it yet its worth it.  I find myself going to other trucks now instead of this though, as its good to have a few times, but then it gets boring, the taste doesn't have me coming back for more. Although i would go and get their sexy fries and get sometime else for the other  food trucks. 

But if you havent had the CTM burrito, try it out, you won't be disappointed, until you get tired of it.
author: Anuj C.

description:
Some trip it was. Got to see this food truck at makerfaire in San Mateo. One of the best food truck I hv had my meal at is in Tucson. Nothing has come even close. Bland chicken tikka burrito, literally no taste at all. It's good they serve 1 samosa for $2.50, else I would have thrown the other one. The stuffing was below par but for one who has tasted original samosas from India this one was a disappointment. It cannot be that difficult, more than a billion people make it and eat it.
Indian food is all about taste. There are only a handful of restaurants/food trucks that have realized it.
Will not recommend.
author: Milind K.

description:
The Indian burrito concept is a stellar one, but not everyone can do it right. Sometimes the curry is too runny, and sometimes it's too much spice or goop to be in a burrito.

Curry Up Now gets the mixture just right and gets a good mix of creamy tikka sauce, spicy sauce and and scrumptious bites of chicken. To top it off the sexy fries (waffle fries with chicken tikka masala on top) is just delectable.
author: Milan T.

description:
Since the first time I went to Curry Up Now I had wanted to try their Sexy Fries. Every time I tired to order them they were sold out! 

Finally a couple of weeks ago at Off the Grid Hayes Valley I was able to try the Sexy Fries. I ordered them with chicken tikka masala. They were amazing. The criss cut fries were perfectly cooked and crispy. The chicken was super spicy, tender, and delicious. My only grip is that the cheese on top didn't completely melt, but it definitely didn't ruin the dish.
author: Stephanie T.

description: There is often a long line. The chicken tikka masala burrito spicy is good. It is very spicy. The Naughty Naan is very messy. Go when it opens to avoid the line.
author: Karl K.

description:
I've been here twice in about the past 5 years (or however long this cart has been there). I had the Chicken Tikka Masala Burrito and it was decent.  Not anything special, but I enjoyed it. Let's put it this way, I work 2 blocks front this place and didn't feel the need to eat there again until yesterday. 
Yesterday I go at 1:30. Still a pretty long line. We wait 15 minutes and the guy makes an announcement: "we only have the beef and (something else)" then there's a bit of a pause, then he announces "(something something) chicken!"  To my friend and me, it was unclear if they had chicken or didn't have chicken. So I wait 5 more minutes and I'm up to order. I order the Chicken Burrito and he leans out the window, cocks his head to the crowd and shouts, "We are all out of the chicken!!!" and turns his head back to me with a shit eating grin. It was a real passive aggressive, shitty move and it was his fault because of the disjointed way he announce what food they no longer had to serve. I'm sure it's frustrating when customers don't hear your announcements, but don't shout through them and try to embarrass them.  Completely unacceptable.
author: John S.

description:
I like the food here, but I am not going to go back.

The first time I had a deconstructed burrito, it immediately became one of my favorite things ever!  The mini-samosas were probably my favorite part, but this was tasty and filling and a pretty decent deal for $6.

However,  the next time I came back (Admittedly later in the afternoon than the first time), it was not as good as my outer samosa was soggy straight from the truck.

So I got a tikka masala burrito the next time, specifying that I did not want onions (it said so one the ticket even).  When I got back to my office to eat the burrito, I found it chock-full of onions.  I let them know via twitter but did not get any real response.  What if I had been allergic?

That was all from the Bush St food truck.  More recently, my office ordered some food from the truck off Mission St.  I enjoyed my deconstructed samosa quite a bit, even though their fryer was down so it had no mini-samosas.  My enjoyment of the meal quickly subsided a few hours later when I threw it all up and spent most of the afternoon in the bathroom.  I"m pretty sure I got Staphylococcus aureus, which is food poisoning that occurs when food has been left out for a while and comes on very quickly.  

3 strikes and an out!
author: Tmon B.

description:
The Chicken Marsala burrito was so spicy and wet that not only was it hard to eat in the Off The Grid setting, but it burned the living daylights out of my mouth. My boyfriend and I both paid dearly for this little adventure the next day, with digestive issues. We ended up throwing away half the burrito, so it was pretty much a waste of money. 

The same Chicken Marsala on the Sexy Fries did not seem as hot and was palatable as well as easier to eat. I think they gave us an extra spicy burrito, when I clearly asked for the least spicy option.  Not to mention we ordered the beef on the fries, our order was lost somehow and then we ended up with chicken on both. 

Needless to say we won't be returning.
author: Kathy M.

description:
Lost, hungry and alone, a certain art student found himself wandering the busy streets of Montgomery. It was then when an obnoxiously bright orange and purple food truck appeared under a veil of light on the other side of the street, surrounded by a crowd of scary elitist white people. 

JK. Anyways, Curry Up Now is a fine example of fusion food done right. Never  saw or even heard of the truck before; I just saw the crazy line of people waiting. It can't be horrible if there is that many people, right?

You might want to stop by early to avoid the lunch rush. I ordered the chicken tikka masala burrito, and it was freaking delicious. I don't consider myself an expert on Indian food, but I am an expert on what tastes good. The chicken bits were tender and well proportioned. The onions had a delightful crunch. The chick peas almost had a lovely potato-esque texture. And the sauce...oh the sauce. It is quite spicy, but rich in flavor. The tortilla itself was perfectly chewy as well. 

Only thing was that the wait was a little jarring. Plus some of the orders were given out of order, which definitely annoyed a number of customers, including myself. But it was ultimately worth it. Just be sure to have some water with you for that fiery masala! Muy caliente!
author: Kero D.

description:
7x7! I'm on a roll, speaking of roll (awkward transition to...)

Burritos! Let's specifically talk about those fusion burritos. Curry Up Now serves this thing called a Chicken Tikka Masala burrito. It is delicious! I love the spicy sauce, yum yum yum. All that goodness wrapped up, without ever needing a utensil. It's 8 dollars, and they accept credit card--which is totally awesome for a food truck. You instantly get your burrito when you order, so that's awesome. My friend ordered the Sexy Fries, and mmmhmm they looked enticing. Maybe next time.

Tip #1: you might want to order ahead of time because the line is long!
Tip #2: bring a drink/water or buy at the truck. Although I was totally fine with the spiciness, my friend was sweating from the heat, yowza!
author: Vera W.

description:
Food trucks are so convenient when you need a quick bite to eat!! Been back to this spot a couple of times stuffing my face with either butter chicken or chicken tiki masala. Good sized portion, heavy weighted burritos for less than $10. There burritos will not disappoint - the spice level will definitely kick you in the mouth on the first bite! Nice surprise....sorta.

I don't even want to know how much calories these things have! Good stuff nonetheless! I'll be back!
author: Diana M.

description:
Gone are the days where I worked directly across the street from where Curry Up Now parked itself at Bush and Sansome. I miss peering off the building's balcony to see if the truck arrived and being one of the first in line. Now that I'm back in the South Bay, it's too bad that CUN is a rarity in the South Bay. But when this beautiful yellow food truck does roll into San Jose, at least there aren't 45-minute lunch waits like there are in the FiDi.

Here's the breakdown...

- Tikka masala burrito: The chicken in the chicken TMB is too dry for my liking and the onions have that raw onion taste because they're are cut a tad too big and/or not cooked long enough. For those reasons, I always go for the paneer TMB. The TMB is way better than some non-Indian burritos out there. Solid.

- Deconstructed samosa: Almost as big as a baby's head. Serious.

- Sexy fries: Criss-cut sweet potato fries lovingly smothered with your choice of chicken or paneer tikka masala, then sprinkled with melted shredded cheese. What a way to one-up chili cheese fries. Damn.

- Mango lassi: I'm no lassi expert so I can't comment on it's authenticity or whether it's the best lassi ever. I will say that the mango lassi pairs is a great counterpart to the spices found in the food. Mmm.

C U sooN, CUN!
author: Sylvia D.

description: tikka masala burrito was the number one lunch option when I worked in Civic Center. Fast and delicious food.
author: Rose S.

description: I ordered from this food-truck yesterday at Off the Grid in Concord. I ordered a Chicken Tikka Masala Burrito for $8.50 and two Samosas for $4. The woman who tookd my order was very friendly and professional. The food was put in to-go containers without me having to ask which was nice. I took my food straight home and dug in. The burrito was so tasty and the flavors were so distinctive. The samosas were so big and heavenly (that's what she said!). The two different types of chutneys that came with the samosas were great. I can't wait for this truck to be on the Concord's Off the Grid schedule again. I am excited to try the Sexy Fries next time!
author: Kristin A.

description:
I've only experienced Curry Up Now at events such as Off The Grid and Eat Real Fest, but it's the one truck I would recommend to everyone. I've tried other Indian food trucks and none can compare. I'm so glad they opened an actual shop in San Mateo and hope they continue to expand throughout the community. The world needs more burritos.

I always end up ordering the same thing every time: chicken tikka masala burrito. One of my favorite Indian foods wrapped up in a warm flour tortilla? Jackpot! It's quite a massive wrap for $6 and will surely fill you up. This baby packs some heat, so I have a tendency to douse a LOT of yogurt sauce on it to kill the spice. There's a lot of other great options on the menu, but I can't seem to step away from the burrito. One of these days, I'll have to try to deconstructed samosas, but for now, the chicken tikka masala burrito will have to suffice as my staple item from this delicious food truck.
author: Michelle W.

description: I had the Curry Up Now Tikki Masala burrito the other day. I had to take a double take at my food. It sure didn't taste like tikki masala! I don't know, I feel like the quality has suffered. I also had the samosa. It was good but not spectacular. I know I had Curry Up Now about 3 years ago and I remember it being better but now I just don't see a reason to return.
author: Judith G.

description:
I've been here twice now and I'll definitely be back. Being Indian myself, I appreciate a good fusion of Indian food with convenient packaging (in burritos, bowls, etc.)

I had the CTM burrito the first time, and ordered it spicy. It was definitely spicy. A hell of a kick to it, but the filling was definitely delicious. It was a little wet and tended to fall out of the roti but scooping it up afterwards was a delight.

I just had the deconstructed samosa with chicken and it was delicious. I love samosas and adding the tamarind, raita, and mint chutneys on top was amazing and delicious. 

I can't wait until my parents get here, so I can take them to Curry Up Now and then tell them to make me stuff like that at home.

PS - Make sure you get the chutneys and raita! Ask for them afterwards. They have at least 4 kinds: raita (yogurt), mint chutney, tamarind chutney, and a spicy (SPICY) chutney similar to sriracha. If you add all 4 you will achieve epic Indian-ness.
author: Ankit G.

description:
I love the food here, tried in san mateo and SF foodtruck. Spicy and yummy. Eat here when you want to chuck the rules and enjoy, the food is a bit greasy. I have tried
1. Samosas -- Average
2. Deconstructed samosa -- Superb
3. sexy fries
author: Vinoothna G.

description:
Chicken masala burrito. 

Perfectly seasoned...perfect rice to masala ratio. Just pure orgasmic. :) it had a nice kick of spice. Its just genius. Try it...you wont be disappointed.  One burrito was enough for two.  I havnt tried anything else but you can definitely smell the spices. Ill be coming back to try the rest. 

Btw they do take credit cards.
author: Kim T.

description:
Love this place - it's a great treat in the financial district.

My reco: Chicken Tikka Masala Burrito NAKED style, i.e. no Tortilla.

Be warned - you will be full and the rest of your day but be slow due to your food coma.

Tip: you can order online or via their iPhone app to avoid the lines!
author: Michelle K.

description: Not sure if it's because they are concentrating on their restaurants or just expanded too much, but the food at the trucks has gone downhill. Yesterday I got the Thali with Gobi. The Gobi was over-cooked & the Tikka Masala sauce was bland & watery. Surprising because their curries used to pack a big flavor punch. I threw most of the meal away. No quality control on the trucks anymore. Very disappointing.
author: Wan T.

description: Curry Up Now created the most awesome fusion burrito that I have ever had. Their chicken tikka masala burrito is PHENOMENAL, with the density of a ginormous Chipotle burrito (potentially larger) and the flare of a north Indian curry. I can't think of anything more delightful than sinking your teeth into one and letting the flavors flood your taste buds. I make it an order for my friends to try it whenever we are at Off-the-Grid. It's delicious! Although it is not Halal Truck of the NYC, their chicken tikka masala has a special heart in all of San Francisconians ;)
author: Jenny Z.

description:
Really good modern Indian food!

I'm pretty new to the food truck scene, modern at least, so I've been missing out on a lot of good food. I hit up this particular truck outside of ATT Park at an Off The Grid event. I wasn't expecting to try this truck, but the look of the truck attracted me.

Some of the big choices on the menu were between the burritos and the Sexy Fries. The name alone of sexy fries was really appealing, so I went for it. Being a natural carnivore, I naturally went for the CTM (the chicken one lol). When I got them, came in a standard food truck looking to-go box. When I opened the box, the goody goodness came.

The CTM Sexy Fries are actually waffle fries covered in curry sauced chicken. The portion was pretty good too. This alone was filling, killing my interest to check out other trucks (a good thing, haha). The spices were pretty good, I've always been a fan of indian food. Too bad I'm not much for vege's so I can't tell you how the vege dishes are, but I highly recommend the CTM Sexy Fries! A little greasy though, if you're self-conscious about that.

I'd really like to check this truck out again in the future, a real good take on the fry dish thing! Go there!
author: Robert O.

description:
I love burritos, and finding out they had a Chicken Tikka Masala Burrito, I immediately ordered it.  I must be the only one, cause I really didn't like it.  All my coworkers loved it, and it's something they always order.  So why didn't I like it?  I think I was disappointed in how wet all the filling was.  All the while I was eating the burrito I was just thinking how good it would be if I poured everything into a plate and eat it like that.
While I was disappointed with the burrito, I loved their Deconstructed Samosa.  It's simply amazing.  Every bite is a bunch of flavors and spice.  Delicious and cheap.
It's too bad Yelp doesn't give half stars.  Cause the Deconstructed Samosa is more than 'A-OK'.
author: Karen L.

description:
Holy Moly Ravioli- breaded paneer raviolis smothered in a chicken tikka masala sauce. Gastronomic napalm. Hot, hot, hot...but so tasty.
Off The Grid Ft Mason- my Friday night happy place. When I see that Curry Up Now is serving the Holy Molys, I turn into Pavlov's dog waiting to order.
author: Johanna S.

description:
For some odd reason, I always call "Curry up now" "Curry ME now"! haha! That kind of explains a little my passion for this food truck!

Please curry me now - you make me tear, you make me drool, you make me sweat and you make me feel sooooo good!

Get your mind out of the gutter now! hehe~ 
We first met at stanyan and Haight st "Off the grid", it was love at first sight! I've always have a passion for Indian food. I love heavily spiced food with great seasoning and flavors! The smell of cumin and curry powder just makes me so happy! I ordered the chicken tikka masala Burrito - oh em gee, I loved it! The chicken was marinated deep in the flavorful curry, it was so tender and perfectly seasoned! The rice and a bit of beans makes it very filling. The onions in the burrito gives it a little texture, it also brings out the flavor of the chicken! It is a big size burrito, $8 and you will feel so full after! The reg burrito has a bit of a kick at the end. It's doable for people who don't normally eat spicy food. So one time i ordered the super spicy (ghost pepper infused) burrito - I cried, the tears of joy! I sweated, the sweat came from the heat of the pepper! and I LOVED IT!

Deconstructed samosa - inside out samosa is delicious, also! that's my other favorite! They also have the reg Samosa, which is this fried pastry with savory filling - meat, potato, mint, curry spices. 

Sweet potato fries here are bomb too! rough cut sweet potato waffle fries top with chicken and curry sauce! It's kind of like the indian version of NACHOS. The sweetness of the sweet potato, the juicy chicken and the spices in the curry pair perfectly! 

Every time I go to "Off the grid", I always prepare to pig out and always have eyes bigger than my stomach. "Oh that's interesting! I wanna try this, I wanna try that..." But I hate that every time i SEE "CURRY UP NOW", my heart just flew straight to the truck like a magnet! I have to have it! Ok i don't hate it because you make my tummy so happy! Next time I might consider sharing you, so I can have a piece of other food, too! Maybe, just maybe.... 

Can't wait till Friday - CURRY ME NOW! CURRY UP NOW!

p.s Annabelle Ramil, YOU ARE AWESOME! XOXO
author: Mindy C.

description:
Wanted
to eat sexy fries
on the menu, but got
to the front of the line
and you were out.
There was no sign, there was no sign.

Wanted
to pay with my card
on the truck, but got
to the front of the line
and you were only taking cash.
There was no sign, there was no sign.

Goodbye
author: Liadan R.

description:
Sheesh...say hello to your workday undoing...one burrito from Curry Up Now will have you passing out on your keyboard and accidentally deleting your entire inbox (oddly specific example?)...

Today, I opted for their Karne Burrito special, a samosa, and a mango lassi, all for $14. While slightly steeper than I wanted, the portions more than made up for it. Honestly, a potentially 2+ pound burrito, a fist sized samosa, and a delicious lassi to cut through the grease for $14 is wayyyyy better than three tiny "asian fusion" tacos from [insert almost any SF's food trucks].
author: Nick W.

description: Excellent street food and very fast service.
author: avinash s.

description:
My co-workers and I have been eating at the Curry Up Now truck regularly for about two years. The truck started with a fairly limited menu but has expanded its options a lot over this time. That said, I'm a huge fan of the old stalwarts - the CTM burrito and the deconstructed samosa. I order from the Curry-Up Now truck around three times a month and the food is consistently good.

Couple of things to note: the spiciness level of the burritos has changed over time so if you have not been there for a while, it may be less spicy than you remember it. One tip - the line gets pretty ridiculous starting at about 12:15 so if you can make it to the curb by 12:00 on the dot, you'll be in better shape.
author: David B.

description:
I always order the chicken tikka masala sexy fries (or CTM Sexy Fries as they're known on the menu). Their large portion is more than enough to satisfy my lunch cravings when I want to ingest some quick but delicious Indian food. I haven't had their burrito hybrid wrap things, but they always smell amazing when people walk by me with them.

Be warned though: the sexy fries are REALLY greasy and messy to eat! You'll need a truckload of napkins, plus the oils will start to seep through the container if you let it sit for too long (I learned this to my chagrin). But you shouldn't be letting it sit there for too long anyway! There's a mild kick to it, in case you can't handle spices, but with some water (or some of their mango lassi), you're good to go!
author: Anna W.

description:
fries!

their samosas are delicious.. but standard sized and a bit pricey.

their sexy fries!
delicious!
with paneer!
the sweet potatoes are fried crispily
and the curry covering it. mm. mm. mmmm.
author: Jun K.

description:
Food: 4
Decor: 2
Service: 3

Came here for lunch with a coworker.

1. Chicken tikka masala, 9
~Pretty good. Just imagine chicken tikka masala in a burrito.

Service was okay. The lunch line was quite long though, so I definitely recommend coming here around 11:30 or earlier.
author: David L.

description:
Finally I try Curry Up Now. I was trying to find a "lighter" option and thought that their deconstructed samusa is the answer. Wrong! It's samusa topped by chicken tikka masala so it's still pretty heavy. But the chicken tikka masala was good, so whatevs.

In addition to the deconstructed samusa, I bought additional 2 samusas (2/$3). It's perfectly crispy. However it had a very strong freezer burn smell. One of them actually had a very strange taste too. I'm not sure what happened, maybe it's an old batch?

Being one of the very first food trucks, their setup is the most organized. They literally can just close their window and take off as soon as they're done, since all of their equipments are attached to their truck. That's pretty cool!
author: Novalina N.

description:
VEGANS! Have no fear, this Indian food truck is SUPER SUPER Vegan friendly!

My BF I decided to wait in line for this truck out of all the trucks at Off The Grid because I had heard so many good things about this place! He ordered the Chicken Tikka Masala burrito and I got the Vegan burrito. We also shared a Deconstructed Samosa.

The Vegan burrito was bomb, filled with rice, cinnamon-like seasoning, and fried potatoes. I tried the Chicken Tikka Masala burrito and it was definitely interesting. Not nearly as good as the Chicken Tikka Masala you can get at an actual Indian restaurant, but pretty unique and good for coming out of a food truck.

Lastly, the Deconstructed Samosa was the most interesting thing we got. Normally samosa are just one huge deep fried triangle, but dish was many mini samosas with toppings on top. DEFINITELY my favorite dish out of all the ones we tried.

Really enjoyed the food here, don't know if I'd go out of my way and wait a good 30-40 min to try it again but it's definitely worth it if it's your first time!
author: Vicki L.

description: Got a vegan burrito. It was loaded with sweet chutney. Could barely get the taste of rice and beans. Not cool :(
author: BoredYelper R.

description:
WAY. TOO. SPICY. for my tumtum.- thinks the Indian girl to herself.

Ya, Curry Up Now leads to toilet seat now for me, so unfortunately for me, this food truck is not where I go for my Indian fast food cravings.

Caaaaalm down with those spices, white people :)

The deconstructed samosa was just a mess and the chicken tikka and paneer tikka masala burrito was just inedible. 

People seem to have a love/hate relationship with this truck, but I unfortunately cannot love it.

-Hungry Hungry Pongy
author: Sangita A.

description:
I've been here a few times now, and usually just get the Chicken Masala burrito which is pretty good but this time we were on a mission for something else. My co-worker has been talking up this mythical Butter Chicken burrito that blows her mind but hasn't resurfaced for years.... until today. I don't understand why they stopped serving this but they need to bring it back NOW. I'd say it's one of the best burrito's I've ever had either Mexican, and definitely Indian. 

MESSAGE TO OWNER: PLEASE MAKE THIS A REGULAR ITEM!!!
author: Andrew K.

description: It was good - not amazing. I like honestly some frozen CTM wraps at whole foods better. Too big for lunch and the chicken meat was mixed dark and light which I didn't love.
author: Shameem A.

description:
I know I'm a little late to the food truck party, but I'm totally on board with this delicious phenomenon.

Recently, I met my friend Tara for lunch, and since she works in the Financial District, we decided to check out one of the most popular food trucks, Curry Up Now, which specializes in Indian Street Food. The key with food trucks is preparing the food in convenient, on-the-go style options. The folks at Curry Up Now solved this by putting traditional Indian dishes in a tortilla and wrapping them up into a delicious burrito. We both got the Chicken Tikka Masala (with organic chicken breast from Fulton Valley Farms), and I also got a thick Mango Lassi to help wash it down and calm the spiciness of the burrito.

My combo also came with a Samosa, which was equally tasty. However, for some reason, I thought this meant their famous "deconstructed samosa," which is basically an inside-out version. I will definitely be trying that next time! I don't know how I managed to finish all of that food, but needless to say, I was not hungry for dinner.
author: Jaymee S.

description:
My quibble with Curry Up Now is ultimately that the fusion does not especially work - at least not for me.   While many of the ideas, such as a chicken tikka masala burrito, should work, the result here is a little bit of both and not enough of either.  The chicken  itself seemed dry and bland (!) to me, the rice merely emphasizing that.  The only thing burrito about it was the admittedly nice tortilla.  In other words, the concept should go further with some of the Indian garnishes and sauces in the burrito itself.

Oddly, the paneer tikka masala burrito is better, even though the only change is the protein.  The paneer itself is pretty good - nice, big, squeaky cubes, which is how I like it.  

The kati rolls are probably the best item on the menu, but you'd need to order two (or a samosa or fries) to make a lunch, which would be true pretty much anywhere.  But unlike other venues, your choices are limited to chicken, paneer or vegan.

The least successful menu items (again, to me) are the sexy fries and the deconstructed samosas.  They are essentially variations on other dishes (kinda like how Chipotle has basically one dish that gets recycled into other shapes), and the substitution of fries, for example, doesn't add a whole lot, plus they get unpleasantly soggy under the toppings.  And samosas are just fine the way they are; no deconstruction warranted.
author: Jennifer D.

description: The first time here and hopefully not the last!  Really yummy and worth the wait/line!!  Unique dishes on the menu and I'd love to try them all!  Can't wait to go back!!  The only thing missing for me was the riata..
author: Mardi S.

description: I might be on my 10th deconstructed samosa over a one-year period. It's an incredible value, and I don't want to mess with success by ordering anything else this truck serves. For $7.50 you get a generous base of mini samosas, each perfectly fried. On top of that, the chef heaps garbanzo beans, the protein of your choice, mint and tamarind chutneys, and pico de gallo. Today I ordered the chicken decon, which was loaded with flavorful stewed-and-shreaded breast meat. I generally think fusion mash-ups are silly and contrived, but the pico de gallo works in this case. The deconstructed samosa  is very reasonably priced for SF food truck fare, and I give props to the chef for frying those samosas perfectly every time.
author: Jon P.

description: I've been to the food truck a few times and tried a variety of food. Overall, the food was good but my most favorite thing to get are the Somosas with green sauce. So convenient and quick to grab a quick bite! 2 somosas get me full. Aside from that, their CTM burrito is good as well but a deconstructed somosas is definitely better IMO
author: Robbie P.

description: I was at OTG at upper haight the other day and decided to try something that I probably usually wouldn't try but the smell was enticing. There was a line but it was well worth it. My friend and I shared a chicken tika masala burrito and it was delicious. We both really enjoyed it and probably would have been able to finish our own.. but by that time we had already eaten a lot so it was a good amount. Next time I'll be sure to get extra sauce because it is amazing.
author: Tiff C.

description:
Literally the best food truck I have ever been to. And it's Indian. Totally deserving of 5 stars! I was fortunate enough to visit this truck every Thursday at Berkeley's Off the Grid festival. Unfortunately they have stopped visiting, likely because the buzz of Off the Grid has died down and local restaurants have been complaining of the excessive competition Off the Grid forces. However, this summer I will definitely be visiting the city to get my fix of Curry Up Now! 

Service: It's a food truck so the food comes out pretty quickly. The longest I've had to wait is 5 minutes and that's if they're making a burrito in the case that it is not already made. The guy that I have interacted with everytime is very nice and always gives me extra chutney (the red and green sauces) when I ask. 

Food: My absolutely favorite dish is the paneer tikka masala (PTM) Burrito. It is a burrito filled with rice, paneer tikka masala (an indian curry with paneer and a creamy tomato gravy), and chutneys. It reminds me of Indian Chipotle. What I love is that is the PTM is not so creamy that it makes the burrito too heavy or messy to eat. It's just liquid enough so your burrito is not that dry but not too much so it's a hassle to eat. It's a good level of spicy too, so you really taste all the flavors that come along with the PTM, even though the rice and burrito act against them. Ugh, I can go on and on about how good this burrito is. For $8 at a foodtruck, totally worth it! The burrito is huge and after I scarf it down, I am extremely satisfied and full. The other dish that I have tried and also really enjoyed are the sexy fries. I usually get the PTM Sexy Fries, which is basically big potato wedges doused with PTM and chutneys. The potato wedges are cooked just right and with the paneer and chutneys, this is a great snack! 

Verdict: I miss this food truck so much and wish it would come back to Berkeley! But if it doesn't come to me, I will definitely be going to it!
author: Anu P.

description:
I always order the Chicken Tikka Masala burrito. It's truly amazing. I have to have it! I could eat this all week and not get tired of it. The chicken is cooked just right, tender and juicy and has a ton of flavor. Plenty of sauce soaks up into the rice. I order the regular, because I'm a wimp when it comes to super spicy food. Yogurt, you scoop into little cups. I love a lot of yogurt on this hot burrito, so I keep going back to refill my yogurt cup. It's all good though, the people are very friendly!

I get my fill at the Curry Up Now food truck. Cash only! $7 for burrito and it's large enough to satisfy both Wes and I. (Because we need room for dessert!)

I never had a chicken tikka masala burrito before finding this truck at Off the Grid. Now when I can't get to the truck, I'll make my own at home. It's pretty good if you marinate the chicken overnight, cook the chicken in the sauce, refrigerate an additional night and then serve...truly flavorful. Thanks Curry Up Now. You'll always have a place in my heart and stomach. You rock!
author: Liv K.

description:
OhhhhhEmmmmGeeeeeeee

the "sexy fries" are so Delicious!!!

sweet potato waffle fries topped with chicken tikka masala, onion and cheese. 

i think i'm still drooling from my lunch this afternoon. 
I'm also still very full.
author: Terry C.

description:
Boyfriend and I went here for lunch and got the Chicken Tikka Masala burrito and the "Kathi Rolls". 

The burritos were already made and ready to go for the customers and the Kathi Rolls were made to order. Despite the fact that the menu had written "rolls" (plural) it was really just one big roll (was expecting multiple tiny rolls, like an Indian Spring Roll type deal). It was pretty good but nothing memorable. 

The Chicken Tikka Masala Burrito was pretty good. It was Chicken Tikka Masala, rice and beans. Kind if boring after couple of bites. When ordering an $8 buritto I kind of expect a little more layering. Definately needed some acidity (like maybe a pico de gayo or tomato chutney) in the burrito. It is definately big, got 3 meals out of it. After I took it home I broke open the tortilla, chopped the chicken up (was a little too chunky for me, would have better if shredded or had just smaller pieces), added tomatoes and cheese and it was a million times better.

Overall this was just an okay experience. Didn't really live up to the hype, that could be because I have one of the best Indian Fusion restaurants 2 minutes from my Boyfriends house (Pizza and Curry) and kind of compare to them a lot.
