I should've followed my instinct that certain food shouldn't be brought to the food truck scene. As much as a lot of people love Indian food, I'll keep my taste buds in check next time.
author: D'Andre L.

description:
My favorite food in San Francisco so far. The tikka saag burrito was the perfect amount of spiciness to it, not too mild at all. Delicious samosa potatoes. Nice street food, hodge podge of popular favorites wrapped in burritos. A nice addition to great Indian food I've had! Huge serving, I saved the other half for dinner ;).

Also the mango drink was delish, thick, like mango pulp
 mixed with a yogurt base. I recommend this also.
author: Lily D.

description: I love curry up when it's not out of control spicy.   I feel like this is half the time,  sometimes you eat there and it's like 2 habenineros per burrito/sexy fries.   When it's not this place is solid.    I don't like rolling the dice when I grab lunch.
author: Michael E.

description:
Ummm...can I be on the pit crew for this Food Truck?  I can change a tire in 3 min flat.  I can fill your truck with gas with sniper like efficiency.  I can wash your windshield like an artist.  I can do whatever you need, just as long as you make me a burrito.  

During a recent trip to the Bay Area, a friend suggested we check out the Food Truck orgasm known as Off The Grid.  We checked it out while at its Haight location.  

Oh me, Oh my.  Hummina, hummina, hummina.  Uy Yuy Yuy!

After being mesmerized by the culinary options, I was at first overwhelmed, but I ultimately chose Curry Up Now.  I picked her like a girl at a Junior High School Dance.  I was scared & bashful, but I knew I we were each other's density....errr....destiny.

Indian & Mexican cuisine.  Two of my favorite types of flavors.  I love it when food is Frankenstein style---the mixing and matching of only the best to make the ultimate.  I had the:

:::   Chicken Tikka Masala Burrito   :::

It wasn't the best Indian food I've had or best Mexican food, but with both of them bonding together like an organic molecule of perfection, I found my winner for the evening.  The burrito was oh so tasty.  It was big.  It was fast.  And it made an impression.  

I will remember you fondly, Chicken Tikka Masala Burito.  Will you remember me?  Please don't forget me.  

You'll always be in my heart.
author: Corey G.

description:
I had the chicken tikka masala burrito again. Since it was too spicy the first time, I asked if they could make it less spicy. The girl said no, they all come medium spicy. I said okay and paid the $8.

I'm happy to report it was not as spicy as the first time! It was about 4 out of 10 on the spicy scale. Also, they cooked the onions longer this time, so they were much better.  Overall it was very good and 4 stars is about right for their food.

(Overall grade: B+)
author: Shannon L.

description:
This review is partially for "Off the Grid" as well as Curry Up Now.

I remember when Off The Grid didn't have lines (and though they deserve the booming business), I'm sure the 30 minute wait turns people away from even tasting the magical burrito. 

So after forcing myself to stand in line for more than 30 minutes (it felt longer and excruciating since I was so hungry), I get to the window and order: "Vegetarian deconstructed Samosa and the Paneer Tikka Masala Burrito Please!"

After a few anxious moments, I get my burrito and scan the area for a place for a seat, but there's no where to sit since everyone and their mama decided to come down to the food truck party. Besides, I don't want to sit in the co2 exhaust funnel area anyway.

Nonetheless, there's an empty dock nearby that's generates romance. Cool night breeze, music in the background, under a star lit sky, and great company while I enjoy every savory bite of my burrito. This is off the chain!!!!!

I definitely recommend sitting away the festivities. Trust me, you'll enjoy your food so much more when there's less distracting noise and people. I'm sure you'd rather smell your food than smell smoke from exhaust pipes and generators.

Off the Grid in general attracts a wide range of crowds, but you could be sure the hipsters and new 21 year olds will be there with their homies. If you do not dig the young hipster scene then come early. Like right when they are just setting up and opening for business kind of early. 

So for my final reviews:

Off the Grid in general gets less stars for me. I really do not dig the abundance amounts of people and the hipster crowd it attracts. I also do not like waiting in line for food or enjoy breathing in exhaust and smoke for any amount of time. However, to get a Curry up Now burrito I will endure it. 

Off the Grid: 3 stars
Curry Up Now: 5 stars

Off the Grid Pros:
Good food.

Off the Grid Cons:
Large crowds.
Hipsters.
Long Lines.
Breathing in exhaust and smoke.

Curry Up Now Pros:
FOOD!!!!

Curry Up Now Cons:
Having to go to Off The Grid for food.
author: Krystle A.

description:
I was jonesing pretty hardcore for some Indian food so I yelped "Indian food" around the financial district. I'm so glad I found Curry Up Now at a reasonable distance from where I work. 

The line to order food moved pretty quickly, but you will see a lot of people standing around waiting for food. This place gets really busy. Expect to wait about 10 minutes.

I ordered the Chicken Tikka Masala burrito and the samosa ($10). I'm never quite sure what to get when I try a place out for the first time and it's hard to gauge portion sizes. Let me tell you, their portions are BIG. 

The samosa was delicious and perfectly crispy and warm. Everything was great about it. It's big and filling too!

The CTM Burrito is huge. It comes wrapped in a regular flour tortilla (unlike the CTM kati rolls/ burritos from Kasa). The burrito is packed to the point of near explosion with rice, chicken, chick peas and sauce. Thank Ganesha for that aluminum foil!! The flavor was great and the perfect amount of sauce and spice. I couldn't finish it all during lunch for a had the rest later for linner (bonus! woo-hoo!).

I'll definitely be back to this joint.
author: Daisy S.

description:
got to do a second round of this truck, tried there chicken tikka masala burrito, MF wow is all I got to say!!!!! y'all got to try it folks

the rice pudding not something I was use too there was ginger and it was super runny but rice pudding is suppose to be, i think more or less i was just not use to having the taste of ginger in my rice pudding.. would not order it again

go for their burritos gots to have at least one haha

food ***** for burritos meat or no meat * for the rice pudding
price $
service *** since it was at Off the Grid super slow, but at any other there any other locations im sure it would be an easy **** stars
author: Clarence A.

description:
highlights- 
always at OTG!
Huge burritos ---worth the $8
Spicy but not too spicy
author: Nicole S.

description:
Curry Up Now, Mess Me Up Later.

The truck parks near my work often so we had to give it a try in our mission to try all food trucks in the city. After lining up for 45 mins, we finally reach the front of the truck and notice a sign that says there's an iPhone app where you can preorder and just come pick up. REALLY WISH I had known this 45 mins ago.

I am not a huge fan of curry, but was pleasantly surprised to see Chicken Tikka Masala Burrito on the menu so I ordered that with a Mango Lassi. Both were delicious - the burrito was SO full of flavor! We even asked for hot sauce which was quite spicy, but was delicious! The mango lassi helped wash it all down nicely. Overall, a great lunch and very filling - I couldn't even finish an entire burrito.

While a tasty lunch, we were feeling it all afternoon in the office, into the evening, and unfortunately, the next day as well. I didn't eat dinner that evening and woke up the next day w/a stomach ache, cold sweat, and nausea. That was not a good day at work! It wasn't until I was able to get rid of the burrito that I finally felt normal again.
author: Stella C.

description:
First time trying Curry Up Now was at Off the Grid - Berkeley. I was enthusiastic to try this truck because I am huge fan of Indian food or any foods with flavor that is. I ordered a samosa and the BBC (Betchen Butter Chicken), and let me just say I was really excited to try my favorite dish wrapped in a burrito.

I took my first bite......MY MOUTH WAS ON FIRE! There is a difference between spicy and overbearingly spicy that it burns your mouth! No no, I am not a wuss, I promise you. I grew up in the south and very accustomed to normal spice to really spicy foods, in fact I prefer spicy foods. I was so disappointed, I had really high hopes for this dish. Not only was it overly spicy, but I am going to be honest the chicken tasted like Chef Boyardee meat, no joke. It was just gross.
author: Jessica C.

description: The deconstructed samosa is so rad. Its perfectly spiced, has the right amount of heat and the paneer addition takes it a notch further. Its pretty authentic to boot. I tried the burrito as well which was humongous and delish. The star though was the deconstructed samosa. Too bad CUN is not in the South bay where I work :(
author: Natasha I.

description:
After a long day of MUNI-ing and shopping, my boyfriend and I just wanted something quick and delicious for dinner- we didn't want to have to cook.  We got off the train at Stanyan and walked just a couple short blocks over to Off the Grid.  My boyfriend had never been to OTG before, so we walked around and skimmed the menus of each truck.  

I was in an indecisive mood, but we came to the conclusion that Curry Up Now's tikka masala burrito would be the most delicious option.  I'm usually one who likes to try new things, but based on how much I liked the burrito last time, I knew that my boyfriend would like it and he thought it sounded really good too.  We got in line, which was once again, really quick and within minutes, a hot, wrapped, huge tikka masala burrito was in front of us.  (It was large enough for the two of us to share).  

The burrito ($8) had many pieces of chicken and was so flavorful.  The tikka masala is spicy enough without being overpowering.  They also have a wonderful tangy yogurt sauce which compliments the burrito quite nicely. The burrito is wrapped nicely so that it doesn't fall apart or get sloppy- even when you're down to the last few bites.  With this last visit, I have to bump Curry Up Now to five stars-because it really is as good as it gets.  Delicious food, fast service, fair prices.

Notes:
-They run out of certain items quicker than others.  Make sure to get their earlier if you want to try out a specific product.
author: Samantha L.

description: Chicken Tiki Masala burrito =  super good but super spicy. I couldn't bear the spiciness and with much regret, had to throw the last fifth of it away. There's always a long line during peak lunch hours. Fortunately, I've trained my stomach to not start wanting food until 1, which by then, the line dies down. Wish they had a spiciness level option. I would definitely come here more often if they did.
author: Amy Z.

description:
kept hearing about the chick tikka masala wrap and the mango lassi...tried both and seriously I don't know what the hype was about.  Bummer that the stuff was pre-made. I get it given their high volume but even MacDonald's makes things fresh...

final aftertaste on this place...er truck - not so much.
author: Jacque P.

description: Have had the Chicken Tikka Masala Burrito more than once and it is very good.  Has the right amount of flavor and the spices.  Found them today at OTG in Alameda.  Will have to try some other menu items, but the burrito is awesome.
author: Lon H.

description:
I love curry up now, I salivate just thinking about their tikka masala burritos. I'm salivating right now as I write this review. But I have two small issues that knocks them down a star. Yes, I know I'm being nitpicky.

1. Their regular spice level isn't quite spicy enough for me, but when I asked for it a little spicier than normal, it about burned a hole in my mouth. I love spicy food, but this was painful. Sniffling and crying, I still finished it because it was damn good. So to be safe I now order it standard wishing it were a tad bit spicier. 

2. Please chop up your chicken into smaller pieces. There are large chunks thrown in and not incorporated very well, so you end up with bites of rice and sauce and then suddenly have to work your way around a way too big chunk of chicken. No bueno.

Other than that, keep doing what you're doing, CUN. I may have to get a burrito for dinner now.
author: Sophie P.

description:
Points for creativity, but the food is not that great.

They were at the LunchBox in SOMA, and I got the Tikka Masala Burrito and the Sexy Fries. Now I like spicy food, and I mean authentically spicy food, but whatever spice they put in the tikka masala gave me a stomachache.

While the Sexy Fries looked fantastic, they were half raw. Crunchy raw potato is not sexy.

Really disappointing, and this is the first time I've ever I've ever said that about a food truck. Never coming back again.
author: Meg G.

description:
I love this food truck!  Their wraps are enough to fill you up for less than ten dollars.  Perfect lunch run when you're craving indian food but dining "al deske" (aka: working through lunch). The paneer masala wrap is my favorite.  

Tips:
1) Be prepared to wait in line for about 20 to 30 minutes.  This truck is pretty popular.
2) Do not request your dish be made spicy unless you want it atomic.  If you do, I suggest you grab some extra napkins.  It'll make you sweat! 
3) Don't forget to ask for chutney.  They carry it, but you have to ask.  ;)
4) If you're not a huge onion fan, or meeting a date for happy hour later, make sure to request no onions. They really pack 'em in there.
author: Natalie Y.

description:
for someone who has a VERY HIGH tolerance when it comes to spicy food, omg...this place will have you running for a fire extinguisher!!!

when i saw tikka masala burritos on the menu...i knew that this was it...out of all the food carts at off the grid...i decided to wait my frozen booty in line for curry up now.  $6.75 for the monstrous burrito that you get...enough to feed both wifey and myself.  make sure you have a bottle of water or mango lassi in your hand...cause you're going to need it.  it wasn't painfully spicy...it was that kinda spicy where your mouth was on fire but your hand kept shoving more into your face!  it was like a reflex...we just couldn't stop.  

the burrito itself was about 3.5 stars...rounding up to 4.  my only complaint is that the burrito was a little on the sweeter side...not what i'm used to with tikka masala...but it was still tasty and hit the spot.
author: Jen W.

description:
I have been trolling around "Off the Grid" and the food really ranges, but I haven't tried all the trucks, and I will stop once I have.

I had the chicken deconstructed Samosa. Tender chicken pieces covered with a spicy sauce, over a large deep fried samosa. Accompanying the "dish" (box, really) were chick  peas and tiny samosas. 

This is by far the best truck I have tried at this location  and definitely one worth trying. I will return.
author: A I.

description:
The woman taking my order was literally the most amazingly beautiful woman I've ever seen... but i'm supposed to write this review about the food, dam it.

cktikkamasalaburrito, mmm, hot!

Yeah, almost broke a sweat, speechless, wow...
author: Ethan L.

description:
After writing my last review, one of the owners contacted me and promised that they had since improved the chicken tikka masala sauce, so I had to come back and try. Now, that's customer service!

I finally had the chance to try the new burrito tonight at OffTheGrid and Rana/Amir/Nimma: very tasty!

For the very reasonable price, you get a burrito stuffed with methi pulao (basically, Indian fried rice), pickled onions, chana (garbanzo beans), and super tender and most chunks of chicken. Each bite bursts with well-balanced flavor - a great balance of sweet, heat, and savory! The sweetness level is a bit more pronounced than I'm used to in traditional Indian food, but I think it works well in this fusion context.

If you enjoy heat, I recommend the spicy version.
author: Steve L.

description: I would have taken a picture but my vegan burrito is gone.  I think I may never eat indian food again unless it is in a burrito.  And I don't think I will ever eat a burrito again unless it is indidan.  This was DELICIOUS!  I have walked past the truck so many times but there was a huge line.  Today was a late lunch day and there was no line so I gave it a try.  Now I know whey there is always a huge line!  I just might stand in it next time I have a craving.
author: Britt R.

description:
The truck parks out in front of the Wal-Mart offices every Wednesday.  My co-workers and I have gone twice and it was excellent both times.  

I've had both the chicken and paneer tikka masala burritos!  Both are great!
author: Melisa C.

description:
CUN is the Indian Chipotle.

Love, love, love their food. This is the kind of place that could go national. 

Authentic, it ain't. But it's damn good. It's a cross between Indian food and Mexican food.

My favorites are their Kathi rolls.
author: Rocky A.

description:
Sexy Fries, get in my bellyyy!!!

I honestly have yet to try much else.  My desire to induce hot, spicy, and heart-attack inducing food never lets me get past the Sexy Fries.  If chili cheese fries were the hometown cheerleader, Sexy Fries would be the HOT NEW CHICK that breaks up the happy ending.  SOMETIMES, you just have to be down for the home-wrecker.
author: Diane N.

description: Strictly on delivery service, or lack thereof. Thumbs down on the delivery radius. We live in Cole Valley & have received delivery before. Tonight we tried to order & were told that Cole Valley is out of the radius. They deliver in the Mission & to the Financial District. WTF? Bummer!
author: B K.

description:
(I actually wrote this on 4/7...but under their Burlingame account; copied and pasted..)

I was so excited to witness and support their first time serving the hungry FiDi citizens in SF! 

The online-ordering wasn't available, so for people with RESTRICTED lunch breaks like myself, it was quite a long, hideous wait. But it was really hard to be mad at them because....they were so nice and warmhearted. I'm guilty though, I'll admit I was grumpy because I waited for over half an hour for one burrito and one order of tacos (mango lassi and samosa combo.) But can you see that I feel kind of bad now?

So the taste - can't really mess up a burrito, right? Though I don't think it'll make it on to the 7x7 list any time soon, I enjoyed my CTM burrito. It was perfectly sized, not too big and not too small. It had big chunks of white chicken meat and seasoned/curried basmati rice (thank goodness they didn't use short grain...) It wasn't very saucy, so it wasn't messy to eat. Actually, I must praise them for their excellent burrito-wrapping - I hate it when burritos fall apart after 2 bites. I had asked for "spicy", but only got the Americanized spicy....but that was expected. 

Generally speaking though, I would prefer a good dish of curry over its wrapped-up counterpart.

I didn't taste the keema (beef) tacos my mom got, but she said they were really good. However, she said the samosa was only so-so....kind of cold. Lastly, the mango lassi, despite its watery-appearance, scored delicious points.

I'll probably go again if they come back in the future, only because I'm obsessed with Indian food and highly support the street food culture. I also want to go back and try their other items, like the deconstructed samosa and kathi rolls. 

Street food culture, it adds flavor to your food.
author: Grace C.

description:
Tikka masala burrito such an ingenious idea! Who would've thought indian food & mexican food could work so perfectly together! When my friend brought a burrito back, I could smell the yumminess from a mile again!! Sadly, I didn't get a chance to eat it until two hours later. So as I was pulling back the foil, I expected to see a giant lump of soggy mess, but to my surprise the tortilla was not soggy at all! 

The filling was delicious and hearty! although it was spicy, it was a good type of spicy- the kind where you just can't stop eating even though you're sweat up a storm! Curry up now has definitely made it's way onto one of my top go to food places!
author: Jess s.

description:
I really wanted to like it, but it didn't go that way. I ordered the Tikka Masala I believe and split it half with my boyfriend. We both didn't really like it that much, and I didn't even finish my half. It was too spicy for me :( 

Guess I didn't like this place because of my own personal taste preference. Nothing else I want to say about this place.
author: Harriet W.

description:
Yum, the Chicken Tikka burrito is always good, not really spicy but a good low heat that compliments the flavor well. 

Not particularly "authentic" tasting but come on, you're eating a chicken tikka burrito from a food truck! Also be prepared to be STUFFED afterwards cause the thing is HUGE!

If this truck is at off the grid there's a good chance I'll get a CTM!
author: Ely L.

description:
A lot of my friends really love Curry Up Now, so I keep trying it in hopes that maybe this time I'll understand the Curry Up Now craze. Maybe it's my fault for always sticking to the chicken tikka masala burrito, or for always going in with hopes raised high, but, for one reason or another, I always walk away a bit disappointed. 

I think the main reason - Indian food wrapped in a tortilla always makes me want either a real Mexican burrito, or regular Indian food. The combo just doesn't do it for me. Now, Indian food wrapped in roti or naan would be AWESOME. 

A bit of advice - go early. San Franciscans love waiting in lines for food. Also, if you order spicy be ready for SUPER spicy. The regular burrito is already decently spicy.
author: Talia G.

description: You may think you can handle spicy... But don't order it. It was literally painful to eat. I thought I was stronger but this burrito proved me wrong. I got through maybe 1/4 of the burrito and had to throw it away. My mouth hurt too badly. Just stick to the regular spice. The samosas are okay... the two times I've ordered them I feel like I taste more oil than flavor. Curry Up Now is okay, but I guess I'm just not as big a fan as everyone else seems to be.
author: Kelly E.

description:
I am a big fan of Curry Up Now (CUN).  I used to work in Burlingame in a food desert so Thursdays, when CUN parked outside, were always the highlight of my week!  Now that I work downtown, I have a multitude of lunch options but still make the trip to CUN every once in a while.  

Their chicken tikka masala burrito is delicious!  Is it the most authentic CTM ever? No, but that doesn't mean it does't taste good.  My one complaint is that the construction of the burrito isn't consistent from trip to trip - sometimes there is a great balance between rice and chicken tikka masala and other times I have felt like my burrito was full of liquid.  

The line can get pretty long at the Bush St. location so I recommend going their early or stopping closer to when they are leaving.
author: Liz H.

description:
Is place has amazing paneer tikka burrito!!!  Yess burrito no kidding..
Definitely a must try.
author: Sumanth A.

description: The deconstructed samosa was a lunch disappointment. The portion was small (but heavy/carby) and it was less of a deconstructed samosa and more of a hodgepodge of different ingredients. These included mini samosas, chickpeas, and a giant rice-filled samosa at the bottom to fill up space. The chicken seemed to be of poor quality (a lot of trucks use free range or local chicken for the $7-$9 price point, but not Curry Up Now). I asked for mine spicy, and boy was it spicy (my mouth was on fire).
author: Pria P.

description: Another 7x7 big eat crossed off my list.  I ordered the Tikka Masala burrito and it was ready right when I ordered which I was not used to from a food truck but it was a nice surprise.  This was a large burrito and it was good and had a good kick to it too.  Now I understand why there is always a long line here unless you show up after the lunch rush (which I luckily did).
author: Blake B.

description:
so glad i work close to one of their trucks!

i love the paneer burrito, so that's pretty much all i ever get, though i did try the deconstructed samosa once and enjoyed it as well. thanks for actually making the burrito spicy!
author: Kate W.

description:
Been here a couple of times and I have NEVER been disappointed!  Chicken tikka masala burritos are amazing.  This, Chairman Bao, and Japacurry are by far the top three food trucks in my book.  The deconstructed samosa's were alright.  Just stick to the tikka masala burritos and I promise that you will enjoy it.  You can thank me later.  

Dammit, just writing this review is making me hungry!
author: Jacquelynne S.

description:
The chicken tikka masala burrito is the must have here. The chicken is tender and juicy and the sauce has just the right spiciness (ordered "regular" spicy).

Pass on the deconstructed samosa. By the time I got back to the office (about a 3-4 minute walk), the samosa was already soggy. Although it had good flavor, this item probably needs to be eaten immediately.

Definitely pre-order with their iPhone app, skip the line, and head directly to the "pick-up" window. This will save you about a 15-20 minute wait.
author: Lester W.

description: The combination of Indian curry and cheese wasn't to my liking. I got the 'Naughy Naan' with paneer, and the flavors just didn't go together. With fusion food, you usually hope that the end result is better than the two things that are being combined - but in this case, it was worse.
author: Amaresh S.

description: Don't understand the hype. I've been here multiple times and find it to be overhyped and overpriced for what it is. Asked for less spicy curry and it was the same both times. There are better Indian places than this, like Roti in west portal.
author: Ce Ce M.

description:
I've been here twice, wary about the whole burrito craze. Korritos, curritos whatevurritos... it's insane. So is this truck and its goods - they're insane....ly great.

Unless I'm mistaken, they recently introduced spicy levels for their burritos, in case you couldn't stand the default (spicy). But really, mild? Mild is for chickens. At spicy, the paneer tikka masala burrito is so hot, your lips will burn at even the slightest touch of the sauce they put in it. I, being masochistic when it comes to spicy foods, even dripped a few drops of their excellent hot sauce into the fiery pit of paneer, and spent my lunch hours crying in tears of joy (and pain).

Lines can get long, so I highly recommend ordering with their mobile app, then picking it up.

You can order a deconstructed samosa too, if you wish. I've heard good things about it. But my heart will always burn for the burritos. And I do mean "burn".
author: Hannah H.

description:
Ever go in your office restroom in the early afternoon and hear some dude playing Battlesh!ts by himself?  He probably went to Curry Up Now for lunch.  

If you love spicy arse curry and organic chicken rolled up in a giant tortilla, look no further than the chicken tikki masala burrito.  Especially if you love extra hot/spicy stuff.  I will say the ratio of chicken to rice is a hit or miss w/ this truck...and that's why I only give it 4 stars instead of 5.  I've had one w/ way too much rice and barely any chicken and another w/ very little rice and a huge portion of chicken (obviously preferred).  But for $7.50, you can't really go wrong w/ giving this place a shot.  The spicy curry mixed w/ organic chicken is fantastic..no doubt you'll feel the burn in your tummy and bowels.  But the taste and portion size (burrito is definitely on the generous side) make those burns very worthwhile.
author: Jeff S.

description: This is an update to my prior review of Curry Up Now...nice improvement to the quality of food, a responsive management and an owner who takes responsibility for his business...so overall, a yay from me for Curry Up Now...yes, I am now a fan of their food and good service !!!
author: Raj D.

description:
This is Bang for your buck type truck.  First be warned that the Chicken Burrito is SPICY, not mild but hot, with that said I LOVE it!  Good size for $8  I also tried the Samosa and that was mild spicy and very good too.  Next time I want to try the Sexy Fries ( I know the name doesn't match the Indian theme)!  This burrito hit the spot, hopefully I won't be crying later tonight.  They take credit card too.  Yay for us FiDi folks.
P.S.  Line moved quick, especially if you order a burrito since they are pre made.
author: La C.

description:
I've seen this truck a few times now so today I figured, "might as well". I ran over at 11:30 and didn't have to deal with a line. I had the choice of a tikka burrito or a pulled apart samosa. I went for the burrito because they had my favorite - paneer. Paneer is a fried cheese that looks like tofu, but isn't. I brought it back to my desk, it was a huge piece of work. Definitely not like the typical burrito you can eat and walk with, you definitely need to sit down with a knife and fork.. or be willing to get your hands curried up. 

I did enjoy my burrito, it had some rice, paneer and garbanzo beans in a mild curry. I could tell the spices were thrown in near the end of cooking which is one of my pet peeves with Indian food. I want to taste my garam masala cooked in, not thrown on later. There was a lot of garbanzo beans and not enough paneer or rice. And though I liked the paneer, it wasn't as good as some of the stuff I've had.

That said, I'll probably go back to try the samosa one of these days.
author: Analisa S.

description: Deconstructed Vegan Samosa.  Nice subtle blend of spices and not greasy at all.  It is the best.  Maybe because I was really hungry, but this place was very good.
author: Abigail J. M. M.

description: The Chicken Tikka Masala burrito was my go-to for a quick, delicious lunch.
author: Mike P.

description:
Everything about this place is just... yes.  Win.  Winning.  Not two hours ago I consumed a spicy paneer burrito, and my insides are still glowing from the delicious spicy burn.  This is not a place for those who don't like hot food!

I'm inspired, everything should come in burrito form now.  I've been here about 8 times this month now.  It is the best truck food around.
author: Jon M.

description:
FOOD:
1.) Chicken Burrito = yummm.... spicy, tasty, just right, satisfying... (and still hella good even eating it way later as leftovers... yurm *drools)


SERVICE:
Order pickup from a truck. Lady was nice and friendly. :)
author: Angela L.

description:
Burma Superstar's coconut milk and mango version is a better drink. Cold apple juice is better at tampering the heat than their mango lassi.  Greasy and heavy chicken tikka masala burrito!  I love the chickpeas + crunchy onions. I was crying against my will from the spice. 

I craved that paneer even though it lasted me two meals. I didn't get ordering online because it looks like you can only checkout items one by one, without descriptions. I noticed the line as I was walking towards John's.  The website doesn't really go into any culinary background behind the owners, just food culture. What is a khati roll?

I love the smell of curry on the street.  I'm getting full just by eating a third of the paneer burrito.  The tortilla is good quality, maybe from a small producer.   Unlike Kogi it was parked at the same place the next day.  Wouldn't roti work as well as a burrito wrap?
author: Ai M.

description: Just a quick update.  I've been back to Curry Up Now several times since my last review.  I'm happy to report that this truck is not only standing tall through the test of time, it just keeps getting better and better.  Lines are still long and unbearable, but they have adapted well.  Lines are long not because they're slow.  Far from it, they're very efficient.  The lines are a testament of a good product.  I still can't get enough of the Chicken Tikka Masala burrito.  Thank you, Curry Up Now, for parking right in front of my office.
author: Angel S.

description:
Best testing Indian food I have had in the country. 

It's very close to authentic Indian test.

Awesome food ! Awesome people ! Awesome service !

It's a go to place !
author: Chinmaya S.

description:
The Curry Up Now food truck offers the perfect marriage between Eastern food and Western packaging: spicy, savory curry wrapped neatly into a foil-encased burrito exterior. Delicious genius.

My coworkers and I walked over to Bush Street around 12:30 on Friday. We waited for about 25 minutes in line and another 10 for our food, which is standard. If you want to avoid the crowds, come after 1 pm when the lunchtime rush hour dies down. 

Their menu is simple. I opted for the Chicken Tikki Masala burrito, which was large enough to be both my lunch and dinner that day. It had just the right amount of spiciness, with large chunks of moist, juicy chicken and strips of carmelized onions. I normally don't care for curry, but this tortilla wrapped creation has inspired me to give curry a second chance. I am, once again, a fan.

Instead of the same boring soup and sandwich, head over to the Curry Up Now truck and spice up your lunch hour.
author: Mariela D.

description: The chicken tikka masala burrito is very good, only wish it were 1) a little less spicy and 2) more chicken less chickpeas. Very tasty -- beware, they are HUGE so share!!
author: Melody T.

description:
This truck turns out a delicious and nicely sized curried chicken wrap that I just love.  I finally tried something else, the deconstructed samosa, it was OK.  The service is quick and their pricing seems very fair.  
I'll add that their menu offerings are not easily understood. There are descriptions of the ingredients and photos of the food but nothing tying a photo to the dish listing on the menu.  I was told that they have daily specials but I've never seen one.

WARNING: Be careful about ordering the spicy at this place.  They do mean SPICY! If you are acclimated then go for it but if you just kinda-sorta like spicy then don't cross the line.
author: Jay A.

description:
I don't like indian food unless it is in burrito form apparently. 

Spicy.
author: J A.

description:
This place is amazing. The burrito is really good, but for 8 dollars... Its a little high for a burrito but it is in the FIDI. This is a must try if you are interested in burritos or indian food because its a nice twist for your taste bud. The food is pretty consistant.

Pro: 
Good food
Decent price for the area

Con: 
Too little on the menu :( but it is a food truck.
author: Benjamin C.

description:
I visited the truck for the first time on a Wednesday around 11:15, so there wasn't much of a wait.  (In fact, as soon as I ordered and paid, my food was ready.)

I ordered the Chicken Tikka Masala burrito and thought it was tasty.  Yes, it was spicy, but I like spicy food and didn't find it as crazy hot as a lot of other people on here did.  The $7.50 price was a little steep, but it is a pretty large burrito.  I actually ate half and plan to eat the other half for dinner (unless I keep picking at it with my fork...)

I'll go back to try the Deconstructed Samosa (the other item on the menu)...unless I start craving this burrito again!
author: Kimberly B.

description:
I am a fan of the truck. The burritos are terrific. However if you do not like hot/spicy food - stay away.

The first time I ordered the burrito, I asked them to make it spicy. Dude at the window warned me - but I am used to spicy foods.. wtf.. this was spicy.. I was burning. Needed a coke and then a yogurt to kill the burn.

But the burrito was damm tasty.

Now a days,  colleague and me split a burrito and a deconstructed samosa. (as the burrito is huuuuge)

Note: They do not have any vegan food. They never have the kathi rolls.
author: S C.

description:
Your wait time in line is hit or miss. Usually I'm lucky in that San Franciscans are wimps and won't queue up for a burrito on a sunny day if there was a forecast of rain earlier, but I've lost half an hour waiting before. That said, the staff at the Curry Up truck are always friendly and amazingly efficient at what they do.

Curry Up's paneer burritos with pass muster with all of my coworkers, including the ones who apparently like agony. I'm told that if you order it spicy (I don't), it will burn much more as you continue eating.
author: Sharon W.

description:
San Franciscans love lines!  I hate 'em.  I've seen this truck on Bush and Sansome for several weeks.  Always a super long line, so I was not interested.  

Then today, BAM!  No line!  So I decided to give this place a shot.  Obviously not authentic Indian as the dude working there was white and had a huge mohawk held together by a can of Aqua-New.  

I ordered the chicken tikka masala burrito (the cool kids call it the CTM burrito).  It came out very fast.  Took it to my office -- inhaled it!  Chicken was warm, tender and flavorful.  The whole package was perfect.  I'll come here again -- even if there is a line!

Thank you, come again.
author: David M.

description: Decent food, but nothing extraordinary. Like their kathi roll, didn't care for thei "burritos" or samosas.
author: Ankur V.

description:
Another of my favorite 'food-on-wheels' places!

Their Chicken Tikka Masala burrito is amazing - spicy and delicious. If you're a spicy whimp, this may not be for you. Even if you order the mild, it's pretty spicy, and I LOVE IT.

Also love their paneer and (when they have it) the biriyani burrito. 

Follow them on Twitter so you know where they're at - they even have an iPhone app that you can order food online and then bypass the line to pick up. I think it needs some work because the past few times I've tried, I still have to order at the pick up window.

I hear a brick and mortar is in the works soon for a spot in San Mateo - YAY! Then I can get my CTM burrito cravings satisfied whenever I want without having to find them somewhere on the streets of the bay area!
author: Christy L.

description:
I discovered Curry up Now about a year and a half ago, and I've had their Chicken Tikka Masala burrito so many times it's absurd.

Quite frankly, I would have given them 5 stars, but I feel like the quality of the burritos has decreased since I started eating their food. Don't mistake me, I still love their burrito, but it used to be AMAZING, and now it's just great.

I've only had food from their food trucks, never been to the actual space they opened not to long ago. So this review is only for the food truck experience :)
author: Gerardo C.

description:
The Tikka Masala burrito is the bomb!!

I'm not normally a fan of paying $8 for a burrito from a food truck, but the fact the burrito made the top 100 list for the Big Eat SF in 7x7 Magazine pushed me to try.  Dang, was it worth the try!

Wrapped in a fresh tortilla was chicken tikka masala, Indian rice, chickpeas, and lots of flavor.  Now, I just need to find the truck again at the next Off The Grid!
author: Chad S.

description:
Stellar food at a great price.

I had the CMT burrito -- chicken masala in a wrap -- and it was excellent. Great flavors, a little spicy, and filling. And it was $8! I'll definitely return next week.
author: Kevin V.

description:
I heard, I saw, I ate and Curry Up Now conquered.  Ok I knew i was getting too much food when I ordered the burrito and somosa AND a mango lassi but hey...I had to try everything right?

So I only took a few bites of the burrito.  REally solid, but the spices were really strong.  I guess the masala I'm used to is more tame and I like to dip my naan into the sauce.

The somosa was nice and fried and I liked the potato stuffing inside.  I wish they gave more sweet sauce.  That stuff is yum. 

Mango Lassi was nice and thick and a good compliment to the meal.  Overall solid lunch but I had food coma all day.
author: Christine K.

description:
It's kind of difficult to ignore a bright orange-yellow truck parked smack-dab in front of your office building every single day from 11:30  - 2:30. 

I've walked by the Curry Up Now truck every day for almost 2 months without trying their Indian-Mexican fusion offerings, attempting to ignore the mouth-watering curry aroma.  Why?  Because the line is always so long--even well past the 12 - 1 lunch rush.  And well, when I'm hungry--I hate to wait.  

One benefit of the rain in San Francisco today:  No line at Curry Up Now!  I finally sampled the Organic Chicken Tikka Masala Burrito.  
The verdict:  it was delicious.  

So let's talk about the burrito:  it's definitely a good-sized burrito--depending on your appetite, it might be 2 meals.  The burrito is chock full of chicken, sauce, rice, and onion among other things.   For me, it was just the right spicy temperature.  Absolutely worth the $7.50 I paid for it, and next time--I might just brave the line.
author: Jamie M.

description: Tikka Masala burrito + samosa = amazing lunch (food coma)... I don't need to say anything else.  The food speaks for itself :)
author: Amanda K.

description:
We had dinner in the restaurant.  The spot is trendy and very well put together, but the atmosphere area was not so great. Waiter came twice only during our meal. I had to get up a couple of times to ask for more water or napkins..  The dining room was a lot busier than I expected, lots of movement and noise. 

The food, however, did not disappoint    Probably wont come back
author: Reginald S.

description:
Chicken Tikka Masala burrito, wow. Definitely one of my favorite food trucks. The burrito bursts with flavors and unlike other pop ups or food trucks they don't skim on quantity because they sell from a trendy food truck.

May not be the best burrito to get if you are on a lunch break, it is very heavy. 

From my experiences with food trucks, these guys have the longest lines by far. I was working in the south bay and visited them and the line had to be an hour's wait long. i can see how the name of the truck formed. Luckily, I put in an order beforehand and I was good to go.
author: Glenn M.

description: The curry lamb stew was excellent.
author: Diana R.

description:
Food trucks know the way to my heart &&  Indian Fusion food is certainly one of those ways!

Their burritos are a hefty load of omgthisisSOOspicy...butican'tstopeatingit. They had a burrito featured at the Food Festival this year and it took all 5 people who came with me to tackle that baby down [it is a load to take on yourself... a delicious, yet ridiculously AMAZING load]

The crowned jewel of fantastical amazing comes in the form of Sexy Fries. My roommate and I visited the Dragon Boat races last weekend and were pleased to see that this food truck was here [I've been wanting to revisit since my last experience]. I was debating whether or not to get anything... but since the dude taking orders was adorable I decided to jump for those Sexy Fries. 

The service was quick. AND THEY TAKE CREDIT CARDS. AWESOME. 

Let me just tell you, it is rare for me to take a bite out of something and be AMAZED by what is going on in my mouth. I have eaten a ton of food in my day... but... these fries, MY GOD. I dream about them. My roommate can't stop talking about them. I think this is what love feels like. 

Sweet potato criss cut fries topped with chicken tikka masala, cheese, and onions. BAMM!!! WANT WANT WANT all the time!

I've already spread the word by mouth for everyone to try this item... in fact, try it all. The service is great and the food is phenomenal and everything is under $10. 

Curry Up Now... You make me proud.
author: Megan V.

description:
I eat at this truck about once a week. Get there early or later. THE LINE IS INSANE.

All the burritos have consistently great taste, but they are oversized. Sometimes I ask if they could just put less in the burrito, and I get weird looks in response, and then the burrito comes out normal size. They could sell the burritos a lot smaller for a little less. It just seems wasteful; I know many who say they just can't finish the damn thing. -1

Also, I understand the need to facilitate the line, but I'm not a fan of them making a bunch of burritos in advance and stacking them on top of each other.

Then sometimes you want some of those extra sauces on the side, and you grab your little sauce cups and they give you a *squirt* of extra sauce, no where near filling the container. Meaning I would have to get like 5 little sauce cups to have enough for my burrito, or you're just wasting plastic by not giving me enough sauce. Again, wasteful. -1

 Aside from my gripes, this is a solid, quick, & inexpensive choice for lunch in downtown during the week. Just be ready for a big meal.
author: Harold C.

description: I caught them at the Thursday night food cart scene in the Haight. Man, it was tough to choose one truck to eat my dinner from, but something about Indian food rolled up into a portable pouch was really attractive. I had the $7 Tikka Masala burrito with Paneer and was delighted to eat the other side for lunch the next day. A generous portion for a girl tummy. Its stuffed with rice, garbanzo beans, and big hunks of paneer (a less pungent version of feta, I think)...all doused in spicy Tikka Masala, and surprisingly not-messy the way they bundle it up so well. One of the most exotic and scrumptious burrito experiences of my life. If you're skeptical, take the plunge and you won't be sorry. It's just one of those San Francisco things...
author: Nique F.

description:
Order the Chicken Tikki Masala Burrito. 

That's all.
author: Jason W.

description:
As I've explained to friends - the mood needs to be properly set for me to write a good, comprehensive review. Like a romantic evening things like lighting, temperature and ambiance need to all perfect. 5,000 or so tea lights, flower pedals scattered...err, anyway...well sometimes you just need to launch into it because I have to absolutely gush about how delicious and utterly satisfying my Paneer Kathi Roll was today from Curry Up Now. This is my...4th time visiting...but today's delicious $6 delectable fare had such character, such diversity of flavor and was so savory that I couldn't help but just get this review out now within minutes of the last bite. 

I've previously had the paneer tikka masala burrito and their samosas but this Kathi roll just blew me away. I couldn't put it down - good thing it wasn't larger. This place really executes - it's amazing what can be done in a truck these days. While I love a nice extravagant indian dinner with 5 different kinds of naan, saffron rice, all kinds of curries etc. - this satisfies the fix abundantly especially at lunch time and right outside my office. Nicely done.
author: Ross R.

description:
The food is spicy (based on my Korean standards)!!  Curry Up Now doesn't feel authentically Indian and never tries to be  (it's a freaking taco truck selling Indian burritos).  Call it Indian fusion... or call it SF Indian.  Either way, you get flavorful spicy food comprised of new and innovative combos that are both easy on the wallet (for SF) and tasty & fun!  

A huge plus is that the menu is very basic.  Only two real dishes - a Chicken Tikka Masala or Paneer Tikka Masala burrito and an interesting Samosa spin.  I had the CTM burrito for $7.50.  I love simple menus, since I'm both indecisive and want to know that I'm getting the tastiest item on the menu (can't go wrong when they only have a few choices!).

Get here before noon, otherwise the line will be crazy long.

I would give this place 4 stars, but... I'm bummed that I was recovering from a stomach bug and it made me uneasy about ordering anything on their spicy menu.  Thankfully, no major stomach pains! It would've been nice to not have spent my entire afternoon in fear that anything I could've ordered might have put me over the edge. Sigh of mixed relief...?
author: Hannah C.

description:
wow!! first time to try pork belly curry burrito.

amazing!

you have got to try this!!! enough said.
author: Becky U.

description: Amazing chicken tika masala buritto! My only critique is that they say they take credit cards, but their truck was covered with papers saying "cash only."  The burrito was kind of worth the $3 ATM fee.
author: Anne R.

description:
"Do you Mexican food take Indian food to be your lawfully wedded food partner?" -Si!
"Do you Indian food take Mexican food to be your lawfully wedded food partner? -Haan!
The two consummate the marriage and later have a baby named Curry Up Now (CUN for short).

This is what happened in my dream when two of my favorite foods got together and did the mating dance.

You just can't go wrong when you mix Mexican and Indian food to make a Chicken Tikka Masala burrito or Paneer burrito.  This burrito is just too damn tasty.  The flavor is on point with what I expect from Indian food.  When you get a complete bite of the rice, tortilla, sauce and chicken all together, that is when you get the full flavor of the burrito.  If you can't stand spicy food, I recommend getting the regular spice burrito.  The spicy option can be pretty damn spicy (make sure to have your choice of beverage in hand) but even that didn't stop me from putting down the burrito.

When I'm not in the mood for one of their burritos, I go for the deconstructed Paneer Samosa.  Just as the name implies, it's a samosa, just deconstructed.  That means you're getting a plate of garbanzo beans, samosa wrapper, paneer, and their special sauce that brings it all together to complete this awesome Indian dish.  The smell of  it compliments each bite that you take, making you want some more.
 
Thank you Curry Up Now for always satisfying my cravings...
author: Suzi K.

description:
I had the chicken kathi roll from Curry Up Now yesterday for lunch. It's become an instant favorite for lunch when I'm in a hurry in San Francisco. 

The line moves really quickly and the wrap was just delicious. I have no idea what was inside, but really, who cares when it's so spicy and tasty. Yum.

I'll definitely come back again to share the tikka masala burrito with someone--as the portion is enormous. Can't wait to come back again!
author: Patricia Q.

description:
I had the chicken masala wrap at CUN because I've heard so many good things about it.  I decided to make my way down to Civic Center one Friday and try it.  The verdict: It's good, but its heart burn city in a wrapped in a tortilla.

I'll come back if I'm craving for Indian food and have no access to one nearby.
author: Y L.

description: Been excited to try this truck.  Got the Chicken TIkka Burrito.  Quick service as they are premade, but still fresh due to the turnover.  I went a bit before noon to avoid the crowd.  I thought it was good, but a bit too much liquidity for my liking, something I like in an investment portfolio, but not in a burrito.  Chicken was nice quality and while I enjoyed the flavor, I got a bit bored by the end.  I might try another item here, but for this particular one, I would give only a middle of the road rating.
author: Marc S.

description:
This is by far the easiest restaurant/food stand to find in San Francisco. 

You can smell curry from blocks away and there is usually a long long of people anxiously waiting to place their orders. 

I'm a rookie and figured I would read reviews before heading over. Three of us stood patiently with streets still littered with ticker tape and Giants signs on the windows of local businesses. 

I went with the Tikka Marsala Burrito. It came out in a flash. But I have to say, that was about the best part. The burrito itself was just "ok" and even though I said "careful with the curry", that was really the only ingredient I tasted. 

Yes, the line is a long one but it does move quite rapidly. Your order is ready for pickup within seconds and the prices very reasonable (especially when you aren't the one picking up the tab). 

I smell like curry and I think my suit might be in serious need of a good dry cleaning.
author: V B.

description: I just ate the spiciest chicken burrito on earth.
author: Nicole L.

description: Perhaps I ordered the wrong item from the menu but the samosa chat was ok, not the best I've had, nor the worst.
author: Najah Q.

description:
and there goes my waistline...as my plethora of followers know (including myself, about 1 person), i have a love/hate relationship with this franchise.  the food is uber fantastic, but the trucks are MIA unless it's a popular location.  the later issue is no issue now!  

there has been a slew of growth in the mission.  this gets a big fat thumbs up with chutney on top.  no frills, super duper tasty, and *gasp* cheap!  way more choices than the food trucks, and the quality is going to give valencia st a kick in the ass for quality/value.  see ya later Dosa.  Udupi hut...no need to eat your crappy food and come out smelly.  Amber India, you should be going out of business soon?  Pakwan, lookout.  Aslam's Rasoi...yeah you still rock.  

sweet potato fries with paneer...what the f is that?!  thali platter was great.  oh the burritos, you make my bits tingle.  i mean i can't rave enough.  with so many dud restaurants popping up here taking advantage of the rich generics in the city, it's refreshing to know there's someone who still delivers quality.
author: A A.

description:
Extremely hot and a bit soggy but good.

I also think they should offer a smaller sexy fries but that is just my opinion.

Get there before 11:30 and the wait is tolerable.

I was warned that the burrito\ was spicy, took care of that with rice and peaches from Lees'
author: Sean C.

description:
I've been coming since they first started off in Burlingame and only had one truck. Yep, I'm cool. 

Every time I'm home I always look up where the trucks is located at. Luckily for me it was in Burlingame today and I stopped by. The last couple times I've been ordering the Paneer Tikka Masala Burrito. Last time my burrito was too spicy I was sweating eating it. This time it wasn't spicy, but there were too many beans in my burrito. I'm pretty sure I counted over 50. 50 beans in a burrito? Okay, enough with the complaining of the beans. I just thought it was strange how one time they gave me beans, and another time they didn't. 

Other than that my paneer burrito was pretty big and super delicious. 

Only 4 stars for putting beans in my burrito.....or because they are inconsistent on the spiciness.
author: Sean W.

description: Burrito is not bad , but  overpriced . Sloppy workers here ,   I've gotten a bone in my burrito before.  Additionally ,  the last time I went their dinky credit card thing mis-swiped  triggering a fraud alert on my account & my credit card to be declined . Gave them another card which they overcharged about a dollar.   I'd  avoid this place .
author: Ted J.

description:
Yum! I had the Chicken Tikka Masala burrito and it was excellent. They didn't skimp on the spice, the garbanzo beans were amazing and the chicken was tender. Is it expensive? Somewhat but you have to remember this is the financial district and the price for eating out is always higher. I can't wait to go back and try to Paneer Burrito. 

Beware though, there is always a line and they are always pretty slow at making a burrito. They do take Credit Card though!
author: Enoch L.

description:
my old roomie raved about curry up now, but I never had the chance to try. right when I walked into the sf street food festival, I saw the curry up now truck and made a beeline. 

it's so simple, but SO FUCKING GOOD! chicken tikka masala and rice wrapped up in a flour tortilla. that's it. why is it so good? the curry is on point with flavor. when you make something right, it can stand on its own, and anything added is just a yummy bonus. big burrito is $8, super affordable. absolutely lived up to the hype!
author: Angela L.

description:
The food here is really good.  The line that stretches around the block should be evidence enough.  In fact, be prepared to wait a loooong time in that line because these folks are not magicians and demand is very high.  

Top marks go to the good people who work in the truck.  It's not easy to maintain a positive attitude when the hordes are clamoring for your goods, but these folks are as chipper as can be and it really is nice.  They are popular enough that they could easily take on a 'curry nazi' attitude and people would still line up, so good on them for staying kind.
author: Lester B.

description:
I went to OTG Upper Haight and was stuffed from all the other goodies there, however I ordered a Chicken Tikka Masala Burrito to go for lunch the next day.  Well, I actually cut it into two halves and had half of it only since it was sooo big (definitely share the burrito especially if you are at OTG and need to save room for other treats).  Anyway, the burrito was still delicious the next day.

The burrito is basically just tortilla wrap filled with chicken tikka masala and rice.  What makes it so special you ask?  I think it's just because the tikka masala is so flavorful with the perfect blend of spices.  Also, since they don't have different condiments that usual burritos offer, they are able to make their burritos ahead of time, essentially eliminating the wait time that most other food trucks have.

If you've read my reviews before, you'll know that I love spicy foods.  My boss had told me how spicy their burritos are and boy are they spicy.  I got the regular (meaning I did not ask for extra spicy) and it had a very good kick to it.  Actually, it was more like a punch and if it was any spicier, I probably wouldn't have enjoyed it as much.  I just feel sorry for those poor unsuspecting people trying it for the first time, especially those who cannot handle heat, lol.  

If you love spicy foods, you have to try the burritos from Curry Me Up!
author: Katelynn L.

description:
Okay, I had to downgrade my review because I am a little upset over some changes. First of all, they raised their prices, and I cannot help but think that my burrito from the truck is financing their restaurant which I am not nor will I ever attend.  Also, the burritos are slightly smaller than yestermonth.

The change that makes me the most sad is that instead of taking customer names, they are now using an impersonal number system. I just think Curry Up Now needs a little reality check and needs to keep their grass roots awesomeness....

One positive that I haven ot yet utilized is that you can order online instead of waiting in line.
author: Caitlin H.

description:
Without a doubt my new favorite lunch spot. Can't eat it too often though...it's way too rich for regular consumption.

The chicken tikka masala burrito is simply genius. They have the perfect chicken to sauce ratio (more chicken and less sauce as compared to a typical restaurant order) as to not be too saucy/messy. Add in some onions, beans (channa masala?) and rice, and BOOM! You have an orgasm in your mouth. 

One thing I especially like about this place is that their burrito isn't as huge as a Chipotle one. Chipotle burrito will guaranteed take you down for the afternoon, but this one isn't necessarily the case. 

Other perks I like here: credit cards typically accepted, Mexican coke, online/iphone ordering (haven't tried but I hear it works fine),

Oh, and their hot sauce will burn your face off. This coming from a guy that regularly orders Thai spicy/extra spicy at Thai and Indian restaurants...
author: Farhad M.

description:
No, I am not just giving them 5 stars because they messed up on our order and ended up giving us double of everything to makeup for it. 

+Stars for GREAT Customer Service.

But I am also giving them 5 stars because there's no one else that makes Tikki Masala/Butter Chicken Burritos or fries as sexy as theirs so there's really no comparison or room for improvement. 

I was full for days.
author: Spring L.

description:
Dear CUN, 

I tweeted you wanting to know when you were coming to the East Bay. You tweeted back saying something was in the works. This weekend you made my dreams come true by showing up at the Eat Real Fest, but alas, my dream is fleeting and you are no longer here. Please come visit me often, I love your chicken tikki masala burrito and need you to be closer to me. 

Hurry back to this side of the bay, 

chum elle roi L
author: Chum L.

description:
Met my friend for lunch at 12:20pm today. The line wasn't long, only 3 or 4 people in front of us (probably because of the rainy weather). The line went pretty fast and the burritos are all pre-made and ready to go. 

I got the chicken tikka masala burrito and a mango lassi. The burrito is delicious. There are large chunks of tender chicken and the rice is moist and flavorful from the curry sauce. I liked that that there were garbanzo beans too. The mango lassi is pretty good- full of mango flavor, not overly sweet, but a tad too thick for my taste. 

I tried a bite of my friend's sexy fries which are sweet potato fries topped with chicken tikka masala and cheese. Ehh, they weren't that good and the fries weren't crispy at all. For a few more dollars, I'd rather get a burrito which is much more filling.
author: Wanda K.

description:
oh my goodness...the paneer burrito is just fucking amazing. the cubes of paneer are creamy and plentiful, nestled within the saucy, spicy rice. the onions and chickpeas add the final touch. this is a bomb of curry, cheesy goodness, with delicious varied textures and deep, spicy flavors. and the plain yogurt that they provide on the side, complements it SO so perfectly. one of these filled me up for 10 hours. 

curry up right NOW!!
author: Jessica C.

description:
DECONSTRUCTED CHICKEN SAMOSA!!!!!!

FTW!!!!!!

Big major bonus points for parking around the corner from where I work. I overheard a group raving about their sexy fries... so that's a definite try for tomorrow's lunch. I can't wait!
author: Summer R.

description:
This is my go-to food when I feel down. Or hungover. Whichever.  Their Tikka Masala burrito is one huge hunk of spicy love. And you're full like 1/4 of the way through it but it is THAT GOOD, you can't stop eating it. Paired with a yum-o mango lassi....that's a fine lunch in the FiDi folks!

Knocking 1 star off for the ordering app never seeming to work...ever.
author: Kristin H.

description:
Worthy!

I think the burritos here can't help but be wrapped a bit too loosely, but that's okay.  Just expect to make a mess.

My favorite would have to be the deconstructed samosas followed by the sweet potato waffle fries topped with chicken tikka masala, onion and cheese.  So good!

I just wish it were easier to get my fix during work down in the South Bay via the Sunnyvale truck.  Their San Mateo store is too far for me so I won't be going there regularly.
author: Chris E.

description:
This place is fabulous! We got in line at this truck at the Eat Real Festival in Oakland, thinking it sounded good, but unsure of how good an Indian-food-truck would be. So good, that's how good! We got the Deconstructed Paneer Samosa and Paneer burrito, and man they were so tasty! They were just spicy enough, and had all the good chutneys and whatnot right there w/ them. 

This place wasn't that expensive, and vegan friendly. I really hope to go again.
author: Sadie G.

description: Tried their Chicken Tikka Marsala Burrito and it was pretty good. The chicken was very tender, the pricing (8 dollars in FiDi) was fair, and the burrito had a rich, wholesome flavor going for it. The normal burrito is also fairly spicy, so be sure to take that into account when you're ordering if you're not into spicy foods.  The line was pretty long (around 20 minutes at 1PM), so I'd recommend ordering online so you don't have to wait.
author: Nevin L.

description:
Um, how does a restaurant get this good? Curry Up Now shocks and amazes each customer with an array of Indian fare that, when stacked up against other Bay Area competitors, stands head and shoulders above the rest. Each dish is prepared with care and a sheer love for food, a combination that must go with each and every restaurant in order to guarantee it's success. Curry Up Now shows just how good a food truck can be, and exemplifies how Indian street fare still has it's place in every person's modern tuned palate.

The example I choose to use is the Tikka Masala burrito, a strange yet quite effective method which combines traditional Indian cooking techniques and spices with the ever-popular Mexican fusion spin. Stuffed inside a delicious, warm tortilla rests piles of white rice turned curry yellow from the meat resting overtop. The juices and sauces seep into the rice, turning it into a medley of flavors that explode inside your mouth before ever tasting a bite of the meat itself. Once the meat is added to the mix, though, the level is turned up with the textures and added flavors of the protein melding with the already present rice and curry slurry.

If this has not convinced you of Curry Up Now's prowess, just give them a try for yourself. Their San Francisco based truck and fixed San Mateo location are waiting for your visit - and for your approval. I mean, after all, how could you fail such promising company. Each item on their menu will earn your bill of support, and will be sure to leave you coming back for more.
author: Garrett P.

description:
Holy flamin' buttcheeks.  I love me some curry but my tummy [and bowels] aren't such huge fans [sorry TMI].  I proceed with caution when it comes to Indian or other heavily spiced foods, but seriously, I'm willing to risk it all when it comes to their Tikka Marsala Burrito.  

So. Damn. Good.  Flavor explodes in your mouth with every bite and eventually your head feels like exploding because that thing is SPICY!  Yes, I'm a wimp when it comes to that too, but you know what?  This thing is so good, it's worth all the pain, during and after.  What's that song...hurts so good?  Mmhmm..
author: Heidi L.

description:
I always look forward to every other Friday when Curry up Now is in front of City Hall with Off the Grid. Their food is perfectly spiced and satisfies my Indian Street Food carvings everytime.  Not for the light hearted as all of their dishes pack quite a punch.

-*Chicken Tiki Masal Burrito (Fresh La Palma Flour Tortillas with your choice of filling. Inside: Methi [fenugreek & turmeric rice] Pulao, Pickled Onions.) $8
-Deconstructed Samosa (Inside out samosa, garbanzo beans, pico de gallo, pickled onions, cilantro & mint chutney) $6
-*Make it a combo :Mango Lassi & Samosa $4

* = Favorite
author: Stacey L.

description:
CHICKEN TIKKA MASALA IN A BURRITO? SOOOOO YUMMY!

tried it randomly one friday at Off the Grid at Fort Mason since we were so hungry while waiting in line for Chairman Bao. didn't know what to expect and slightly nervous about eating indian street food (i have a sensitive stomach). 
turns out this burrito is my favorite of all the street foods i've had in sf. i love the spiciness but it can be intense if you're not used to spice. 

to all you people who wait in that huge line for Chairman Bao - there are better foods there!!!
author: Vy D.

description:
Came back today to try the deconstructed samosa. The line was short close to 1pm and thank god for that because I was starving! The chicken deconstructed samosa was $6 and pretty darn fantastic. The portion filled me right up and came in one of those biodegradable to-go containers. Thumbs up for being green! The kind lady even warned me to hold it upright as to not spill anything.

The chicken chunks were incredibly moist/flavorful and came apart easily. It also included pieces of bite-size samosas, curried chick peas, potatoes, and a mix of chutneys. On the bottom laid a layer of pastry normally used to wrap samosas as well to complete the "deconstruction". My only complaint was that there was quite a bit of oil that soaked the pastry from the curry. But in the end, all the salty, sweet, spicy flavors came together beautifully and I was very happy! 

Great value for a satisfying lunch!
author: Karen Y.

description:
My favorite food is burritos. My second favorite is Indian food. Holy.Mother.

This was so good I can't even describe it. I got the hella vegan burrito and I woke up wondering how I could have another today.

Even if you're not a vegetarian, try the hella vegan one. It's so good. It has rice, chickpeas, samosa, potatoes, tomatoes and onions that are either pickled or marinated in some kind of tangy sauce, green curry and some other amazing sauce.

Ridiculously good.
author: Osh J.

description:
YUM!

While standing in line, I checked the reviews to get the low-down on just how spicy this place is, and I saw the helpful review from my friend Lisa W.!  She pointed out that you should definitely make sure to ask for spicy if that's what you want, and this was still true today.  My coworkers who did not ask for spicy did not have the same, sublimely delicious experience that I did. :)

I got the Chicken Tikka Masala burrito and a mango lassi.  Not only was the mango lassi delicious, tangy, and sweet -- it was also a *very* important part of my meal.  I absolutely love preposterously spicy food, but you'll need the lassi to help make sure your mouth isn't burning long after you're done with your burrito.

The burrito was delicious.  Creamy tikka masala, big chunks of chicken, and it was very balanced throughout (cuz don't you hate when everything's at one end of the burrito?).

The Spiciness:
It was delicious.  If you're someone who can really handle spice, don't be scared, you'll definitely survive and then some.  Don't settle for anything less!
If you're not *as* keen on spicy, maybe don't get it spicy the first time.  I'm told the mild version was still not exactly mild.

I'll be back!
author: David W.

description:
Burritos are $8, which is a little on the steep side for me. But good thing the burritos are very large so at least you get full. 

I had the Chicken Tikka Masala which was good for the first few bites and then the flavor sort of plateaued. To me, overall the flavor was a little too simple and mediocre. And yes, the burritos are really spicy but I enjoyed the spice. 

I do commend the staff for being super fast and friendly.  Since I love food trucks so much, I have to sometimes remind myself that not all food trucks are created equal.
author: Leslie W.

description:
Note: according to Charles L., Curry Up Now now allows you to customize the amount of spice you want!

Wish I knew this before I was shamed by my friends after bragging that the burrito would make them all cry, and then biting into a much-milder burrito than I had in the past. 

Friendly suggestion - please have the cashier ask your patrons if they'd like their food spicy or mild! Keep it up CUN, and see you soon.
author: Lisa W.

description:
I went around 12 so the line was kinda long.  Don't believe your friends when they say spicy "isn't that spicy," because it is HELLA hot! I got the chicken masala burrito in spicy and I couldn't finish it because it was so damn spicy and I thought I could eat pretty spicy!!! 

It is good but next time I'll get mild or something.  I heard people getting extra spicy...bunch of cray crays after that you can't even taste anything!
author: H H.

description: For a food truck I would say this is as good as it gets! My boyfriend ordered Chicken Tikka Masala Burrito for 7.50 - good size and very tasty. It had a kick to it. If you can't eat spicy this is not for you. It is pretty much your chicken tikka masala dish at an Indian restaurant in a burrito form. Probably the best truck for your money. I ordered garlic noodles at An to go and it was the same price as the burrito. Best bang for your buck!
author: Sarah C.

description: This is a fun food truck, bringing together two my two favorite cuisines. The samosas were about as good as samosas get. The Vegan Burrito was hearty and exploding with flavor. If I ordered it again, I'd ask them to go easy on the tamarind chutney because a dude wants to taste everything he's eating.
author: Dan R.

description:
Food is pretty good.  Decent value.  Line moves quickly.

But DEAR VISHNU was there some heat that I wasn't expecting...

Like most people, I got the chicken tikka masala burrito.  My stomach can't handle spicy at all so it would have been nice to know that there was some kick ahead of time.  Instead, I ate the burrito anyways (like the moron that I am) and paid for it later.
author: Patrick C.

description:
Where do you draw the line between going to to a restaurant versus a taco truck? The whole reason why people go to these trucks is because of one thing and one thing only.  PRICE.  If your price point is the same as restaurants then why not go to a restaurant?  Why would you want to eat on the streets?

Great concept!!!  I came here twice already so I got to sample most of the items on their menu.  Samosa was good, burrito was excellent, but the wrap for 6.50?!?  To put things in perspective..............the wrap is probably twice as small but cost the same as a burrito.  The wrap is more like a taco than anything else.  Portions were small and price was high.  Taste, however, was great.  Honestly, I would probably go to a taqueria at this point and pay less. 

1 beef wrap and 1 chicken tikka wrap = 12.50.  

Bottom line.  I would get their burrito but I would definitely pass on their wraps.
author: jason g.

description:
Indian food in a food truck. Awesome. 

Had the deconstructed chicken samosa and shared a chicken tikka masala burrito. The samosa was HUGE! For $6 or so that is a meal in itself. I didn't think it would fill me up but it did so I saved the burrito for another day's lunch. Heated up in the microwave it was still yummy tasty indian goodness. 

They take cash and credit.
author: Julie F.

description:
Dude. Chicken curry burrito? C'mon now.

Delicious. Wow. Those are the words that popped out of my mouth upon sampling the deconstructed samosa and tikka masala burrito at SactoMofo.

This was my personal favorite from the event. Good flavor, a good heat that builds on you. How can you go wrong with that? You can't, that's how. I was especially wowed by the samosa. Flavor that leaps up and wallops you in the mouth.

Curry Up Now, I'm issuing my warning to you now. I am coming to SF, and I will find you. I will be hungry. Have food ready.
author: Sam B.

description:
I ate at this truck during Off The Grid at Fort Mason. Lots of hype for it and with such a cool name, I had to try it! After much contemplation between a deconstructed samosa and a tikka masala buritto, my friend and I finally decided to split a paneer tikka masala burrito. 

For those who like their food spicy... this will hit the spot. But for me, an individual who does NOT dig spicy food, it didn't quite titillate my palate. We asked for a mildly spicy burrito and it was so hot we thought they gave us the spiciest one on accident. I could feel my lips burning! We brought it back to the truck to get a less spicy one and it was confirmed that the one given to us was indeed the "mild" version; however, they still gave us another burrito anyways. So, at least I can confirm that the customer service is good! 

The second tikka masala burrito was slightly less spicy than the first one, but still too spicy for my friend and I to finish. After a few bites, our mouths were so on fire we couldn't even taste anything anymore. Sadly, we ended throwing the remainder of our burrito away. I was so ready to love it too, as paneer tikka masala is one of my favorite dishes. My honest opinion of Curry Up Now is probably more in the 2-star range, but since I probably would have enjoyed it more if I had a higher spice tolerance and since the customer service was awesome...I'll give it 3!
author: Natasha H.

description:
Delicious tikka masala burrito. You're going to pay around $9 for it, but it is gigantic. Hell, you could even make two meals out of it if you show some self-restraint.

But where's the fun in that?

I am happy to report that I tried it at the mini Off the Grid event that happens in my neighborhood at Haight and Stanyan every couple of weeks. Great event, and Curry Up Now is definitely a must-have when you go.
author: Katie S.

description:
Their truck is outside my office in South San Francisco every Thursday.  Today was my first stab at the chicken tikka masala burrito I've heard so much about.
Fun.  Spicy.  Different.
But I think I'll stick to burritos on Wednesdays and chicken tikka masala with naan on Thursdays.  
(I'll gladly pay you Tuesday for a hamburger on today btw.)
Thumbs up for Thums Up, and the wacky Kurkure chip type things (with a recipe for eating them out of ice cream cones on the bag).
author: Jennifer D.

description:
Currycoma and curry breath are worth it when you're eating Curry Up Now's tikka masala burritos. For $7.50 you get one big burrito that for me lasts about 2 meals. When I first tried Curry Up Now the spice level was way over the top, like my lips are majorly burning and "I need milk badly" status. Fortunately, I think they realized the California crowd can not handle such heat so the regular spice has been toned down. And thank goodness because the burritos are so good that upon getting it from the truck all I want to do is scarf it down and before when it was so hot I just couldn't do it. But enough of my weak sauce status. The burritos are great. They're filled with spiced rice, tikka masala sauce, chicken (or paneer), and garbanzo beans. The seasoning is just right, and the tikka masala is the perfect balance of salty with sweetness. There's a decent helping of meat inside and is not overloaded with garbanzo beans, I would say they do a pretty good job of mixing it all around because every bite has a little of everything. The tortilla's they use are great and sturdy too so you're not dealing with a messy deconstructed burrito when you're taking it on the go. So good, have indulged in this probably more than 3 times.

X-tra Special: Tikka Masala Fries! This combo kicks animal style fries and carne asada fries butts. Surprisingly delicious! The order is $7.50, could easily be your entree, no way you could eat this AND a burrito - and has waffle cut sweet potato fries topped with cheese, chicken, tikka masala, and fresh onions. My order was smothered in sauce, the fries were almost unidentifiable. The tikka masala was slightly different than what you get in the burrito, I would say a tad sweeter, and the sweet potato fries add a little extra. While I liked the smothered sauce I kind of wish the fries had been on top or something so that they would have stayed crispier. They're all the rave, give it a shot yourself.
author: Nicole L.

description: I ordered on Grub Hub and was disappointed.  First off the food is delicious.  I go to the food truck downtown at work often.  I tried them on Grub Hub and my food arrived late, cold and smashed up.  I will still go to the food truck, but I will not order it for delivery again.
author: Lane W.

description:
Off The Grid Civic Center -- you are the death of me! ...in a good way :)
