I ordered the Chicken Tikka Masala Burrito.  Let me tell you that this burrito was bursting with flavor, more than filling (I brought leftovers home to my sister who asked if I brought home half of the burrito--it was actually 1/3 of it) and not really spicy at all but still very delicious.  Not sure why a lot of the people on here are complaining about the spiciness.  I mean, it IS Indian food (kind of)  so what do you expect?  I love love love spicy food!  

Bottom line, the burrito was delicious and reasonably priced at $7, so no complaints here.  Looking forward to trying other things on the menu.   Excellent job, Curry Up Now!   

FYI:  you might smell like curry after your meal!
author: C E.

description:
Ehhhhh as far as food trucks go, I'm jealous of the people who have long lunches and can afford to wait in line here because it does get pretty long

the food? just okay. My friend ordered the tikka masala burrito - pretty good, pretty spicy

i ordered the super version of this one - holy-my-body-and-bowels-hate-me-christ it is SPICY

I can handle my spice too, and i quit halfway, so unless you hate yourself and love bathroom breaks, avoid the spicy burrito.
author: Noah P.

description:
I basically spend my nights dreaming about the delicious food curry up now serves. it is amazing. it is orgasmic. if you have never tried it you are seriously depriving yourself of one of the most amazing meals ever. My only complaint ever would be that they're spiceyness is not dependable. But I think that is because I have visited different carts with presumably different staff. either way, loosen your belt a little and give curry up now a try.

also, they have an awesome iphone app, so you can order without standing in line or calling in. I'd like to see if you favorite street food cart has that? yeah, didn't think so.
author: Allyson S.

description:
Date: Wednesday, Sept. 22 

Time: 12:20pm 

Number of people in line ahead of me: About 30 

Total wait time: 25 minutes 

That should give you a pretty good idea of how long you'll have to wait for your food. Bottom line, come early if you don't have time to wait. This place is seriously popular with the FiDi crowd. 

The good news is that once I ordered, I was handed my delicious chicken tikka masala burrito before I even received my change. Nice! 

I love the idea of a nouveau-Indian roach coach, minus the roaches. These guys must pull in some serious dough. The food is high quality with the perfect blend of spices & spiciness (I didn't order the spicy version, after reading other Yelper's reviews). 

Follow them on Twitter so you know when they're in town.
author: Erin S.

description:
I had this months ago at Off The Grid and I was thrilled that my favorite food (indian)  was given a new twist. 
The pros: The burrito is huge! My sister and I split it and were both full 
They have super friendly people working the trucks which is something that always makes me want to come back 
The mild was still very spicy but it gave it a good kick and i enjoyed it 
The samosa  was nothing amazing but it was good

The cons: the mango lassi was disgusting - Now being Pakistani I know good mango lassi and this was bitter and watery. I ended up giving it away to my brother in law who drank it just because he didnt want to waste. Maybe they were rushing that day due to the lines but I don't think I would try it out again 

The lines: They need a better system to handle these lines because people were cutting in front of people and orders were getting messed up. One vegetarian woman was accidentally given a chicken burrito instead of paneer and the poor woman had to wait around 30 minutes to get the first burrito and around 45 min to have them fix her mistake... not ok. 
I waited all together (for one burrito, one lassi(shiver), and one samosa 45 min. This is a food truck so I think I immediately assumed it would be quicker to get food, but much to my dismay it wasn't.
author: shazia b.

description:
Oh, oh, they'll light your mouth on fire...

SPICIEST burrito I've ever eaten. No exaggeration!
author: Stephanie P.

description: sexy fries are freaking amazing. Great combo!
author: Adam V.

description:
Man I feel like I'm the one person in the group who didn't understand the punch line but feels obligated to laugh along. So I finally tried to Tikka Marsala burrito. Mind you I love Tikka Marsala with a passion. The rich ceamy texture and the spices. So when I got my burrito I was a tad dissapointed. It was more watery than creamy and though it was spicey it didn't have that strong tikka marsala flavor I love nor the creaminess. It was a bit watery if anything. Don't get me wrong it wasn't bad but I guess I'm just not in love with it like everyone else. 

Also when it's all said and done, it's still an 8 dollar burrito. Not exorbitantly expensive but if you went into a taqueria and especially a taco truck, you would think that is a bit pricey for a burrito. 

Will I go back? Probably. Am I rushing to go back? Not really.
author: Hyung L.

description:
I am going to agree with my buddy John C and say that this is one of the best food trucks around. Anywhere.

Chicken Tikka Masala burrito is fantastic and the addition of Sexy Fries to the menu makes this place gets even better!

The line can be long, but they do move fairly quickly, considering the size, although I order ahead if I remember. 

Also, try the Thums Up! soda (it reminds me of RC and yes, I spelled the name correctly)
author: Brett W.

description:
I WANT to give y'all 1 star, but that isn't fair, at all. Read why? I really don't care.

Monday September something...
(it was this week I don't even know what todays date is.) 

Prologue: 
 Lunch time, I had just bought a savory crepes, which sucked, only because I can't seem to remember that I don't like savory crepes, they always sound amazing on paper and my stomach tricks all my other sense... anyways, as I decided to throw away my crepes I get an email from my friend: 

"Friends Email:  (subject) dear mr. head crasher. 

"dinner tonight from a foodie bus machine?
http://www.curryupnow.com/blog/monday-night-football-bloodhound-sf/" "

I responded with yeah, and that I was starving after failed crepes lunch cart venture. 

Actual-log?:

I meet up my friend that night at bloodhound and we order. 

Me - Whats good?
Cute Indian Girl in Food Truck - something something something... words. (I wasn't paying attention, I just stared at her, creepy I know)
Me- I'll have that (some veggi thing, cheese... this isn't a very good quoted dialog)
CIGiFT - regular or spicy?
Me- How spicy is spicy? Can I taste a sample?
CIGiFT- No, but it's pretty spicy. 
Me- eheheuhhhuuhmmmmmm SPICY!
CIGiFT- Are you sure? It's really spicy. 
Me- Yeah! I like spicy, I drench my food in siracha(sp) and all that stuff all the time. 
CIGiFT- This isn't siracha(sp). It's really spicy. 
Me- I can handle it. 
CIGiFT- Ok, but don't come crying back to me when it's too spicy. 
Me- Ok. 

HOLY SHIT! LISTEN TO THEM! That curry burrito was spicy as all hell. There were times where I was just inhaling pre bite and it tasted like chemical war-fare was taking place in that curry burrito. 

friend: how are you doing?
me: why would they even offer this?!

Seriously, why would they even offer that... why?! BECAUSE IT WAS MOTHER F'N DELICIOUS! Lips, gums, throat... all on fire, but enjoying every minute of it. I don't finish burritos... don't like eating that "burrito butt," and this time, I was glad I didn't because I am sure that all that heat was just at the bottom, waiting for me so it could spring an attack and kill me.
author: danny e.

description:
Stood in the rain for my first Chicken Tikka Masala burrito and it was worth it. It was more than worth it. the burrito was spicy and the perfect combination of flavors. 

There are no words for how much I love this food truck.
author: Denise A.

description:
Oh man, I seriously thought this was one of the worst meals I've had in awhile.  The truck is located right around the corner from my workplace, and there's always a crazy line.  And while I don't always buy into the hype, I figured with so many people, it had to at least be decent.  

After a 25 minute wait (and I lined up well before noon), I finally got to try their paneer burrito.  Waaaayyy too spicy, to the point where I could barely taste any of the other ingredients in the burrito.  I couldn't take the heat, and gave it to my friend to try, and she said the same thing.  

I almost added a second star, but that's only because the line to the nearby Mexican taco truck seems to have gotten shorter since Curry Up Now opened.  Could just be a coincidence.  Oh well, I love my Mexican taco truck!
author: Ernest S.

description:
If you don't like spicy, you won't like this.
I went with my co-worker to split a chicken masala burrito & an order of samosas. The samosas are supposedly vegan & really good, the perfect amount of spice for me. We ordered the burrito - not spicy - to share which doesnt mean its not spicy, it just means it won't blow your head off. The white sauce will cool it down too, sorta reminds me of chicken & rice stand in NYC...
author: Sara P.

description:
Curry Up Now is my favorite food truck and actually one of my favorite places to eat in the whole of SF, a pretty big deal considering all the great restaurants in the city.

I am totally addicted to the deconstructed paneer samosa, although they have a variety of vegan, vegetarian, and meat options available, which I'm told are all good. The "decon" is a lighter meal than the burritos (I love it so much I sometimes get two and completely stuff myself) and includes -- pardon the limits of my descriptive abilities -- a fried crust with potato and pea filling lining the bottom (that's the samosa), chickpeas, onions, tomatoes, and at least two different fantastically flavorful sauces (maybe three); this is what really takes it from good to mouth-blowing!

I highly recommend that you try it. Be careful, it can get spicy. They happily take cash and credit cards. Props for tax included in price.
author: Ashley L.

description: Very mediocre food, me being Indian know there is surely better chicken tikka masala elsewhere. Pretty disappointed with null flavor of any spice and chicken not well done......pull up your socks and get some recipe check for your food.
author: Bhawna V.

description: Got the butter chicken burrito tonight at Edgewood Eats and it was deeeelish. Was deciding between this and the paneer tikka masala burrito but decided to go with the chicken because of a very mediocre experience with paneer at another truck last week and because it was the special. The chicken was juicy and there was plenty of rice and a good amount of spice. Next time I'd like to try the paneer and/or the deconstructed samosa.
author: Kathy L.

description:
There's so much potential here.  Indian food = delicious.  Mexican food = can't turn it down.  What do you get when you combine the two together?? A hells YES, please!

I was sitting at work when my partner in crime informed me about the food truck that is Curry Up Now.  Forget the salad I was contemplating, I was off to get my Tikka Masala Burrito.

It was a decent size and I do love paneer (as I think all my reviews involving Indian food mention).  But...something was lacking...

I like things spicy, but I got a bit worried when my friend told me that I was asking for it if I got the spicy option so I settled for "medium."  There was no heat!  Actually, they never even asked what level of spiciness we wanted and I had to request that they make my friend's Chicken burrito spicy (I guess someone wanted a challenge!)

My burrito wasn't bland, but it was definitely missing that extra "oomph" and my friend who got the spicy burrito was still standing without breaking a sweat...maybe they toned down the spiciness because of all the reviews.

I'd definitely try it again...an Indian Burrito just sounds too amazing to give up on!
author: Alvina W.

description:
My co-workers and I were practically giddy with excitement when we went to try this place, thinking:

INDIAN + TACO TRUCK  = HOW COULD YOU GO WRONG?

Well it turns out you can go wrong. Mind you nothing tasted bad, it just wasn't...good. The "weird" burrito that I ordered was a mish-mash of ground beef (admittedly a tad sacrilegious for an Indian joint) rice and tiny samosas rolled into a tortilla. I don't doubt that each of these components would have tasted great if consumed separately but all put together they rendered a burrito that was just ehh. It also didn't help that this mediocre experience cost $8.75, more than the price for a delicious carne asada or lengua burrito at the taco truck around the corner.
author: Adrian W.

description:
I'm not really sure which Curry Up Now truck I went to... Because I went to a foodtruck event that was in Pleasanton. The really nice man told me they had never been to this part of the bay. And now, unfortunately, I cannot remember what his name was. And we had a whole conversation about it! The food was so great. And also, free! 
So this is what happened:
I had just finished working out and I was wearing my "Mama Cass" floral sundress. It's a baggy dress that looks better with a belt, but I was just wearing it all casual-like. Anyway, there's some little baby man in front of me. Actually, he was probably around the same age as me. And the guy taking the orders was all talking to him and they were like joking about how I made the rules and ran the relationship. And the guy in front of him was like yeah, I'm getting this for her. And I didn't really put it together because I'm "tontita" [a little dummy]. And they both looked at me and I smiled. Then I go up to order, and the guy was all, didn't your boyfriend just order? I was like uhhh..? And he was like, Oh... I just assumed. And I got a tiny bit creeped out. And I was just like, I've never met that man in my life. 
So I ordered the naughty naan. And he probably felt bad about an honest error and gave me free food.
author: Natalie C.

description: I'm belatedly updating my rating because the owner followed up with a helpful response.
author: Stephen G.

description: I tried their Deconstructed Chicken Samosa ($6) and was sadly disappointed.  I love samosas because of the potato filling, but this one was really lacking in the potato department.  It consisted mostly of chickpeas and chicken mixed in a murky sauce.  It's topped with mini samosas, which sounded great, until I realized those little samosas taste nothing like their normal sized counterpart. It was mostly just the fried flour skin, with barely any filling. I guess I should have tried their more popular Chicken Tikka Masala Burrito.
author: Jenny H.

description:
The chicken tikka masala burrito is amazing.  The balance of the flavors all wrapped up in a neat burrito is amazing.  

I've had it many times.  It's so good, it's all I ever have.  The rest of the food looks amazing, my wife loves the somosas, but the chicken masala burrito is freaking amazing and a must-eat in the Bay Area
author: Zakk D.

description: Rude and disinterested Indian guy at the food truck window. He seemed pretty pissed off that I was ordering only 1 samosa. They then squirted sweet sauce all over the crispy crust without as much as checking if thats what I wanted. Finally he handed it over with a loud "take this" and didn't care to notice I was trying to fish out my card to pay them. Pathetic service. Passable samosa.
author: Krishna K.

description: After reading all the reviews about their Chicken Masala Burrito I had to try this place. Too bad my spicy tolerance isn't as high as I thought it was, cause I had a flaming mouth for about at least 30 minutes after I finished eating it. $7 meal for Financial District? I'm a fan! Make sure to get here early though, the line gets long around noon.
author: Angela K.

description:
We had a spicy treat tasting Curry Up Now's Tikka Masala Burrito and the deconstructed samosa.

The tikka masala is spicy - but the chicken is moist and tender.  Make sure to have a drink or two to help wash it down.

I really didn't care much for the samosa...it tends to get soggy fast.
author: JJAMZ C.

description: I am in LOVE with the chicken tikka masala burito - it's chicken, rice, garbanzo beans, special sauce and deliciousness wrapped up in a giant tortilla. It definitely packs a spicy punch - this isn't for the faint of heart with spicey and it only comes in one spice level.  The burito is huge and is good for splitting at off the grid.
author: Christine B.

description:
It's alright, but I don't see what the hype is all about, really.  

For starters, the burritos aren't rolled very well, so you get a loose, lumpy mess.  Also, the filling is too saucy.  Thicken that shit up, yo!  It's street food by merit of the fact that it's purchased from a truck on the street, but it's too messy to actually eat out there.  

The mango lassi was pretty good though.

My ideal Indian burrito was, until recently, made by Bindi's a few blocks away.  For what ever reason, they've quit selling their spicy chicken wrap, thus creating a hole in my heart.  But that's a story for another review.

Anyway, Curry Up Now is alright, but I probably won't be back.
author: joe p.

description:
Sexy Fries w/ Chicken Tikka Masala: the chicken tikka masala was too salty. I ate about 1/4 of the sweet potato fries and switched with my friend who had the vegetarian burrito.

Vegetarian Burrito: sauce was lighter than the chicken tikka masala, tofu was good, but overall it was still too heavy for me. 

The first couple bites for both the dishes were good, but it became too much too soon. 

They accept payments by credit card here though :)
author: Cindy L.

description:
Chicken Tikka Masala Burrito! 
$5 at the Eat Real Festival in Jack London Square, Oakland.

Y:ou're easy,
U:ber spicy, and
M:ucho filling!
YUM!

I wish you came around Berkeley.
author: Lana N.

description:
SO FULL but SO HAPPY. This was AH-MAZING.

The Curry Up Now truck stops by on Thursday at the Genentech campus. This is the first time I've been because my coworkers really wanted to go and insisted on how delicious it was.

I ordered the Chicken Tikka Marsala burrito and a samosa. We also shared an order of their new chicken tikka fries (with waffle sweet potato fries). I finished the entire burrito, my samosa and had a couple of bites of the fries which completely bursted my stomach.

But it was worth it. The chicken is tender and juicy and there's just so much good flavour within the spices in the burrito. The spicy level is just enough to have that great kick but not overwhelm your taste buds. If it is too spicy for you, I suggest ordering the mild or getting yogurt (they have it in a little cup) to quell your taste buds. The tortilla that they use is also soft and fresh. The samosa had great taste, although I do recommend eating it as soon as it comes out. The mix of the meat, spices, chickpeas and potatoes is delicious. 

Next week's lunch - Curry Up Now!
author: Angela K.

description: The Dish: I've been meaning to try this truck for a while, but it wasn't until today I was able to. The CTM burrito is the bomb. Seriously. I was a fan of korean fushion type burritos, but Indian burritos are seriously good. It's actually not that messy and it definitely fills you up. The wait can be pretty long though - I got there around 11:50am/12pm and still, it took about 10 minutes. They are extremely fast with the orders though! If you like Indian food, you'll definitely love Curry Up Now.
author: Gina T.

description:
3.5 stars - I was going through my food truck/stand reviews and imagine my surprise when I realized I hadn't reviewed Curry Up Now.  I've braved the lines and have tried this truck twice at OTG Fort Mason.  Both times I had the Paneer Tikka Masala burrito, once regular and once spicy.

Some have commented here that they felt the regular spiced burrito had enough spice.  I didn't find that to be the truth at all; however, those that have referenced that the spicy burrito is indeed spicy are absolutely telling no lies.  I pride myself on my ability to handle spice (especially rare for a white girl like myself), but hot damn (pun intended) that burrito was SPICY.  Flavor wise, the burritos are not bland and the spices are generally well balanced.  My biggest issue with Curry Up Now is that after a few bites, the burritos become very one note.  If you surpass the mid way point in your burrito (and I have) you're really just giving into gluttony because the flavors just seem to blend together at that point.  I haven't tried any of their other offerings, but I would love it if they branched out a bit and included some different curry flavors, like a vindaloo or something.
author: Laura C.

description:
Chicken Tikka Masala Sweet Potato Fries.

Yeah, that happened.  And it was fricking delicious.
author: Shauna F.

description:
Omg chicken tikka masala is so good. Fast and clean, too, with the burrito wrap. Their spicy level is more intense than other Indian restaurants, so watch out for that. Also, there's almost always a long line, so plan accordingly.

I also recently just tried their Sexy Fries - amazing with the Tikka Masala sauce. Super soft and melts in your moth.
author: April Z.

description:
my boss: "Hey Darren, we're going to get some curry burritos, wanna come?"

Darren: "(curry burritos.........ddaaaa fuuuccckkkk???)..............Sure, I'll go"

"Curry Burritos"...I've only put the two in one sentence in my head once before:  "SOMEONE SHOULD FUCKIN MAKE CURRY BURRITOS!".  Never would have I imagined that a food truck would sell them across the street from my work building.

We walked up to the truck surrounded by a cluster fuck of lunch goers and my boss and coworkers continued to tell me about the food.  The menu was limited but I was assured that the quality was up to par.

We brought back the food to the office; sitting around the ping pong table in our rec room, I take a bite out of my Chicken Tikka Marsala Burrito and was completely blown away at how different it was from what I was expecting.  
The burrito tortilla acted as a conical plate to hold flavorful curry and tender chicken, nothing was over powering and the spice was at a comfortable hot/mild level.  The curry was so prominent in the food it was almost oozing out of the burrito, exactly what I wanted.  (Shit....i wanted curry and I fuckin got curry)  The chicken was soft and well flavored and the chic peas and other vegetables crunchy.

We all let out a hearty belch at the end of each of our burritos.   It was good.

I wouldve given 5 stars if there had been more of a selection, but I guess....if youre serving a milllion ppl in a window of 1 hour it might help to keep the menu slim.

4 stars Curry Up now
author: Darren D.

description:
I heard this place was good and its popularity quickly increasing in FiDi so I hurried my curry butt up and tried to do the smart thing by ordering online.  I may have saved time by ordering online, but probably not much.  

I'm pretty sure I smelled the truck before I saw it.  There was a huge crowd surrounding the truck- at least 25 people all waiting just to order, and maybe another 8 waiting to pick up their online orders.  Even though I ordered online, we still waited forever for our food.  They don't really make the online orders until you get there.  There was no official line really, just gotta shove your way up there and hope to get their attention.  Service is slow because there are only three people working in the truck and really, no more than three can fit and they are mighty busy.  

Be patient, because the wait sure pays off!  My Deconstructed Samosa with chicken was delish!  For just five bucks, I got the perfect amount of fiberlicious food for me to eat.  It was spicy but I didn't order the ultra hot.  I mean I still wanted to make it back to the office.  But even the medium was so spicy I swear steam was coming off my glasses.  Okay so it was kind of hot outside and I sat in the sun, but still.  My coworker ordered the Chicken Tikka Masala burrito.  It was so hot she couldn't eat it at all, so I let her have it, er some of mine, that is.  Luckily, she ordered a soda with her meal so she gave everything a THUMS UP.  We'll definitely be following this truck around town!
author: Stacey C.

description: My favorite food truck in the city.  Eating a deconstructed chicken samosa as we speak!
author: Amar P.

description:
DECONSTRUCTED SAMOSA? Say what? Oh, a chick pea, samosa, tender chicken stew. You are delicious. 

And it's a truck that takes credit card? Awesome!
author: Dee Y.

description: After going to the their new restaurant in San Mateo and finding out it was closed. Robert H and I decided to go their truck located on 225 Bush street in San Francisco. After finding the directions to the location of the truck. it closed at 2pm and we left at 1:30 and got there at about 1:52, I ordered a chicken tiki masla burrito, once i paid it was done a minute later! best indian food I had. I can't wait to go to the restaurant on a day it's open.
author: Brian B.

description:
Awesomeness wrapped in a tortilla!  I just had my first tikka massala veggie burrito and I am in LOVE.
It was spicy, filling, lively (though the onion peices are HUGE) and filled me right up!
Can't wait to go back~
author: Dangerous T.

description:
I really enjoyed this lunch. We went after 1 and there was only a couple people in front of us.  I ordered the Paneer Tikka Masala Burrito. It was SO GOOD. Not too spicy that I couldn't eat it. Just enough to feel the heat. It was definitely filling. I ate it for lunch and dinner and still had some leftover. I also tried the samosa, had it for dinner, reheated. It was a perfect blend of spice with a bit of sweetness in it. 

The mango lassi I had at lunch was just ok. I've had better. And it wasn't a full drink, the cup was only about 75% full and it was something like a $4 drink. I felt a little gypped.

Without the lassi, its only $9 and they were fast. I'd go back. 

Oh yeah, and it says they accept ccs but not when I went. Bring Cash.
author: Ping N.

description:
I waited almost one hour in line for this at off the grid! Crazy huh!
I wonder how they can provide all this chicken for all the tikka masala burritos. But it was tasty, spICY, warm, large, and filling.

$8 per burrito
author: Veranna N.

description: I had there Spinach Saag Burrito Special Spicy last week! It packs heat but it was delicious!
author: Kyle W.

description:
Chicken Tikka Burrito and Samosa ar amazing. Kathi roll is marvelous as well.
This is a great joint for people who love spicy. It's not that the food here is volcano hot but it's relatively spicy than other places, though if you want to heat things up for your taste buds, I strongly recommend a take of their spicy sauce on the side.
Must visit place.
author: Caroline G.

description:
i want to marry the chicken tikka masala sweet potato fries. 

- chicken is flavorful AND tender...and they're not stingy with it at all! way better than most restaurants
- credit cards accepted
author: Stephanie C.

description: I am absolutely shocked that people even patronize this dumpster truck.  I always see a long line waiting outside this truck so I never tried it.  Today, there was a very small line (about 8 ppl) so I decided to give it a try.  Just for research, I looked at my watch when I got in line at 11:55 a.m.  At 12:10 p.m. (yes, 15 minutes in line) I finally made my way to the window to order my chicken burrito.  At 12:20 my number had not been called, which would not have been an issue except for the fact that 3 people who were behind me had gotten their food before me.  I saw them about to give out another order to someone else when I asked to cancel my order and get my money back.  He give me a saucy answer about their machines not working yet they didn't have a problem taking money. He did eventually give me my money back and I walked across the street and got a club sandwich from a deli and was back at my desk within 2 minutes.  After waiting for almost half an hour which is my entire lunch break just to get a burrito.  Never again will I attempt to patronize this place.
author: James F.

description: Had the thali platter with chicken saag and paneer tikka masala. Not bad.
author: Maximillian M.

description:
This should be printed out and taped to curry up now:

"You cannot handle desi hot.

Desi hot will utterly destroy you.

Unless you convince us otherwise, desi hot is off limits.

This is not a warning, this is for your own protection.

UNLESS YOU MANAGE TO CONVINCE US THAT YOU ARE _TRULY SERIOUS_ ABOUT ///EXTREMELY/// ///SPICY/// FOOD - YOU ARE NOT ALLOWED TO ORDER DESI HOT.  ***CONTAINS THE HOTTEST DAMN CHILI IN THE WORLD!***

IF YOU MANAGE TO OBTAIN A DESI BURRITO WITHOUT PROPER TRAINING - GOD HELP HELP YOU TOMORROW."
author: Andrew B.

description:
Pretty good, but I don't really get the hype or see why people will stand in a line that goes all the way down the street for this place.

I've had the Chicken Tiki Masala burrito a few times which were tasty each time and had just the right amount of kick to them.

Although I enjoyed the Chicken Tiki Masala burrito, I don't find myself craving  it or  willing to stand in line for another one.  

I'd say it's an options, and it's probably a must try if you're into trying different types of foods.
author: Ed B.

description: I ordered the CTM (Chicken Tikka Masala) Burrito and it was huge! I shared half with a friend and also shared the deconstructed samosas. It was truly delicious. Spicyness is just right and the chicken was cooked right! I am definitely coming back to try some of their other menus but I won't mind getting the CTM again!
author: Eileen Z.

description:
Oh man...Curry Up Now. I'm getting hungry just thinking about a chicken tiki masala burrito. 

Pros:
- Insanely good chicken tiki masala. So good that I haven't bothered to branch out beyond that burrito. I tell myself that I will, but every time I cave...
- Huge portion that should really be two lunches but somehow I wind up consuming the entire thing and suffering from a Buddha belly and food coma for the rest of the afternoon 
- Very convenient to my office. 
- Great price--$7.50 for a burrito is awesome!

Cons:
- The line can be somewhat atrocious, particularly on a sunny, warm day

Bottom line:
A delicious lunch on the go when I'm not in a hurry to get back to the office.
author: Jenn G.

description:
I was able to try this truck at the 2nd annula SF street foods festival.  I don't know if they do this regularly but they had music playing which i thought was pretty unique. 

i really like chicken paneer tika masala burrito, warning if you cannot tolerate spciy food at all i would steer clear from this. I was surprised to find some heat in this burrito.  It got pretty intense near the end of the burrito but not too spicy to be unbearable.

I would definitely come back and try their other things, hopefully i can stop by off the grid when they're there so i can get more to order :]
author: Ryan S.

description: Their PTM burritos are orgasmic, especially if you are a lover of spicy Indian food like me. If you don't trust me, go ahead, have one bite and you'll know what I mean. They have a very limited menu, but heck I don't care. I can have the PTM burrito or their Naan everyday for lunch if it were logistically possible (It ain't 'coz its a food truck and it only stops near my office once a week.) They are pretty inconsistent on the spice level though. Their spicy burritos sometimes will demand only a glass of water or two, and during other times, they will set every single part of your body on fire. So approach with caution. It's safe to ask for a non-spicy burrito and hot sauce on the side. That way you'll feel in control of your life. [Note : They claim to make their hot sauce from the hottest species of chilli ever known to mankind]
author: Srivatsan S.

description:
WOW.  I am in awe of how amazing my lunch was from here.  I ordered the Deconstructed Keema Somosa and I'm not sure I have ever had anything better in my entire life (sorry mom!).  I was stunned with every bite.  

I also shared a chicken tikka masala burrito which sent me to the roof with its heat.  I loved how spicy this was and the flavors are just delicious.  However, I was looking for more chicken in the burrito.
author: Jordan F.

description:
I haven't actually been to the restaurant but I did try their paneer tikka masala burrito from the Curry Up Now food truck located at Off the Grid on Minna.  Both my friend and I just *loved* the burrito there... a unique idea, mixing Indian and Mexican together into a tasty concoction!  Num num.  It's not too spicy, quite large and filling, very affordable for the wallet.  

I'd happily get this burrito again next time I run over to Off the Grid again!
author: Cassandra J.

description:
CUN get SUM!

These aren't just regular burritos folks.   

Tikka masala burrito was well spiced and balanced out with rice. One of my favorite wraps thus far...

Bonus: When they say spicy, they mean spicy! ask for it...hurts so good.
author: Ralph S.

description:
The tikka masala burrito.  Just do it.  Serious.

Can you think of anything better than buttery delicious spicy tikka masala with tender succulent chicken wrapped in a warm fluffy tortilla?

Didn't think so.
author: Kelli P.

description:
Hm, why does my boyfriend used to eat this stuff twice a week? I mean, it's darn spicy and delicious, but not blow-my-mind-away ridiculously awesome to be eating it everyday possible and then regretting it at the bathroom (the spiceness catches on....). Nonetheless, it was different and fun to eat... I would definitely grab one for lunch if I was in the area.

Don't know too much about the wait times, but I was told that the Android app is the way to do it.

I think I like the idea of Curritos more than what I ate. I was quite disappointed in the sauce and chicken. Saucier please! I'm thinking chicken masala in a burrito not curry flavored chicken and rice! Even for me, the chicken was slightly dry... maybe if there was more sauce, it would mask that!
author: Helen T.

description:
Chicken Tikka masala burrito! This thing is huge!  This is the best bang for the buck.  I normally have issues being full from eating at food trucks but this baby will fill me right up!   

Now take the good stuff out of the burrito and dump that on some crisscut fries and voila we have sexy fries!  Sexy fries are perfect if you aren't that hungry but want some CurryUpNow.  I do have an issue though.....  crisscut fries are huge... this means every fry ends up being piled on with chicken, onions and sauce.  It's so dangerous to wear a white tshirt and eat this stuff.  Be careful...

The samosa is blah.  Nothing to see here.  

Go eat here!
author: Max L.

description:
I was first attracted to this place when I found out about Off the Grid and saw on their site that they had Chicken Tikka Masala Burrito. I love chicken tikka masala and what a genius idea it is to wrap it up in a tortilla to avoid a mess! 

Surprisingly, the line was not too long and it was even less of a wait to get our food. The woman taking our order told us that Mild has a bit of spicy kick and Spicy will blow you out of the water. I decided to stick to the Mild and I was glad that I did. The CTM burrito was sweeter than what I'm used to but I liked it! Usually, I expect my CTM to be creamy but the burrito was delicious and sweet with a hint of heat to your lips. It was so flavorful and couldn't believe I finished in no time. It costs about $6.75 and its a decent portion compared to other snacks you will buy from other food trucks. TRY IT!
author: Connie C.

description:
Paneer Tiki Masala Buritto - awesome. It was large and we split it between myself and my husband. 

Has some spice but not what I would consider 'spicy'. Some wimps might have an issue with it. 

Handled the OTG Fort Mason crowd well!
author: Tina P.

description: When you can make food so balanced in such a way that Indians and non-Indians alike enjoy it, you've created something special. The tikka masala burrito is a good segway for people who are new to Indian food. Who would have known that this little food truck would grow up to have three restaurants? That's success.
author: Jen Y.

description:
I really like samosas, so when I saw the deconstructed samosa on a OTG video, I totally wanted to try that when I come across this food truck one day. Well, that day came and I was excited when I finally had the chance to finally eat here. They had a lot of options for their samosa...the 3 standard meats, vegetarian, or vegan. The samosa was yummy and just a bit spicy (I'm really sensitive to spice). 

I didn't try their chicken tikka masala burrito but my hubby LOVES that item. He gets it every single week, since a truck comes near his workplace. He describes it as it being exactly like tikka masala, but wrapped up in a burrito form.
author: Susan H.

description:
I REALLY wanted to like the food but I just wasn't feeling it.  And I don't wanna lie to myself or you.  

CUN was at the Asian Heritage Street Celebration over the weekend and I was excited to try their chicken tikka masala burrito.  I ordered just that plus a samosa and mango lassi for the additional $4.  I'm no expert on Indian food whatsoever so don't ask me about the authenticity of it.  I just know that I didn't find it too spectacular.  The portion of the burrito is huge, probably almost  the size of a super burrito from tacquerias.  Definitely good for two meals for a girl like me.  I guess my gripe is that the burrito was very one noted for me.  Chicken, rice, onions (which were unevenly cut) and chickpeas, plus a hint of sauce all around and that was that.  Oh, and the burrito packs some heat.  Didn't really notice it in the beginning but having a drink by your side is definitely a good idea.  

The samosa was filled with potato goodness -- all right, nothing special.  Mango lassi was thick and mango-ey.  It was all right as well, but I couldn't finish it cuz it turned disgusting after it sat for a while without refrigeration so don't make that same mistake!
author: Vanessa C.

description:
On Monday 8/22 @ Off The Grill - San Mateo

Order me a Chicken tiki masala burrito (basically everyone in line was ordering that so I guess the CTM Burrito it is)

This burrito was so full of flavor and so delicious. It's kinda like ordering a Indian Rice dish and just stuff it in a flour tortilla then call it a Burrito.

Mine ended up being kind of messy because sauce ending up spilling after each bites...
author: DVS A.

description:
This place is solid. These are some delicious chicken tikka masala burritos they got going on here in the truck, and I may not be Indian, but my nose and tongue tells me the flavors are legit. Each bite bursts with Indian flavor, and for the carb conscious, there is ample amounts of rice packed into each. They use ghost pepper hot sauce to spice things up, so the heat is for real. Don't get it spicy if you think Panda Express is too hot for you. I find myself nursing a soda and dabbing the sweat off my brow as I eat these. Try to pack a couple of cups of their yogurt sauce. The coolness helps to balance the spice and ease the burning.

The latest word is that they've opened up an actual store in San Mateo. Also, skip the long lines by ordering through their iPhone app.
author: Cristofer P.

description:
This is one of those things that has gotten really good ratings because it's different...but I don't think the food/service lives up to the rep.  Really cool concept which is why I think everyone loves it and it has such great yelp reviews.  But honestly, I think they are unorganized bc it is so popular which causes the wait to be very long and the service to be unreliable.  

I first decided to go after all the rave about it on sf foodie blogs and ordered the OHM (veggie tortilla things).  After a really long wait, I placed my order and they asked for my name with my order but when I got back to my office the food i got (with my name written on it) was a curry burrito (so essentially no veggies, just cheese and carbs).  I ate the burrito bc I'm a pig and was starving and after about a third I immediately began feeling sick from the quality of ingredients.  Then I asked around and a coworker said that I was the third person who had complained about the aftermath of a curry up now burrito.  And I am from malaysia so used to really spicy foods and curries.  

So not only did I overpay because they messed up my order, but I ended up feeling ickish all day.
author: hatti l.

description:
I was really looking forward to this place because of all the great reviews I've heard.  It wasn't bad, but definitely not amazing like the majority of people on here would have you believe.  

First off, I know we're in the Financial District, but $8 is the right price for a burrito.  It's not cheap nor is it expensive - it's just the right price.  So if you're looking for cheap eats, it is not the reason to go.  

Secondly, I didn't know your clothes can smell like Indian food from standing in line on a windy day.  Now I know.  

The Chicken Masala burrito was not bad, but a bit watery for my taste.  Also, I have never had a craving for lettuce in my life until I bit into this burrito.  And I don't even like lettuce.  But, when you're eating heavily spiced carbs and protein wrapped in more carbs, some light crispy lettuce would have been very refreshing.    

Don't get me wrong, I would recommend this place for anyone who has not tried it.  It's fast, convenient, and they accept all major credit cards.  Would I personally go back?  Maybe.  But not before I've tried all the other restaurants, food trucks, cafes, caterers, delis, fast foods, or corner fruit stands in this area.
author: Dean L.

description:
I heard about the amazing chicken tikka masala burritos a whiie ago, (I think SF Weekly had a write up about the truck) and was immediately intrigued.  So yesterday, my friend and I had just finished lunch and were walking back to work. As we turned the corner, there it was! Woo hoo!

Fast forward one day, we returned to the location of the truck on Bush @ Sansome. And waited in line for a long time. Lol. Probably 30 minutes. I'm glad I wasn't starving because I might have collapsed by the time my burrito was ready. 

So I get to the counter and ordered my burrito "spicy" and the guy behind the counter asked me if I'd had their "spicy" before. Almost like he was discouraging me. lol. I'm sure it was just a friendly warning though.

Yummy! This was well worth the wait. The spicy burrito was delicious and not too spicy for me. But I do like my food hot. And....it's a pretty good deal ($6.75) . I only ate half for lunch and have the other half for another meal. 

I'd definitely go back, but maybe order online first to cut back on the wait time. The wait is the only drawback!
author: Elle F.

description:
Whoever came up with putting chicken tikka masala in a hand held (burrito) version is pure genius! I wasn't too sure how I would like thinking that chicken masala had way too much flavor to be put in such a concentrated form..but boy, was I wrong. It's perfection. Every bite is so flavorful and extremely authentic. The chicken masala speaks for itself and doesn't really need much else. Unless you are looking for even more spice..add their red hot sauce..yummy! 

P.S. Not a big fan of their mango lassi..but that's ok, the burrito more than made up for it.
author: Empee P.

description: I love this truck. When I worked in San Francisco, I used to go to this truck a couple of times a week. Now that I'm exclusively in the east bay, I find them in Alameda on Saturdays and the Treasure Island Flea Market at the end of the month. Sexy Fries? So good! Paneer Tikka Masala Burrito? WHAT? Yes, oh yes. My mouth is watering just writing this review. Why does there have to be so much traffic in San Francisco? I'd go right now. Go, do it!
author: Bella T.

description:
With all the Asian Fusion food trucks going around, I thought to myself wouldn't it be great if there was some sort of Indian Fusion Food truck? My question was answered when I went to OTG: Fort Mason the other day and I got to try the tikka masala chicken "currito". 

It was BOMB. It was chicken tikka masala in burrito form, what else could you ask for? I heard the truck is somewhere in downtown Financial District during weekdays for lunch so I will definitely be hitting this up again.
author: Angelo T.

description:
I thought this weird mexican + anything fusion movement (as well as the food truck one) was getting out of hand but this one is amazing.  Probably helps that I love indian food, but the chicken tikka masala burrito is money.  

I got one for my girlfriend at lunch, but didn't see her until after work.  As she ate it, she was gushing about how good it was, even hours after I had gotten it.

The only downside to this thing is the insane lines during lunch rush hour and the one time they got my order wrong and gave me paneer tikka masala instead of chicken.  While it was still good, I of course had different expectations.  

Hopefully the truck makes its rounds across the Bay Area for everyone to try.
author: Ken L.

description:
Before coming I definitely had some doubts about the tikka masala burrito.  
1, Would correctly spicing the tikka masala be an issue? 
2. How they would deal with the gravy of the tikka masala and not serve a soggy burrito
3. Was this Indian burrito just gimmick and over priced hype?

They executed the fusion of paneer tikka masala with a flour tortilla very nicely.  I asked for spicy and I actually received spicy.  To prevent a soggy burrito they held back on the gravy but this didn't hold back flavor. Score!
Finally, for $7 you a pretty filling burrito
author: Roger H.

description:
CTM- the BEST ever combined FOOD efforts. CHICKEN Tika Marsala BURRITO. At first BITE you will be IN LOVE. If you like it HOT. . and SOME DO! Ask for DESI- this is the firey red, hanabero & ghost pepper blend that will KNOW you down. . . BUT you will ENJOY the smackdown if you LIKE IT HOT. 
I reallllllly feel the NEED for the CTM about every six days. . . kinda weird- but when I need my FIX- get outta my WAY! 
OH- by the WAY- buy TWO, one to eat on site. . . .let the other MARINADE overnite. YOU TOO will be a fan! ! ! ! SOOOOOOOOOO good and TASTY.

So that you DONT break into the second CTM on-site, grad a SAMOSA or two.
author: C.V. C.

description:
It used to be really good. Now, I felt like they dont even wrap the burrito very well and food is not so hygienic. I had a Kati Roll the other day and it was like deconstructed somasa. It was not wrap well and the guys just hand it over to me..So, Service is still ok but the quality of food has been going downhill. I think the only way it will run because of the brand name. I would encourage them in food quality and wrapping. 
Thanks
author: Ram J.

description:
My favorite food truck! 

The Tikka Masala Burrito is wonderful, bursting with flavor and spice. If you order it spicy you can expect SPICY, so be careful if you're sensitive to such things. I was sweating like a madman.

The deconstructed Samosa was fantastic too. Been here twice now and plan on going back next time the truck and I cross paths.
author: Dustin E.

description: If you're on the fence, don't be. No need for an unnecessarily long review.  Everything is good. Go eat this. Now.  If you're not sure what to get, you can't go wrong with the Tikka Masala Burrito (I like to add Garbanzo Beans and Rice) and some Sweet Potato Fries.
author: Carlos M.

description:
I have no idea how Mexican(-American) food became the vehicle by which other ethnic food purveyors drove into the food-cart scene but I am happy they took off-ramp to my stomach. 

Curry Up Now makes a super filling and yummy burrito...er...byriani & chicken tika masala lovechild wrap. Hot is actually spicy enough to make me want to shake Desi's hand (whomever he/she is) as they are more man/woman than I am. Certainly more woman. 

The side samosa is nice, nothing special, and longs for a tamarindo dipping sauce (since we are still on the MexiCali cart enablemeant theme). 

The lassi was kind of crappy as lassi's go. Lets just say if you were named Timmy and stuck in a well, this is not the kind of Lassi that is going to save you. Or in the case of Desi-hot, this bland, watery drink with unpleasant chunks of mint Lassi is not the antidote you seek to extinguish the fire in your mouth. Bad Lassi! 

All in all, a great new offering in the area. I look forward to trying one of the specials. Also, If the Curry-Up-Now'ers read reviews, can I request a future special with Palak Panner as the main theme? WANT!
author: Aaron M.

description:
Finally got to try this truck during the Eat Real festival in Oakland.  Usually the best food had the longest lines, but this was probably the best truck I had during the festival and there were no lines at all.  Probably because a lot of the food was already prepared and just being kept warm, but that didn't detract from it at all.  

The only item I got to try was the Chicken Tikka Masala Burrito and it was awesome.  I'm not a big fan of burritos in general since I don't like beans or mexican-style rice, but this one had chickpeas and white rice instead which I loved.  It was extremely flavorful, with just the right amount of kick.  I sure wish they would go by the south bay near my work!
author: Arlene M.

description:
I drove by this place ..  I wanna try this place out.   I got this tikka masala burrito. 
Is very good. The price is not that high too.  Nice.
author: Erica T.

description:
Don't ask for spicy unless you can really handle it. The chicken tikka masala burrito can get intensely spicy. We asked for spicy and spent at least five minutes gulping down milk. Other than the extreme spiciness, this is a top notch burrito! Everything you love about chicken tikka masala wrapped in a convenient and portable tortilla. I've also had a chance to try their paneer which is also pretty good, but I prefer the CTM. Only thing I didn't love about Curry Up Now was their mango lassi. It just tasted a little off (too sour). 

I don't follow them, but I know that they are often in FiDi around Bush St. for lunch.
author: Angela L.

description:
For those in a hurry to worry about indian food in burrito form, don't be like Bill Murray.

Murray was as sure to worry as Cruise's Suri about curry in hurry.

The slurry of flavor in the chicken ticka masala burrito is so spicy it makes my vision blurry.

Stop the worry, collaborate and listen. Curry up now and watch the heat drop like it's going out of style.
author: Nik D.

description:
Wow, I can't believe this has never been done (or at least I had never heard of a chicken tikka masala burrito combo before).

As I braved the 20-minute long line in 50 degree weather in SF in mid-July (seriously, wtf?!), I thought to myself, "What am i doing?"

Good thing I stuck around.  The chicken tikka masala burrito is amazing!  I got it spicy (which was right around the borderline uncomfortable level) but so good and filled with large chunks of fresh, white meat chicken.  Definitely scoop up some of the self-serve yogurt to soothe your stomach afterwards. 

The burrito is quite large and filling on its own.  But along with the requisite two cups of water (or mango lassi) to quench your burning mouth, you'll end up feeling completely stuffed.

Would be interested in the "Weird Burrito" next time but they won't tell us what's in it (besides chicken).  Anyone know?
author: F. P.

description:
Chicken Tikka Masala burrito kicked my ass.

The regular was already spicy, but the spicy was sweat and booger dripping inducing.  But once your mouth gets numb the taste is pretty good.  Love that they've subbed the usual pinto beans for garbonzo's, and the Spanish rice is now Indian rice.  Onions are still crispy and provides a nice texture.  The burrito's size is deceiving.  At first you think that it's along the smaller side, but it is quite packed in there.  Very condensed with rice, chicken, vegies and beans.

The lady taking orders is quite sassy.  I asked her if there was a mild and she went off in a humorous way that "This is Indian cooking here!  It's spicy, no in betweens!"  And it's one of those moments where you just shut up and go "Yes ma'am!"  And so we found out even the non-spicy is still f'n spicy.

I'm enjoying it and I'm glad it's frequenting SF now.  Another quickie roach coach for the FiDi crowd.  Follow their twitter as this likely won't always be their permanent location.
author: Chris T.

description:
I have eaten here on several occasions, but lately they have really been disappointing me.

They are simply not consistent with their food, while one day the burrito will not be overly spicy the next it will be so spicy where i can just not enjoy it.  What finally spurred me to write this review is their sexy fries.  I have tried to get these 3 times now with different results.  The first time i tried they said sorry the machine is down due to the rain and we can not serve them to you... next time i went I was able to finally try them, they were delicious and the whole box was actually full of fries.  Then i went back about a week or two later and tried again... I got two orders so my friend could also try them, both my boxes were not even half way full of fries... needless to say i was disappointed.

While the taste is alright, i think i would recommend and personally prefer different food trucks.
author: Johnny A.

description: Just finished a deconstructed vegan samosa. Yum! Very tasty and filling. The 1" mini samosas that it comes with were adorable, too. My head is full of spices and I'm so full that I'm waddling... Happy Friday!
author: Memory E.

description:
When you go skydiving you shouldn't write a review that disses it for being too scary...

When you go to a heavy metal concert don't write a review that says it was too loud...

When you go to the Folsom street fair don't write a review that... you get the idea!

When you go to CURRY UP NOW don't write a review that you can't handle it!

Their food is very hot! VERY spicy! They don't even make a mild - just medium or hot. My lips go numb. My nose runs. Eventually my whole face goes numb. I hallucinate. I can no longer operate heavy machinery...

For these reasons (and also because the burritos are dam good) I love it when Curry Up Now makes it to the South Bay for lunch or dinner and work my schedule around getting to the truck.

For those same reasons, you should stay away if you can't take the heat, and don't by any means give them a low rating for doing what they do best.
author: Jason P.

description:
The place did not live up to the hype.

We ordered the mango lassi, chicken burrito, chicken samosa, and beef samosa.

The mango lassi was the best part of the meal.  The other dishes were just so so. 

I am a big fan of curry and of spicy foods, but the dishes packed a bit too much heat.  Too much, that it distracted your attention away from the ingredients.  Furthermore, there was not as much meat as I had wanted, and relatively speaking, too much potatoes and chick peas.

The portions, though are pretty big, and the prices are reasonable. 

Just make sure you get plenty of the mango lassi to wash down the food if you go here.
author: Bowdoin S.

description:
The jazzed up Indian cuisine offered here is pretty good. It's rich, hearty and comparably good value with all the lunch offerings in FiDi. 

A wise lady I met in line told me to only eat half the burrito in one sitting, or else the stomach may get funky... so I ate half. Doing good for now. She ordered two burritos today... wonder how's her stomach doing. 

Is Curry Up Now so unique that it's worth 45 mins of my life in waiting? Hmm, me thinks not. Your faithful reviewer ain't lining up 1.5 hours for ANY fancy pants cafe (yes I am making fun of you 'socialise in the brunch line' San Franciscans), and I am especially not lining up for a curry burrito when lunch break is only 30 mins. 

In saying so, Curry Up Now's popularity (aka lines) must speak for something. But do these folks know there are a few places nearby that does Indian burrito and/ or kati rolls? 

Tasty rolls, friendly service... should try, but strictly optional.
author: Joyce L.

description:
The Chicken Tikka Masala Burrito [CTM] is absolutely wonderful! It is so juicy and filling. You can order it either regular or spicy, I personally feel like the regular is already spicy enough for me. It certainly has a kick to it. Also, it's so huge..I can either share it or keep the other half for later. It's not your typical small burrito, this bad boy needs to be eaten with a fork if you want to keep clean! 

Lines get long, arrive early or order online or on your phone app and avoid the line!
author: Nancy L.

description:
Here's the thing. CUN's chicken tikka masala burrito is divine, delicious, heavenly. Spicy or regular version, it is perfect. I have struggled to find good Indian food of any kind for a Fidi lunch, and this is by far the top contender, despite the fact that they only have a few (non traditional) menu items. I took my father here and not only was he impressed by the food quality, he said he felt hip for eating from a food cart. The employees are great and friendly, the whole enterprise is clean, etc.

The ONLY thing keeping CUN from getting 5 stars in my book is that the wait can be SO LONG. I'm lucky in that it is literally right outside my office building, so I often come down a few minutes before they open and can have my lunch in 10-15 minutes. However, I don't know if I'd want to wait in the enormous lines that follow. I don't know what the solution to this would be, and it's certainly not their fault, but it is frustrating.

But overall, try it! For $6 and change it can't be beat!
author: Laurel K.

description:
My nose is running and my lips are on fire!

I've been in a chicken tikka masala phase for the last four weeks and decided to venture beyond the one block radius from my office. I first saw this truck last week at Off the Grid, but the line was so long, I decided against waiting. Upon searching on Yelp for a new lunch spot I realized that this place parks it just two blocks away from my office. Score! Of course I had to try the chicken tikka masala burrito after all the great reviews and it's everything everyone says it is...full of flavor and spice. Heart it! I will be back and sure to get one of their mango lassi next time to cool me down.
author: Milli A.

description:
I am a fan - 2nd time at the Curry Truck as I call it and although I waited 25 minutes in line I am in curry bliss at this exact moment...ahhh. 

The first time I had the green Punjabi which was divine. It was seriously the reason why I can back for a second take. The flavors and layers of spice are not to be missed - I would for sure get this one again and again. 

Today I opted to try another tasty item on the menu the Paneer Tikka Masala (spicy) and it was HOT! In a good way of course but if you can't take the heat don't order this on the menu or anything spicy for that matter because when they say spicy they don't mess around. I absolutely loved again the flavors and spices and for 6.75 it was money well spent at lunchtime. 

One huge drawback which I really hope they remedy is the line situation. I am not sure what they can do - but they are going to loose some customers based on the fact that it takes a huge bite out of your lunch break. Maybe having more than one person take the orders and cash would help or someone along the line taking orders and giving you a tag to pay would do the trick, but something has to give because on certain days waiting 25 minutes for food just isn't an option. 

Overall though worth the wait to try it and become a fan like me - check it out sometime!
author: Heidi S.

description:
I can't think of anything against this place... consistently it is an amazing experience to eat a CTM burrito.  So creative and delicious.  

If you dare, ask for it spicy... it awesome but make sure to have a lassi to wash it down!
author: Shawn A.

description: Came here with my coworker during lunch time. We wanted to beat the long line during lunch hour so we got there by 11:30AM. There was only a short line with a few people ahead of us. We decided to share a Chicken Tikka Masala Burrito as we didn't want to have food coma and wanted to get dessert afterwards. We sat at a nearby plaza to eat the burrito. The burrito was filled with a good portion of rice, curry, and chicken. The chicken was tender. Eating this burrito wasn't too messy! We decided that the next time we come back, we will try the sexy fries.
author: Philana C.

description:
The burritos still hit the spot in that nose-runningly spicy, not particularly complex kind of way.... But the prices continue to creep higher and the portions have now begun creeping smaller - telltale signs they have been drinking too much of their own Kool-Aide.   

The Indian in Financial District is spectacularly mediocre, so Curry Up really doesn't have competition on that front.  But a block away, John's Snack & Deli is doing more interesting "fusion" burritos.
author: George R.

description:
I walk by this truck everyday and was always curious as to why people would spend their entire lunch session to just get food to go and eat at their desk?  Now I KNOW.  This place shoul dbe called CURRY ME NOW!  The chicken tikka masala burrito is one of the best foods that I have had so far in San Francisco and is actually worth whatever wait you have to wait for. 

I obviously can't do it everyday, but man this is a good place to eat.  They even take credit card on a truck!!! It just blew my mind.
author: Min P.

description:
Tikka Misala Burrito is great (barring the excessive onions).

10-minute line; worth the wait.
author: Joe J.

description:
This place serves up a very good and different lunch option.  It is further proof that anything is better in burrito form!  

Generally not my kind of place, being that there's a herd of corporate sheep in a line wrapped around the block (I go for more of the whole in the wall type of place), butttt I can honesty say that it is damn good food! I got the tikka masala burrito with a side of the spicy sauce.  It was very filling, flavorful, and unique.  The only cons were the 15-20 minute line, the curry-smell that will stick with me for a week, and the cashier looking at me like I was asking for his kidney when I asked for a side of sauce.  

I'm all about these "modern fusion" types of food and I would say this is better than the kim chee burrito and Johns (Even though both are worth a try).  I came, I saw, I conquered and I don't know if I'll be back unless there is no line or I'm at work really hung over.
author: Andrew B.

description: I got the Sexy Fries with paneer. It was absolutely delicious. Sweet potato fries covered in paneer tikka masala and topped with cheese, onions, and cilantro. Ingenious combinations of Indian, Tex-Mex, and American cuisines.
author: Shyam B.

description: I love Curry Up Now...When I didn't live nearby, this was my special treat when visiting but now that they are outside my office everyday, I need to exercise extreme restraint in not going all the time. I love the chicken tikka masala and paneer tikka masala burritos. They can be kind of hit or miss with the spice level, but even then, I still love them. My friend has gotten the sexy fries as well, and they are also delicious but I still always get the burrito.
author: Christine H.

description:
I don't understand all the hype, maybe I caught them on a bad day...? 

Chicken tikka burrito was OK. It was nice and spicy, however VERY heavy on the beans, cumin and rice and light on the chicken. Would have been SO much better on naan instead of a flour tortilla. 

Mango lassi at $3 a cup was too pricey (even though the menu stated it was $2!). 

I would consider this C+ Food at B+ prices 

IMO Bindi, a few blocks over has superior chicken tikka burrito places for much cheaper. I think $5 and change.   

Would consider trying the other menu items, but I doubt I will come back for chicken burrito and mango lassi drink at $11.
author: diane d.

description: I fell in love with their Chicken Tikka Masala burrito during the first bite. I ordered Mild, as their Medium in my book is already pretty spicy (and trust me, I can handle spicy!). I love the additional flavor and texture of the added paneer, as I am a huge fan of cheese. Highly recommend the burrito- filling and delicious. I wish I can have one right now!
author: Ree W.

description:
Now that is a great curry burrito.

First time eater here, but heard good stuff about the place.  The long lines say enough.

Tried the CTM (Chicken Tikka Masala), and ordered the Deconstructed Paneer Samosa to tried out w/the family for later.

CTM: really good chicken tikka setup.  Flavorful, size is right, and good chunks of chicken inside.  

I will be back for more if I have a craving for curry burrito.
author: Ben D.

description:
3.5 Stars

Yesh, another food truck, this time a Mexican/Indian hybrid. On the way to UPS (the one on Bush St.) we saw a long queue for a truck. Of course, my curiosity caused me to jaywalk to the other side. Ta-da, there it was, a curry burrito truck! 

The menu is plain and simple, 3 main dishes to choose from and I got to try 2 of the 3. 
Tikka Masala  Burrito w/chicken-$6.75, The cashier asked if I wanted the burrito "spicy or no spice", I said "spicy" not knowing there were different degrees of spiciness. Good lawd, it was intense, my mouth was on FIRE!!! If I knew beforehand that they offer mild spicy, I would of gotten that. 

The Green Punjabi w/unom (meat?)- $8.75, for this one, I wonder why the $2 price difference? I was looking and looking for my "meat" and finally found 1 dingy piece. Hmm... was it supposed to come with "meat"? I ate this to alleviate the burning sensation caused by the other burrito.
author: Leeseuh K.

description:
Paneer Tikka Masala Burrito? This is Indian/Mexican fusion done right!  It definitely hit the spot as it was full of flavor and spicy hot, yet manage not to leak or fall apart.  Portion was hefty for a lunch offering.   The samosa was slightly greasy and heavily fried, but still worked.

Looking forward to returning again and again...
author: Mike B.

description:
After spotting someone chowing down on a big curry burrito I had to get one. This truck seemed to have to best deals at the Off the Grid fair. For $6.75 you get a pretty big chicken tikka masala burrito. It tastes just like it sounds, it's tikka masala in a burrito. It's yummy and there's a good amount of chicken to be had. I liked the heat too. What's funny is that someone pointed at my burrito and simply stated "WHERE?". The only problem is that there's nothing surprising about the burrito. I had hoped there was some interesting spin on the burrito instead of simply filling it with tikka masala.

I'd definitely get it again unless there were a real Mexican taco truck right next to Curry Up Now. It'll be interesting to see how the rest of the menu fares.
author: Michael H.

description:
The chicken tikka masala burrito is not amazing. It's underseasoned and is afraid to be spicier and creamier. The tikkas I have had before --even in London or in Delhi--are rich, creamy, full of spice and have almost a velvet feel. It's one thing to try to emulate a burrito, which I guess is the point, by stuffing this thing with rice and vegetables but all they do is take away from whatever scant seasoning is in the tikka. A few bites into this and you want to put this down. Curry Up Now: please don't feel you have to water down these recipes for the gringo geeks who work at Oracle or Salesforce or whatever other untanned types go to your lunch set ups. Be more faithful and really bring out the seasoning and spice in something that is probably supposed to be your signature dish here.

I don't suppose you want us to say this: we are better off driving in to a Pancho Villa or La Taqueria and ordering a chicken burrito. We're gonna get the same (or better) tortilla that you're foisting on us, multi-culti style, but the filling there will be much more satisfying. Oh, and it won't set us back $8.75. (At that price most Mission taquerias will give you a plate of food!)

Also tried the samosa, which were decent. Again, seasoning! Salt! Pepper! Cumin! Why u guys so shy?

Let me tell you what WAS amazing: those cool little Mango Lassis. Now, that's a great and fresh-tasting drink. Minor quibble: can you guys have cilantro chutney for the samosa dipping? Also be more careful to have plastic lids that fit the small plastic cups?
author: Alfonso L.

description: I can't get enough!  I love the Organic Chicken Tikka Masala Burrito and I have not tried anything else.  Don't let the line discourage you, the wait isn't as bad as it looks.  The burritos are the most popular, and pre-made and ready to go to speed up the wait.   If you enjoy Indian cuisine, the Curry Up Now truck a good look for a quick SF bite.
author: Jamika J.

description:
Generous portions. Makes people cry if you're not ready for spicy.

After drinking so much from the Bay Area Brewfest, I ate some lumpia from Hapa SF, but then the Curry Up Now truck pulled in and I had to go in for the kill. Fuuuu they are generous with portions in the chicken tikka masala burrito. There's a good ratio of chicken and rice in there so don't worry about feeling hungry afterwards.

I'm a fan of spicy food but this was super spicy with every bite. Jane S was a champ, as usual, barely being phased by it. The rest of us were kinda crying.
author: Charles L.

description:
Had the Paneer Tika Masala burrito. It is amazing. Very filing and satisfying.

There is always a line at off the grid but it moves pretty quick. The service is pretty quick too. I'm going to make it a point to visit them at the OTG
author: Abhishek S.

description:
friends of mine who actually work near where the truck plots itself on thursdays rave about Curry Up Now.  It's tough hearing about all these street food options that aren't available to me because I work on the wrong side of town, so when I made it to Off the Grid last Friday I knew I had to try Curry Up Now for myself.  

Well, I'm really upset because I'm obsessed with all things indian food and this burrito was pretty disappointing.  Now I obviously scarfed down the entire thing, but i found it mediocre.  The rice bothered me and I bet it would be so much tastier if it were wrapped in roti rather than a flour tortilla.  I may try the deconstructed samosa if i find myself near this truck again, but sadly I don't think I'll be seeking them out.  I go to Kasa for my indian burritos and even though these are a completely different style, they just didn't live up to the hype.  I applaud their attempts and I'm glad they've created quite a following, it's just not for me.
author: Anne Marie B.

description:
I still can't figure out where the truck is going to be. 

I brought four co-workers with me down to 225 Bush where their website said the truck would be at 11:30. I'd been telling everybody how great their food is.

Truck's not there. I look up their number and call them. Turns out, for some reason, the truck is actually five blocks away at California and Grant. No idea why. We walk over there.

The food is really great, but they've still got some kinks to work out.
author: Adam Z.

description:
This shit is SPICY!!!!  (And I think I have a pretty high spice tolerance!) 1.5 hours after downing a chicken tikki masala burrito and (1) my mouth is STILL on fire and (2) I'm in a food coma, haven't moved an inch outta my chair. Seriously, I think the corners of my mouth got fried. And I got "regular", not "spicy".  For all my complaining that the korean burrito at John's Snack and Deli and Namu's korean taco were lacking spice, damn, this place kicked my ass to the curb.

My coworker got the Mumbai burrito, which the lady warned "it's hella hot." His Thai ass could't even finish it, it was THAT hot!  If you have a weak spice tolerance, be forewarned!  You may want to have some pepto bismal handy later....Also, their burritos are HUGE.

Oh, the line was kinda long--we got there at noon sharp and had to wait 20 minutes.   And now...time to resume my nap.
author: Caroline I.

description: Found them in SF Financial District and ordered Deconstructed Samosa and a Mango Lassi.  The portion is good and heavy, but it's spicy for my taste!  There are a lot of garbanzo beans with some small samosa on the side.  The Mango Lassi is good, I can taste the mango meat fiber inside, creamy and tasty.
author: LeeLee C.

description: The food was good (but not like oh-my-god-I-want-more good) but it is kind of pricey for a food truck. A burrito for $8.5? Come on. Chipotle burrito is 7 bucks. Also be careful with your order, spicy is pretty darn SPICY. They don't mass with that. I don't think I will be back for a while.
author: June C.

description:
Weird Burrito

It was weird. Everything indian you can think of, was in it. My coworkers also waited 15 minutes just for my weird burrito while they got their Chicken Tikka Marsala burrito. 

Chicken Tikka Marsala 

I've had this twice and both times I enjoyed it. It's has a kick of spice in it and its huge. I also had a taste of the mango lassi, it wasn't cold as it should be and not as thick as I have tasted before.
author: Jennifer D.

description:
Chicken tikka masala in burrito form? You had me at chicken.

I am also giving them an extra star, simply because it is an amazing feat worthy of the Ringling Brothers themselves to cram ten people into a food truck.
author: Daniel C.

description:
Woohoo, my burrito world has been changed. I've had a korean burrito, a sushiritto, but this Chicken Tikka Masala Burrito is king of them all. Good spice, good size, and very flavorful. I was worried it would be very messy to eat with the curry, but surprisingly it wasn't at all. Also I didn't think it was too spicy, but I can handle spice.

I will definitely be hitting this up again!
author: Eddy N.

description:
Honestly, curry in a burrito form -- very inventive!

But after taking a few bites? ehh 

I suppose i prefer my chicken tikka masala in regular plate form and that is actually tasty!  The burrito definitely had its kick of spicy.  Though... in terms of flavor and pieces of chicken in it, I was not impressed.  

I'm not quite sure what's all the rave about or maybe I just happen to get the 'not so great burrito' though I rather spend my $6.75 on a bomb ass carne asada burrito.
author: Mabel C.

description: Sexy fries are good. They can be a bit soggy because of all the sauce - but then again  , who can complain about that? Cheesy and very filling. I would recommend it. However, they tend to take a bit longer to prepare than the burritos.
author: Gee H.

description: After a few months I see Curry Up Now at Off the Grid Haight Street and remembered the owner offered me a free burrito. I went up to the man at the register and showed him the email I got for my free burrito. He was funny, giggled then explained to me the one he gave me is not too spicy. My last burrito burned my mouth off! Then he even offered me a free samosa! Thanks! The samosa was yummy, not too spicy but lots of flavor. The burrito was good, this time I wasn't running for milk.
author: Karen T.

description:
I was excited to hear about Off the Grid coming to downtown, so I went to checkout which trucks were coming. Curry Up Now was the one that sounded best. After reading all the reviews, I had to try their chicken masala burrito. Oh man - Da Bomb!!! 

I devoured it. I mean inhaled it, and couldn't stop talking about it. It was a perfect blend of flavor. They didn't skimp on the chicken with mega rice. I need to try their other chicken burrito next if they still have it next time. It also sounded pretty good. 

If you ever see them, you better curry up an go!!!
author: Minh V.

description: This is my first time here and I must say, the food was amazing. I wasn't expecting this to have the authentic Indian taste, but this one was so Indian and I loved it !! They have a good iphone app and let you order before and pay. So you just go there and collect it and enjoy your food. If you are in a hurry, order 10 mins before, walk over to that place, pick up the food and enjoy !!
author: Anand G.

description:
Overrated. 
Review is for the chicken tikka marsala burrito.
Its just curry and rice in a flour tortilla. If I want curry, I can eat it off a plate/bowl kthnx.
pungent and I guess its what you call "flavorful" by some people's perspective. Chicken was dry. The curry was really thick and what is the word for it...Gritty, yes and thick. No bueno. Nothing really special.
I love spicy foods but I wonder how people that cant do spicy would adjust to their regular food.
author: Ellie C.

description: I never thought I would eat paneer in a burrito. I was pleasantly surprised. :)
author: Kimber R.

description:
This place was recommended to me by a colleague who said the CTM (Chicken Tikka Masala) Burrito was the best tasting spicy burrito he has ever had.  So of course, I had to give it a try.  I get to the location and there was a bit of a line.  I waited approximately 15 minutes but was able to chit chat with a few returning customers about their favorite item on the menu.  I was so excited that when it was my turn to order I said I wanted a "spicy chicken burrito".  I was not aware of the different levels of spicy but when I first bit into that delicious burrito WOW was it spicy.  It was filled with lots of flavor and spices.  The chicken was nice and tender.  I enjoyed every bite of it but could feel the inside of my stomach burning.  I was sweating, sniffling and getting goosebumps as I was eating it.  I love me some spicy food and I could usually handle spicy but this was way beyond spicy.  Yet, it was soooo good!  I am salivating as I type this.  haha!  

I've gone back three times and I have enjoyed it.  However, last time I ordered the Vegan burrito and it wasn't that good.  It needed some spicyness.  I can't wait to go back and try the Sexy Fries.  MMMmmm.  For all you first timers, definitely stick with the regular/mild spicy.  Do not ask for extra spicy!! I'm definitely going back for more.
author: Cynthia P.

description: One of the best burritos I've had.  Chicken Tiki Masala burrito is packed with flavor and has an amazing kick, but be prepared for the spice.  I DL'ed the Iphone app and ordered but still had to wait in the long 35 min line.  Not sure ordering through the iphone is much different than walking up and ordering.  Specialty's has it down in terms of online ordering.  You pick a time, they make it and leave it on a rack for you to get.  Worth the wait and the hype.  Not sure I'd get this every week, it's heavy.
author: Josh L.

description:
Good stuff.
Paneer Tika Masala was a bit dry, but the Chicken Tika Masala is divine.

"Regular" is still pretty spicy.  Only order the "Spicy" if you're used to it, or extremely adventurous.

They post on Twitter, and from the looks of that, they're out from San Francisco down the Peninsula just about every day.
