description: All-in-one-Chicken-Tikka-meal-with-rice-wrapped-in-a-burrito-awesomeness!!!
author: Nadiyah S.

description: I must have the CTM burrito once a week or I go into serious withdrawal. Wish they had specials at OtG Stanyan on Thurs nite. That and a lunch truck in the East Bay would up them to 5 stars.
author: Ted M.

description:
My personal favorite FiDi lunch spot!

CTM Burrito- A-maze-balls. 

Naughty Naan- Very spicy but delicious. A bit on the pricey side ($9) and not very filling.

Samosas- DELISH! 

Between CUN and Chaat Cafe @ the Crocker Galleria, I'm set for my Indian food cravings during work!
author: Anon Y.

description: They have a curry burrito for everyone (vegan, vegetarian, meat filled, anything) and they're absolutely fantastic. You can't go wrong with this place.
author: Joaquin E.

description: Paneer Tikka Masala in a burrito? Say no more! Had this for the first time today, it's huge, I ate myself into a lunch coma. But it was totally worth it. The added bonus is that it's cheap! A huge buritto filled with my favorite Indian dish for under $6, cannot go wrong here. I'm glad I can only get to this once a week because I don't think I'd be able to resist gorging myself to fatness.
author: Lindsay A.

description: Got the chicken tikka masala Yummy fast burrito with curry flavored chicken. My suggestion: Offer whole wheat tortilla as a healthy option!
author: Monica A.

description: Finally! After months of wanting to try Curry Up Now I actually got my chance!  It took a work event with food trucks for me to be able to experience Curry Up Now as every time I'd try on my own at other events, the lines are always super long.  Anyhow, on to the food - the Chicken Tikka Masala burrito is insane!  It's big and packed with yummy food, super spicy yet oh so good.  I was practically crying from the spice but oh was it worth it.  I can't believe curry wrapped in a burrito can be that good and I am looking forward to being able to try more of their dishes :)
author: Sonya T.

description: If you even remotely like Indian food, you HAVE to check this food stand out. They perfectly balanced the amount of curry sauce, meat, and rice. I look forward to coming back here.
author: Andrew M.

description: I love chicken tikka masala burritos from Curry Up Now.
author: Chris C.

description: Most of my experience with Indian food is at lunch time buffets when you can try a little bit of everything, and I'm never exactly sure what I'm eating so I was unsure of what to order.  The menu is simple, easy to figure out, and service was great. I visited Curry Up Now outside the new Burlingame Safeway a few weeks ago. Wowee. The deconstructed Samosa with Paneer was dreamy good and really hit the spot.
author: Pamela M.

description: Really awesome CTM burrito!  It can sometimes be hit or miss, but definitely worth checking out for lunch.
author: J R.

description:
tikka masala burrito...4 stars
 extra spicy is really really good, and with descent spice. not 5 stars, as they need more greens or something in here - some spinich and fresh pico de gallo type stuff that they serve on the deconstructed samosas would go well on this. 

deconstructed samosa...3 stars
a bit too heavy and dry, the keema is also not that amazing compared with the chicken tikka. 

overall, this place is creative and delicious, will be back!
author: Ben B.

description: I had the pleasure to eat the Chicken Tikka Marsala burrito at the ingenious Off the Grid event last week.  This was definitely the best thing I had there.  The burrito was a good size for only $6.75!  Beware, though, it's SPICYYY.  I should've known by the little smirk the girl who took my money had when asking if I wanted the spicy sauce.....It was well worth the burning sensation in my mouth and the feel of fire in my stomach nevertheless.  Nothing good 'ol Corona couldn't help fix!
author: Tina F.

description: They use free range hormone free chicken!!!  That's beyond culinary!  Not only are their indian style burritos delicious, they're hormone free unlike other burritos which are hormone injected!  I will forever be a lifelong fan/customer because of this...Also, they have Indian style Lay's chips!!!!!! You need to try everything on their menu!
author: Joseph C.

description: Tikki masala burrito...droool.  Even my Indian food hating hubs liked it and that says a lot.  Samosas wasn't bad either.  Enduring longs lines was terrible but the food was worth it.
author: B. N.

description:
Got the spicy chicken tikka masala burrito, knowing what I was getting myself into. 

Expectations = key. 

Spicy really is spicy here. I love hot food. When the local Mexican place has some habanero salsa, I use it without restraint. 

That said, I was still astounded at how hot this thing was. I squirmed in my seat a bit.  I was definitely sweating.  The yogurt they supply was much needed.  You've been warned. Don't give them bad reviews based on your level of spice tolerance. They have mild options.  

It was pretty darn good and definitely a unique experience for me.  I really enjoyed the spicy tamarind (?) chutney as well.

I would be back regularly, if it weren't for the 20+ minute wait.  They need to get more efficient with the line. Why does it take so long to dish out (mostly) pre-made burritos and samosas?  Get someone off the truck relaying orders from down the line, before they hit the cashier.
author: John D.

description:
If you're looking for some good old Indian food, this ain't it.  Think of this as fusion India.  Like taco trucks, the menu is very limited but that's all fine and good, but what the hell is a curry burito?!?!  

Always a long time too, not worth the wait.
author: CalBear H.

description: Curry in a Burrito off a Truck. delicious!!! The curry is creamy, a bit spicy, and not drippy. The chicken in the burrito is good and tender. The mango lassi is pretty good, but I had better. It was a bit too watery for my tastes.
author: Steven B.

description: Sooo Yummy!!  I had the chicken tiki masala burrito and it was perfect.  A little bit spicy, big and tasty.
author: Melinda H.

description: The chicken tikka masala burrito is bonkers good - very flavorful and just the right amount of spiciness. I also tried the regular samosas and they were good but not as good as the burrito - on it's own, it's kind of plain, definitely could have used some kind of chutney.  You will have plenty leftover for a 2nd meal since their portions are huge!  The line was not terrible - we arrived right around noon on a Wednesday and waited 15 mins or so. I will be coming back for more for sure!
author: Amy N.

description: It's basically the best thing to be invited since the light bulb
author: David C.

description: It was my first time ordering from this vendor and I was hungry because I had a late lunch. The deconstructed samosas with chicken tikka masala is nothing but day old left over that got recycled into a dish. As I was eating it, I started to notice the smell. It smells border line spoil food that got heated up with lots of sauce as a cover up.  The fact that they are willing to serve this tells you about their bottom line - money.  I wouldn't trust this vendor.
author: Dorris D.

description:
the line is long. so try to get there earlier or later than 12-1.30 .  

that said, this truck is great at producing quality food consistently, at a fair price (for financial dist. lunch) and its usually pretty quick. 

i usually order chicken tikka burrito..  its a lot of food, and its usually on the spicy side.
author: damien w.

description: Indian food + Burrito is a pretty interesting combination. This was pretty good.
author: Grant M.

description: Ask for your Tikka Masala burrito in 'indian spicy'. Your insides will hate you and tastebuds will love u.
author: Lokesh J.

description:
I ordered the chicken tikki masala burrito. I love indian food but it is always a formal eating experience so I don't usually get to experience it often. The idea of basically an indian style burrito sounded great and isn't too bad in action either.

The first bites were great. The flavors and ingredients really were quality and the tortilla was soft and fresh, even though they just continually make these burritos to fight the lines.

But after about 6+ bites everything kind of just started washing over me and the flavor just turned into a spice burrito. The whole thing is just one flavor so after a few bites nothing really stands out.

It was definitely filling though so pricing doesn't seem too outrageous, but it definitely is a bit overpriced. I know its FiDi but still, food trucks have a limit. When I go into a restaurant/store I pay a little extra knowing that if the apocalypse strikes when I'm getting my food, I'll have a roof over my head to protect me. Curry Up Now didn't get the memo on that one I guess.....

I'll probably come back a few times but it definitely isn't a go to spot.
author: Andrew Q.

description:
Chicken tikka masala IT IS. Went there 20 times now and ordered the same thing over and over and still not bored . should try it.

Others are OK.
author: Mali S.

description: YUM!!! GO NOW!!! Just wish the prices were a little lower. $7 for a burrito....???
author: Anthony G.

description: The Chicken Tikka Masala burrito was off the hook, yummy! My coworker called ahead and pre-ordered for pick up. Quick, easy, and incredibly good.
author: Maya L.

description: Curry Up Now combines two of my favorite things--Indian food and burritos. It really is a unique combination that I never would have thought of. I had the chicken tikka masala (CTM) burrito. Admittedly, I was skeptical of the quality of the of the Indian element of the CTM burrito. But, the tikka was well seasoned (maybe a little spicier than some people would like) and not overly oily. The chunks of chicken were large and tender, just as it would be ordering a good tikka masala from an Indian restaurant. The included chickpeas added some nice additional texture. The basmati rice was nice overall, but my burrito had one small mushy clump of rice in the middle amongst the otherwise properly cooked rice. Overall it was a good first experience. Generous amount of food for the money (not always the case with food trucks). Unique food conceptually, but also well-executed taste wise. I will definitely be back!
author: Eugene C.

description: Curry Up Now gets an extra star for their super tasty Butter Chicken Burrito. It's a special item that shows up on their menu once in a while.
author: Sasha K.

description:
wow, this is spicy.

omg, this is really good.

those were the first 2 thoughts going through my head and i bit into the ctmbs(chicken tikka masala burrito spicy).  i can handle spicy food.  i pride myself with hanging with the best of the szechuan and indian food of the world, but this is making me tear a tiny bit.  it's also PACKED with flavor.  for $10, you can get a VERY substantial burrito and a mango lassi, but wait about 35 minutes if you go at the peak lunch hour.  with that said, it's ALL worth it.  the lassi is decent tasting, but a good consistency, but the burrito is killer!  this is one to rival the kimchi burrito nearby, which i never though i'd say.
author: Jeff N.

description:
Walked by the line of people outside the food truck on multiple occassion and finally gave in!

Soggiest burrito award also goes to the paneer tikka masala burrito. I usually prefer my burritos on the wet side, but so that it's still in tact when I hold it. Let's just say, this was not "hold-able"

I ordered it on the smartphone app in advance, and waited only about 5 minutes before taking it back to the office. I was expecting longer considering the line was at least 12 people deep. They have two lines-one for those who ordered in advance and another for those ordering on the fly.

WARNING: When chosing the level of spiciness, you are forewarned that the "DESI HOT" is really really  really hot and I'm desi! I can garnish dishes with thai chillies and put sriracha sauce on just about EVERYTHING, but couldn't handle this. Two cups of water later, I'm chewing on the remaining ice cubes in the glass!

The desi hot just takes away from the mildness and creaminess of the paneer, which happily they aren't stingy on!  Proper size cubes of  yummy goodness....mmmm...

SIZE: With desi food being quite heavy and filling, this burrito can easily be split between two.


best part, they've got halal options (keema and goat curry)  for us Muslim folks, yea yea!
author: R. S.

description: Not much real curry spice here. Just garlic and salt, which is what makes the truck smell good from far away. I wish it were tastier, since it's so close to my office...
author: Bootylicious J.

description: Office cafeteria is undergoing renovations, so they're filling the  gap with food trucks. This place has the Thursday slot. The line is long (shorter if you have exact change), but so worth it! I had the spicy chicken tikka burrito (seasoned rice, chicken tikka, chopped onions, unbelievably good!) and the veggie samosa - great flavor, but way too greasy. Ended up eating the filling and tossing the shell. I've ignored the samosa in my rating. 4 stars just for the burrito!
author: Eme L.

description: Yum!  My taste buds are in heaven. Tried this food truck for the first time today and can't believe how amazing my meal is.  I got the Lusty Lamb special in a burrito bowl - tender lamb in a perfectly spicy sauce over rice that's bursting with flavors. I will definitely be tracking it down again in the near future and plan to bring friends.
author: P C.

description: I tried Curry Up Now for lunch. The chicken tikka masala burrito was fantastic. It had a middle of the road spice level, which could have been spicier for my taste. The chicken was tender and not dry. I highly recommend it! Some improvement can be made in the diversity (and quantity!) of vegetables within the burrito. Cilantro anyone?
author: Ryan G.

description: WOW. I love the curry sliders. You get a box with curry on one side, another tomato-based sauce on the other, and a bunch of little buns with onion and that green sauce. (Sorry I am so bad at the names of these things, but I can't find these on their menu anymore.) It's do it yourself sliders. They are so delish! Spicy, savory, and satisfying.
author: Cathy S.

description:
I never thought I'd say this, but I eat Indian food from a street cart and I love it. The Indian "burritos" are on the lunch list for me and my office pals at least once a week.  Unfortunately, the BBC is nearly always sold out before we get there. The consolation prize is the tikki masala burrito. The burritos are huge and a true "bang for your buck."  I made the mistake of ordering a somosa, too, and it was way too much food. Delicious, but impossible to eat at one sitting.

Curry Up Now gets two thumbs up from me.
author: Pinot B.

description:
so good!
creative and delicious twist on the regular burrito
go try it tomorrow!!
author: Deka M.

description: Really good Indian street food. I love the Spicy Samosa Burrito, very flavorful and filling. The deconstructed samosa's are very good too. The have a decent selection of Indian canned beverages (Mango Lassi) to help wash the super spiciness down.
author: Marco M.

description: The Chicken Tikka Masala burrito was amazing, I can't wait to track this truck down again!
author: Alex R.

description: Two of my favorite foods combined, burritos and chicken tikka masala - whaaaat?!? I can't rave enough about this place! I've been twice, the first time getting distracted by the line and amazing curry smell coming from the truck, when we were on our way to pick up lunch. The wait the first time was about 30 minutes and the second time, not that it's become more popular, was about an hour. Sure, it's a long wait, but trust, me, it's worth it. I've only had the chicken tikka masala burrito, but a coworker had the lamb and loved it. Now I loooove spicy foods and ordered my burrito spicy. It wasn't too spicy for me, but select the spicy option with caution. Check it out, Curry Up Now won't do you wrong.
author: Melissa C.

description: best fast food in the city... tie between super duper and this truck. best burritos ever. ctm get in mah belly
author: Omid F.

description: Decent.  I wasn't crazy about the flavor combinations, seperately I enjoy channa masala, CTM and rice...and even tortillas I guess, but it never came together for me.  If i'm going to stand in line outdoors for 20 minutes then wait an additional 15 minutes for food which I then have to take back to my office, well it better blow me away.  But like I said, this was decent.
author: Jim K.

description: The deconstructed chicken samosa is fun, filling and delicious for only $6!
author: Sarah Z.

description: Paneer Tikka Masala Burrito. I loved the cheese a lot but I was sad I couldn't finish all of it because even the mild was crazy spicy, the spice just kept building with each additional bite. I'm no chicken about spiciness but this was so spicy I could not take it, my whole mouth was burning. I felt even worse for my friend since she couldn't eat spicy food and she was telling me how her lips were on fire. (-1 star for super spiciness.) I wish they would make one that's not spicy at all. SADFACE!
author: Constance C.

description: Liked the chicken tikka masala burrito but this one was a little light on the sauce (just my preference).  Their regular spice is definitely quite hot enough (for me).
author: Melinda C.

description: Moist, chewy tortilla wrapped around some uber flavorful Chicken Doesn't get any better than that. Delicious food. Go get some!
author: Tri N.

description: Truck was mobbed today, close to 50 people waiting for their oh-so-tasty-but-very-spicy Indian burritos!
author: Peter H.

description: Excellent!  The truck was at the Sunset Event 2013.  Amazing, full of chicken and full of flavor.  No short cuts here, top quality Mary's chicken combined with spices and other goodness.  A real party in your mouth.  A must try.  Please come south, we can use you.
author: Lovegood F.

description: I had the CTM burrito at the 2010 Eat Real Festival. Good amount of spice and grease! Overall, it was very flavorful.
author: Halani X.

description:
We recently had Curry Up Now bring a bunch of Paneer Tikka Masala burritos to our wedding.  The burritos were a big hit - we knew we loved them since we've had them off the truck a few times, but all of our guests were nuts about them too.  There may have been people fighting at the end of the wedding for who got to take home the leftovers.

Additionally, dealing with them over the phone for our order was totally great.  They were super nice, responsive, flexible and easy to work with.  I would highly recommend them for a catering order.
author: Nick H.

description: Curry Up, I'm HOOKED!!!  I just had it for the first time outside of my work, saw a huge line, smelled the aroma and had to have it!  It was well worth the wait and I'll br trying a different item every week from now on.  The Chicken Tikka Masala Burrito was amazing, got it extra spicy and portion was big enough for lunch and dinner!  Mango Lassi here I come!
author: Nazli P.

description:
someone pls explain to me why a deconstructed samosa is $6 and a regular one $1.50? deconstructed means it's not even put together, which = less work right?! 

anyway, i love all things indian, and the flavor was good and when they say spicy, they're not kidding, but still. it's nothing i can't get in fremont.
author: Lily L.

description:
ahhh!! spicyyyyy!! mmmmmmmmmm 

Once upon a time there was a spicy tikka masala looking for a buddy. She found that buddy in a food truck and later a child was born - tikka masala burrito. 

Tikka masala burrito! so good! I wished I tried the samosa too. Next time. 

The owner is super nice! I wish her all the best!
author: Jess O.

description: I'd heard a lot of good about curry up now, and I stumbled onto the food truck while looking for something for lunch downtown. There was a long line, but I had a long lunch so I got in it. The line moved so quickly, and I ordered a paneer tiki burrito. To my surprise, he gave it to me right away! That was SUCH a quick food truck experience, which is great for people with only a short lunch break. I also got the mango lassi, because people were raving about it. I didn't hate the lassi, but I didn't really like it either. I've had a ton of lassis, and this one just tasted..different. Definitely try it, because since it doesn't taste like a regular one, you might enjoy it. The burrito is mostly rice and sauce. It's very messy, so watch out, don't wear your nice clothes lol. The paneer was very fresh and fluffy tasting. The burrito wrap was just a regular burrito wrap and the sauce was just ok. Way too much sauce and rice. Once again, it wasn't bad, but it wasn't particularly good, and I got a tummy ache. After eating the burrito and for the rest of the day and night, I felt sickish from it, so I wouldn't go again. On the other hand, someone in the class I was taking had this place twice in a row and still loved it, so it's all a matter of taste and diet I guess. I think I'll stick to yummy Kasa for street Indian food.  Oh, and ps, it wasn't spicy in the slightest bit. A bit of spice would have been nice..odd because other reviews say how spicy it is, maybe mine was made wrong?
author: Merredith L.

description: Just stopped by here today with a co-worker for lunch. I got the chicken-masala burrito, regular. Since there are already a million people testifying to the spiciness I'll keep it short: the regular is spicy, the spicy is holy cow spicy.  I usually like super spicy but in the middle of the work day I'm more than happy to just have the regular and not show up to a meeting with red eyes and sweat on my brow. If you enjoy burritos and chicken tikka masala you'll like this place.
author: Russ N.

description: Fast, delicious and inexpensive. Perfect for a quick lunch.
author: Jock M.

description: Just at the deconstructed samosa with chicken. Amazing, not too spicy and a hint of sweet from the mint chutney.  Definitely a fun twist for lunch and feels healthier than the burrito - but who knows if that's actually true.
author: Kellan M.

description: They served it to me quick and still hot in the foil paper. I'm not a huge fan of burritos but the combination of the rice, onions, chickpeas and chicken tikka massala was very flavorful.  They gave me a side of their very spicy hot sauce - Habanero and Bhut Jholokia.  I didn't pour it in but added here and there to enhance the flavor of my burrito.  It was yummy and delicious!  I wished they had kheer that would would have helped with toning down the spiciness from my savory dish.  I'm glad they stop at the FIDI neighborhood.
author: pengrin ..

description: Heaven..........The best thing i have had in awhile  if you have not had it Get it........
author: kim c.

description:
the events leading up to my first visit to curry up now:

while chatting online:

Me: yo, it's lunchtime, i'm hungry.  there's a place over here that has chicken tikka masala pizza.  soooo good.
W (in Michigan): what?!  send me a picture.  i want to live vicariously through you.
Me: ::googling for picture of said chicken tikka masala pizza::
Me: WAIT!  i just discovered something amazing!  there's a place that has chicken tikka masala BURRITOS!  even better.  but ohhhh, they're in burlingame :(  too far.
W: oh wellll, sucks for you!
Me: ::performing more internet research about chicken tikka masala burrito joint::
Me: HOLY CRAP!  they have a truck 3 blocks from here.  SEE YA!
W: brat.

40 minutes later.  yeah, the line is pretty damn long.  but well worth it.

Me: omfg this is so freaking good hahahaha you live across the country & you can't have oneeeeeeee.
W: i hate your guts.

in summary, delicious.  i ordered the burrito, samosa, & mango lassi combo, but the guy before me got the last mango lassi so they gave me a couple bucks back. :(  just a note: it was wayyyy too much food for one meal.  next time i will definitely just get the burrito.  although the samosa is good, it's not great & i am currently regretting stuffing so much food down my throat.  but the burrito was delicious.  wouldn't hesitate waiting on line again and again (or maybe using their online ordering) in the future.
author: Jenna H.

description: These burritos are simply delicious. In particular, the chicken tikka masalsa (CTM) is something you will be asking for again and again. Word of caution though, the spicy version is not for the faint of heart - or even the strong of heart for that matter. It will make you hurt, twice. The regular version has plenty of zip though so don't fret.
author: John J.

description: I got the chicken tikka masala burrito for lunch today and it was good but not awesome. Seems like I have always had a different tasting tikka masala then the one I got here. They should seperate the rice as well. All the sauce drenches into the rice when put into the burrito. I would probably try a couple other things from the food truck as well just to try them out.
author: Genaro R.

description: Worth the wait in line.  The chicken tikka masala burrito is addictive.  If you order it 'SPICY' be ready for a scalp-warming experience!
author: J E.

description:
hits the spot. 

i've had CUN a couple times now and i still crave a chicken tikka masala burrito. the hype and price is worth it. i try to get myself to order something else, but i stop myself because i've only been dreaming of that damn burrito for the past couple of days. 

i only eat it at OtG and it's been the only thing i've ordered every time. i haven't finished one on my own yet. but i'm getting there. 

and a burrito from CUN tastes just as satisfying at 2am after a few drinks. :0)
author: Maria B.

description: Yum!!!! Best chicken tikka masala burrito I have ever had. It's Indian fusion food (Indian + Mexican). The line is long, but well worth the wait.  I have to say that I now heart the street cart!
author: Anne Marie F.

description: So excited that they were in SF for dinner for once!  My bf gets the chicken tikka masala burrito for lunch nearly every Thursday in San Mateo and has been teasing me with it mercilessly.  I still haven't tried it yet, but I did have the deconstructed samosa, which was oh. my. god. out of this world delicious.  A perfect blend of spices & flavors!  Also, a perfect amount of food for one meal (or two snacks) for CHEAP.  Can't wait til they're around here more often in the evening!
author: Angela B.

description:
Have to admit I was a little iffy about this place when I first saw it parked next to my office but it was the smell of curry and the long lines that got me to want to try this Indian "taco truck".
For $7.00 you get a really hearty Burrito, but of course it's not your typical burrito it's filled with Indian food!! YAY!
After standing in line for a good 20 minutes I finally got to the window to order my chicken tikka masala burrito! I thought to myself, this thing better be good or I'm coming back and throwing it at someone standing in line hahaha (I wouldn't really but it sounded good)! 
When I got back to my desk I opened up my burrito goodness and sat and enjoyed the smell of curry! I picked it up and took my first bite, ugh, I thought... All tortilla and no curry goodness? WTF! (I was ready to go and throw it at someone at this point,) then took my next bite-OMG!!! All my senses opened up like a flower blooming in the spring! It was amazing! Who would have thought this burrito would be my by far favorite thing I've had since I've been working in the City (for the past 4 years)!
I'm glad Curry Up Now thought... San Francisco they need convenience and they need it fast, let's take my yummy food and stick it in a tortilla so they can eat and walk! Brilliant!!! 
This place gets 2 thumbs up! So in yelp words: food = 5 stars and wait time = 3 stars. So all in all a 4 star experience!!! 
If you're in town try it!!
I will admit if the lines weren't as long as they are every time they  are here I'd get then everyday!
author: Jessica W.

description: DAMN the tikka chicken masala burrito was delicious. I asked for spicy and they delivered. I can't wait to try their other offerings.
author: Sophia D.

description: I liked but did not love.  I got the CTM (Chicken Tikka Masala) Burrito, regular spicy (the lowest level they have) & it was pretty tasty.  I think that people in the FiDi need something different to eat and new choices - so this def gets a thumbs up for that but I don't know that it would be something that I'd get too often.  I'm a glad that I tried it because it was definitely good - so I'd say give it a try and maybe you will love it!   Also, the line for the truck gets ridiculously long so I'd say to go early ~11:40 or order online.
author: Selena G.

description: This place is a great value and the food is consistenly above par. I usually get the paneer burrito, which is a good size and comes with plenty of cheese for us protein freaks. The "regular" is plenty spicy - enough so that I don't mind enjoying it as I sit on th on the concrete wall nearby even on cold days. I've also had the samosas, which were HUGE. Almost a meal by themselves. But my favorite thing is the egg wraped thing (I can't recall it's name). I've only had the paneer version and it is so so so fabulous, but a tad too small for 6 bucks, so I don't get it that often. The line is often long, but it moves pretty quickly. The staff is always super nice.
author: Velma M.

description: I really like the Hella Vegan deconstructed samosa and the vegan burrito.  I tried the CTM burrito, and it was just alright.  I definitely recommend the Hella Vegan samosa and the vegan burrito.  Super good!
author: Tiffany W.

description:
Maybe it's because I live in an area that has tons of Indian food places, but I just tried their famous chicken tikka masala burrito and have to say I was a little disappointed.  There wasn't much chicken in it and it doesn't have the same creamy sauce I'm used to getting when I order chicken tikka masala from a regular Indian cafe.

Think I'll stick to getting my regular grub from an Indian cafe for about the same price.
author: Elaine T.

description: Can anything get stuffed inside a tortilla these days? Curry Up Now makes an awesome Chicken Tikka Masala burrito that you must try, assuming they don't run out by the time you get there. Check out their site to see what time and where they'll park the truck. Lines start early, but tend to move quickly once you place your order. Beware: spicy = very hot! Specials are posted on their site daily; however, their online ordering system is often down. Nonetheless, it's a welcome addition to the FiDi lunch scene.
author: Rick T.

description: Chicken Tikka Masala burrito rocks, 5 stars.  The fact that the cart is set up in the parking lot of my office at Genentech, priceless.
author: Laura S.

description: Let me just say wow. A Chicken Tikka Masala burrito who knew and so close to my office.  Nom nom nom. I am not into spicy food but this was really tasty and super filling at a reasonable price.
author: Monik T.

description: wow, the kahti roll and the samosas and the tika masala burritos were outstanding.  i am really impressed with this little food truck businesses.  they even have an iphone app.  matter of fact, i would NOT go here without ordering on your iphone application.  download it.  they do NOT take money or a credit card over the iphone.  you basically put your order in and then skip the line at the truck.  you go right up to the "pickup" window, thus ignoring the 50 people standing in line.  you tell them you ordered something online.  they check their iphone and find your order and start making it and charge you right there.  it's done in 2-3 minutes and you pick it up while all the suckers in line wonder why you got such VIP treatment!
author: dan h.

description:
Finally went by CUN on a day without lines. Chicken tikka masala burrito. There were some good things - the spice, both flavor and heat, were great; this is a big, heavy, filling burrito, great value over all. And some not great things - like the chicken. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't the freshest or tenderest thing ever - stewing might be a better choice for this quality of chicken.

But overall, a great concept and a tasty lunch!
author: Wangston P.

description: I thought it was pretty good Indian food. The food was really taste but the spice on even the medium options was a little bit much. I was astonished how full I was after completing the burrito.
author: Andrew M.

description: i've heard good reviews of this place, but i was still pleasantly surprised when i finally ordered a burrito for myself. portions are generous too! i was surprised at the heft and size of the burrito when my order was ready. just be ready for some major food coma after you finish this whole thing!
author: Jennifer W.

description:
This is my favorite lunch spot.  Fast, delicious, cheap, filling, friendly.  Everything I want, when I notice they will be in FiDi for lunch my plans are set.

I also love that they do Off the Grid on Stanyan.

The food is spicy, some complain that it is too spicy.  I imagine these are the people who think "Fire" sauce at tacobell is as hot as food should ever be.  I love the heat here, and am never disappointed.  A good sweat every time!.

Tikka Masala Burrito (Chicken or cheese) is a good introduction, or the decon samosa.  They have good special items, been a fan of the "Green Monster" when it makes an appearance.

The employees are always friendly and cheerful.  The ONLY problem if ever, was the credit card machine was not working one day (I had even passed at ATM and thought, "well CUN takes cards now."
author: Kent S.

description: Love the food, but what's with the new (lazy, hipster) staff?  The line moved much faster when the short haired guy was in charge - - bring him back!  They need to get rid of feather-hat who is more interested in dancing / talking / just standing there with a blank look, than actually working.
author: Andrea F.

description: I got the pannier burrito and mango lassi and it was awesome! I could only eat half of the burrito, so I saved the second half for dinner. I spent about $10 bucks and got lunch and dinner...it was delicious! Pretty spicy, I ordered the mild and my mouth was still on fire.
author: Caley Alyssa Y.

description: I caught this truck on its second Monday stop in Palo Alto. I had the Chicken Tikka Masala burrito; my impression was that it's based on a chicken burrito and has Indian spices. I agree with other reviewers that it's good but not mind-blowing, and that it does not taste like Chicken Tikka Masala that I've had previously. It was more yellow than orange-red and tasted more of curry than what I'd recognize as Chicken Tikka Masala. Still good, still a good burrito, just not Chicken Tikka Masala in a tortilla. Perhaps I'll order it spicy next time.
author: Scott W.

description: I got the Chicken Tikka Masala burrito, which is excellent juicy chicken tm wrapped in a burrito tortilla.  The spice level was just right, flavorful but not obstructive.  Service was absurdly fast once we got to the front of the long line, but it was quite a long line.  The tortilla definitely held together better than my usual Indian wrap experience, and the price was very good, so I'll probably be back, although the fact that I have to remember which days it is there means I might never actually make it back, despite trying.
author: Andy G.

description: I can't get enough of their chicken tikka wraps. Their food is very savory and nicely priced too! Tip: if you get there around 11:45 there's a big chance you will be able to avoid the long lines but the again, their super quick chef will have your order ready in no time!
author: Alexander B.

description: Agree with all the rave reviews of the chicken tikka masala burrito.  Got two to bring home for dinner friday when they were at civic center.  it is spicy - almost too much for me.  but hubby thought it was perfect, and was so delighted when he thought he was biting into a mexican burrito - what a surprise!  I reheated them for 30 min in the toaster oven at 350 and they were perfect!
author: char s.

description: This was my first time trying Curry Up Now so I decided to keep it simple and get the sexy fries with the chicken tikka masala. When I went to order the guy was kind of rude, but its a food truck what do you expect. I got my food, opened the box, and was a little shocked to see that there was maybe 8 fries and few chunks of chicken. For $8.50 I expected there to be more food. After I sat down I had forgotten to grab a fork and a napkin, so I went back up to grab one. My friend asked me to grab one for him too so I grabbed two and the worker made some rude comment about me taking more than necessary. Two napkins for two people (one each) seemed reasonable. Rude workers are always a turn off for any place. After that I sat down to eat my food. It was disappointing to say the least. My advice- don't waste your time or money. The food sucks and the people working the truck aren't much better.
author: Jessica S.

description: BEST Indian food I've ever had!  Love them, and l keep current on their locals by getting their Tweets!
author: Gianali B.

description:
I have walked by the mustard yellow truck for several weeks now, usually on my way back from lunch.  I checked the website to see if they would be in the FiDi today and alas, the stars were aligned.  I went to the order section of the site and tried to place my order.  After timing out several times, I called to find out if there was an issue. I was told by a very nice and accommodating man that they were trying to revamp the website.  He offered to take my order by phone and text it to the truck--hooray

When I arrived at 11:40, I was the 4th person in line with the doors of the truck closed and the staff working furiously.  The truck didn't quite open on time and the menu that stated "Sold Out" was quickly altered with a Sharpie  "CTM and PTM"  (Chicken Tikka Masala burrito and Paneer Tikka masala burrito).  

My yummy CTM was waiting for me in the warming window and was tasty, moist and spicy (medium).  The samosa was yummy, but a little tough.  I shared both with my colleague and it was enough for lunch for the both of us.  Otherwise I'd be asleep under my desk right about now . . . 

My only recommendation would be to provide larger condiment containers.  The teeny ones don't hold enough and your customers will end up using twice or three times as many as a result.
author: Mrs P.

description: Thank you for the incredible tikka masala burrito, it was probably the best I've ever had.  You didn't know but it was the day my beloved nonna passed and I was on my way to sit in the sand at Crissy Field. Your kindness will be remembered.
author: Melissa M.

description: so overrated! too spicy! was expecting something a little better but the chicken tikka masala burrito definitely fell short. big portion tho!
author: Jennifer C.

description:
1. Chicken tikka masala burrito - YUM!  Spicy is very spicy...beware.  But if you like spicy like me then you will be very happy.
2. Mango lassi - very flavourful but probably wouldn't order again as is it was very filling and the burrito is more than enough food.
3. Samosa - the filling was good but shell was very heavy and thick...wouldn't order it again.

Overall....SOOOOO  GOOD!!  Will definitely go back and was worth the wait in line.  Also, for those who don't want to wait in line, I think you can order on their website and just scoot in the front of the line for a pick up.  Saves you 25 minutes of your lunch hour!  :)
author: Tammy S.

description:
Curry Up Now, I love you. 

I really like curry, but it is inconvenient.  In other establishments, the curry is served as a bowl of curry and rice, and I am expected to take my time, and dispense the curry over the rice?  Not at Curry Up Now.  They take all the deliciousness of curry, and package it in all the convenience of a burrito.  

Also, if you ask for extra spicy, it really does have a bit of a kick.
author: Brett C.

description: The paneer tikka masala is better than my Mom's...don't tell her I said so! SO delicious - I hope CUN is available more at Stanford and more in the city on weekends. DELICIOUS!
author: Mona T.

description: I got the chicken tikka masala burrito at $8. As soon as I paid for it, the guy dropped it in my hands. I guess they make a lot of those and have it ready. Hopefully it didnt sit for very long. Anyway its a good burrito, decent size. Not as creamy or moist as a regular curry but I guess the burrito format forces them to make it drier. I didn't specify spiciness level and it was pretty spicy even though I'm used to eating spicy food. It had me sniffling a bit. You wouldn't like it if you don't like spicy food.
author: Dijon Y.

description:
Excellent for the curry you can eat from your hand.  Be sure to ask for it spicy.

Be prepared for the annoying San Franciscian behind you extolling the virtues of the SF food scene.  The line is long and a bit too eager.
author: Tricia M.

description: Well, almost a year later, I finally tried this place again, and thankfully someone did something about the excessive spicyness.  My husband and I shared the "special" chiken tikka sweet potato fries (quite tasty), a paneer burrito (average), and a deconstructed samosa without meat (decent).  The best of the three was definitely the chiken tikka with fries special.  Again, I was glad to have a mango lassi with the food, but this time it was a nice complement as opposed to a necessary fire extinguisher.  $24 for all of the above, and it took about 20 minutes total.  It was also CASH ONLY so we had to hit an ATM - fortunately, there's a Wells Fargo directly across from the truck.  I asked for the burrito "extra mild" and was told that they're "already made kind of spicy."  You can get some yogurt to cool it off in the little mini cups on the right corner of the area below the cash register.  All in all, a better experience than last year, and I give it a fourth star for the fun/unique factor.
author: Molly P.

description: The quality can definitely vary pretty significantly from visit to visit.  But, when it's good, it's about the best lunch option in San Francisco.
author: Jake M.

description:
deconstructed samosa
chicken tikki masal burrito
sexy fries
mango lassi

thats all you need for a party in your stomach.
author: Raymond L.

description: I love frequenting this truck. Their chicken tika masala burrito is delicious and is worth the price. The other burritos are really good, too. I just wish they had more stuff on their menu.
author: Wesley C.

description: Previous reviews are either made up by the owners or its just white folks don't know any better. The Burrito is the worst I have ever eaten. For $7 it does not offer much either, just rice and chicken mixed with pre made sauce. Really boring sauce, no flavor. tastes like some store bought curry powder mixed with hot water. Not worth the money at all. But with right marketing you can sell anything to american, just like bottled tap water.
author: rasari r.

description: That's an incredible burrito. I love burritos and Indian food so how could it disappoint. I was afraid my expectations were too high when I got back to my office and unwrapped it...but I was no disappointed. What a beautiful thing!
author: Andrew C.

description: On my first trip to San Fran, I was looking on yelp for something cool to try and came across Curry Up.  I was actually excited about trying India food from a food truck, after all street food in India is pretty good and being Indian, I could not pass it up.  Unfortunately, the first try we could not find it; so when we came back into the city on the end of week long trip I had a second chance!  I was not disappointed, standing in line in the rain, I ordered the paneer Kati roll, the chicken Kati roll, and the samosa decomposed.   My wife and I were impressed with both of the rolls, she even said the paneer roll reminded her of the ones she had in India.  I thought it was spicy, tangy, the chicken was tender and overall excellent blend of tastes.  The samosa was good, the chick pea (chole) over powers the taste of the samosa, but it is still a unique combination and worth a try.  After finishing my roll I went back for seconds!
author: Ashish R.

description: Came here today for the first time on my way to buy a newspaper... I'd promised myself I'd be spending less money on food but with the throngs of hopefuls waiting for their orders and the delicious smell wafting from the truck, I couldn't resist.  Despite having a very long line, it moved quickly and the guy didn't ask disdainful when I asked what methi pulao is - it's rice with fenugreek FYI... it was hard to decide among the deconstructed samosa, tikka masala & vindaloo burritos!  I decided to go with the chicken vindaloo, to which I added onions and I was not disappointed.  8 bucks is for lunch is a lot for a nonprofit worker like me but once I felt the heft of the fragrant burrito - I did not regret my purchase.  When I bit into the burrito, the weight of a small baby, I was greeted by a symphony of delicious flavors.  If you're not so big like me, I promise you this burrito will make 2 meals - so at 4 bucks a meal, a great deal!  And even if you end up devouring the whole thing (and spending the next few hours in a curry foodbaby hangover), it'll be worth it... so so good.  I'm definitely coming back and grabbing a mango lassi and some of those interesting looking Indian chips.  Oh, if you're vegetarian, you can also get any burrito w/ paneer (cheese - kinda like tofu) instead, love that!
author: Suzanne V.

description: whoa, damn tikka masala burrito...i think anything in burrito form is good, and this is way good...
author: christopher h.

description: eek! methinks not because i found a PUBE in my paneer masala burrito. end of story.
author: april s.

description:
I really really like CUN.  The truck is across from my office,  and from 11AM until about 2:30,  you walk out of One Bush Street and all you can smell is Indian spice.  Wow.  So I finally got over the long lines and tried it.  A number of their products have cream and milk in them, and for me,  that's off the list.  HOWEVER,   they have a couple of things that are off the hook. the 'really wierd burrito', for example. I don't want to know what's in it other than pieces of samosa (YUM), rice and i don't know what.  What I do know is people in my office were really worried about the animal noises coming out of my office as i at this monster.  OMG it was good.  and HOT.   Next on the list is a deconstructer samosa. What genius.  Spice,  chutney, chicken or veg, chickpeas and I don't know what else.  It is SO good,  and SO filling,  for $4!! And today I had a Kathi Roll.  It's essentially a kebab wrapped in an unusual dough done with egg and spice.  It's messy but EXCELLENT.. 

I am grateful these guys are around.  It would get 5 stars but they have milk in too many things!  I want GOAT CURRY with coconut milk not Cow Milk!  PLEEEEEEASE!!
author: Billy O.

description:
Just got back from lunch at Curry Up Now and had the Chicken Tikka Masala Burrito. Pretty darn good. First off, the line was absurd so make sure to order ahead online. You can only get the burritos when you order ahead but the like looked like it would take 45 minutes or so. Even ordering ahead we had to wait 10 minutes or so to get the food. 

The Burrito itself was really good. Very big and densely packed with excellent flavor. I ordered it spicy and it was great but very hot. I wouldn't suggest getting it spicy unless you can really handle hot food. It's also very unique and different than other burritoesque Indian places (Kasa). Just make sure to order ahead.
author: Simon H.

description: I got the chicken tikka masala burrito after hearing rave reviews but I got sick from it.  Disappointing.
author: Doris L.

description: chicken tikka masala. nough said right? nope. stuff it inside a wonderful hot tortilla. words cant describe to you how good this is. so its weird im writing about it i know. unfortunately yelp doesnt me afford a format to draw a delicious heavenly indian street food themed picture. if i could it would have a ganesha healing babies and feeding the hungry while holding a burrito sipping on a mango lassi. the ganesha got it at curry up now. thats why hes smiling :)
author: Jarred D.

description: Had their Chicken Tiki Marsala Burrito non-spicy since I heard their spicy is no joke.  Co-worker had their Burrito and the Chicken Deconstructed Samosa.  Both were good.  But, the only gripe I had was when I was given the bag.  Because I had ordered (3) things they gave me a paper bag.  I don't know what it is about their truck, but it seemed higher than the others.  So much so that I had to tip-toe to place and grab my order.  Never had to stretch so much for the others.  I grabbed the bag and held it similarly to how it was given to me.  But, when I walked back to work, it started dripping heavily.  I didn't realize why and could not find any paper towels or any kind of contraption to stop the drippings.  When I finally did, I realized that the deconstructed samosa was in a to go container and that the drippings were coming from that.  Had I known or was told by the person that was giving it to me, I would have carried it better and my clothes wouldn't be stained.  Minus 1 star for that.  Besides my mishap with the bag, we were happy with our selections.  Burrito was huge!  This was probably 2 servings or maybe 3?  Deconstructed Samosa was so good.  Flavors were nice.   Can't wait to try more.
author: Heizel M.

description: I was a bit skeptical about an Indian burrito, but I have to agree with most of the reviews that it was delicious! It was quite spicy (but in a good way), so be forewarned. I had the paneer tikka masala burrito which also has channa masala and rice in it. It was very filling and worth the $8. I'm looking forward to going back and trying all of their other menu items!
author: Priyam D.

description: Ridiculous waits, disorganized and unhelpful order taker who thought chicken was for vegetarians, unremarkable burritos. Must be the thrill of ordering by Twitter. Try the taco truck around the corner on Sansome street for cheap, fast, good.
author: john d.

description:
the boyfriend and i decided to check out senor sisig and saw curry up now parked next to it. i decided that i wanted to get some samosas because i was craving them for so long. i ended up ordering the 2 samosas with mango lassi. totally met my expectations! it was spicy, so if your not a fan of spicy food, i suggest you pass on this one. i got the sweet sauce, which was delicious! 

cant wait to try out their burritos and other items on the menu!
author: Melissa T.

description: when i worked in the financial district, i would get random cravings for this place almost weekly and end up wasting half my lunch waiting in line for a chicken tikka masala burrito. decide what you want at least half an hour before lunch and order online, it'll save you some of the wait.
author: Ellen H.

description: ridiculous lines aside, this is some tasty indian food.  i've only been able to try the kathi rolls and the CTM (chicken tikka masala) burrito and i've enjoyed both.  the kathi rolls, particularly the chicken one, is absolutely delicious.  the roti part was a tad oily but had great flavor and the fillings were great.  the chicken had more flavor and was more moist but the keema (ground  meat) was a bit dry but still good.  the burrito when i had it was insanely spicy but tasty.  getting there early should prevent any crazy waits. they do wait til later in the day to start selling certain items, like kathi rolls, so keep an eye out for that.
author: Swarup B.

description: The first thing I want to point out is that it is a moving food truck that travels, so it is not always parked at 225 Bush Street.  I went looking for it the other day and arrived at 225 Bush to find that it wasn't there.  Today however, I happen to be walking down Bush street and there it was! I was very excited to finally try it and although I was very skeptical about the Chicken Masala burrito, it was really good! The flavor was fabulous! Very authentic and packed with spices.  I really enjoyed the burrito, but there is only one down fall...it was really HOT! My mouth was instantly burning, and nose running from it being so spicy. I am not a real fan of spice, so to some this may be ok, but if you don't like hot food, you may not make it thru the whole burrito.  I was able to finish it because the flavor was sooo good I didn't want to put it down even though my mouth was on fire!! LOL. I will go here again, and I recommend others to try it as well, but next time I am going to ask if they have a mild version :-)
author: Tiana S.

description: What's better than Indian food, right?  And the long lines I pass by each day indicated something really great, in spite of the roach coach motif.  So, I stood in line for close to 30 minutes and ordered a spicy tikka masala burrito.  Wow, what a disappointment?  Next time I definitely wouldn't order spicy, even though there won't be a next time.  And most importantly, where the heck was the chicken?!!!  It was a curry rice burrito with about four pieces of chicken, if that.  I, for one, am not going to waste my time standing in that line again to be disappointed.
author: Heather L.

description: Just tried the Chicken Tikka Burrito after reading various reviews.  Totally worth downloading the app so you can just walk up to the pickup window and get your order without waiting on line.  I wondered whether people were exaggerating when they said the burrito was "really hot", but no, they weren't!  It's a good hot, not the tounge-numbing searing kind, but a warm enveloping hot with some depth to it.  An addictive kind of hot.  It wasn't too salty either, which is really important to me.  My burrito was full of goopy saucy goodness.  I thought the onions would be pickled but they were not (just sauted).  They also don't have whole wheat burritos on the trucks, but I didn't hold that against them.  The guys on the truck are also really pleasant.
author: Priscilla C.

description: My favorite item is the sexy fries: waffle cut sweet potato fries with onions, tikka masala sauce, and your choice of chicken or tofu.  What's not to like?
author: John F.

description: the food is stellar - decon samosa anyone??? - but unless either of the owners takes your order, don't be surprised if you get some attitude with your change... seriously ppl, whats with the 'tude?!
author: Dama J.

description: So incredibly good! Both the paneer burrito and the deconstructed samosa were fantastic. Get there before or after the lunch rush - I've heard the lines can be long.
author: E K.

description: great idea but i've had "indian wraps." all the same delicious stuff is wrapped in naan and i'd choose that route to my mouth instead of the tortilla any day. still, a tasty buritto.
author: Regina C.

description: Definitiely worth trying if you've never experienced an Indian food truck.  I ordered the Deconstructed Samosa - samosa (potato-stuffed pastry), garbanzo beans, pico de gallo, pickled onions, cilantro & mint chutney.  Definitely a lot of carbs packed into this meal and it was extremely filling.   Spiciness = 3 out of 5
author: B W.

description: This is one of my favorite trucks at Off the Grid...the rolls are by far the best thing in the menu, I think.  Caught them at Eat Real and they weren't serving the rolls but people were loving the deconstructed samosa.
author: B H.

description: 100% worth the wait in line. Not many things on the menu, but what they lack in variety is well made up for in terms of how delicious their offerings are! I'm hooked on the Chicken Tikka Masala burrito (think of it like curry wrapped up in nan bread). After introducing this to my coworkers, we've all become huge fans and are constantly on the look out for whenever the truck is in our neighborhood.
author: Jane D.

description: Great indian fast food. Was surprised at the line, but was worth it. Had the samosa deconstructed (keema) and mango lassi. $3 for lassi was a but much but lassi was good, not overly sweet. The samosa was great. They also have loyalty card!! Will surely go there repeatedly.
author: Abhijeet D.

description: damn this truck is good.  the chicken curry burrito out does about every indian restaurant in the area. and the price is nice.
author: Raj D.

description: oh geez--  this place is hecka good!
author: Hooked On Hoops A.

description: It can be excellent and it can be purely mediocre depending on who is preparing the food.  After trying a smattering of burritos, I now always go with the inside out samosa with paneer ($6).  Spicy, delicious, and filling.  Although... I just had it again today and the dish is not warm, the paneer is rubbery, and the chutneys must have been prepared by a newbie.  Overall, still a great quick, delicious, and cheap bite on the streets.
author: Roshan J.

description: the CTM is mos. def. a weekly lunch staple for me. if only i weren't cutting back on carbs i'd hit up this spot more than just weekly. oh, and the hot sauce is nuclear! i wish i could buy it by the bottle.
author: Greg H.

description: RUN, don't walk to get your curryupnow burrito. For under $10, you will have a very tasty and satisfying meal. I have eaten the paneer tikka masala burrito, in addition to a few other "specialty" burrito's. Always great quality, always great taste and always a good value. 5 stars!
author: Annu K.

description: faaaantastic chicken tikka masala burritos!!
author: Ali S.

description: Kinda Overrated. I think people are drawn to it because of the concept of fast Indian food in the parking lot. Anyone who knows real Indian food can tell you tikka masala is not meant to be sweet. This kills the burrito for me. I don't want sweet curry or I would go get Thai food. The food was good at first but the deconstructed samosas keep getting watery, the burrito is full of rice and not much else, and the chai was chewy. Yes, chewy. Apparently I was the last one to get a cup and well they ended up pouring me the cooked milk. It was gross. They need more options.
author: Jin S.

description: Beat the lunch rush for this place! But, really even the wait is worth it. Great food, good service. Flavorful, spicy, tasty and generous portions. Credit cards a-ok too.
author: mike g.

description:
finally tried the chicken tikka marsala burrito that everyone has been raving about on yelp.. boy, it was great! spicy and yummy! although, I can't take spicy too much (couldn't finish the burrito b/c of the spiciness).. I would still get it..

definitely a go back.. tip: this place is so popular..get there early (they open at 11:30A) better yet.. order online and just pick it up! order 1/2 hr before they open..
author: Linda Y.

description: Delicious Indian food with a Mexican taco truck aesthetic. Perfect.
author: Andy H.

description: I've been here several times now and today's experience wasn't great. There were only 3 people in line in front of me, but it was taking forever. They had the main guy ringing people up, then 3 people working on orders. Three different people came up and said they had placed orders online and I'm not sure what the problem was, but no one knew anything about them. Kept asking each person the same questions, what did you order, what is your name, what did you order again?? Then they just made the stuff right then and there, so those of us in line had to wait even longer. Doesn't seem like a great system. What really inspired me to write the update though, is that I requested my Chicken burrito 'spicy'. I do this most places I go, I love really spicy food. I can't remember a time when what I ordered has been too spicy, I'm sure it's happened, but the burrito I got was insane. Although I managed to get it down, I drank 30oz of water in doing so -- have to refill my 24oz water bottle, I was able to see how much I was drinking. Like I said, I'm really not a wimp when it comes to 'spicy' but while I was able to force this down, it was not enjoyable and I imagine for most who say, 'oh ya, i like spicy food', this would be inedible to them. So there's your warning, I would avoid asking for it spicy unless you want your entire tongue (and later stomach) burning.
author: Lauren M.

description: Stopped by the Off the Grid food truck gathering in front of City Hall today and amongst all the selections, I was most intrigued to try Curry Up Now and it did not disappoint.  Had a hard time deciding, but finally settled on the paneer tikka masala burrito, which is cottage cheese, chickpeas, and a rich curry rice wrapped in a tortilla.  It's not Mission burrito sized thankfully, but it's still really sizable and filling and I couldn't even finish mine as wonderful as it was, particularly for the price.
author: Jason L.

description: Woohoo - Spicy actually means spicy. Delicious... and feeling and well worth its price. I'd definitely go back here to get a delicious burrito. Mango lassi was more on the "enh" side, but I thought it was cool that they had all these sodas and chips from India, not that I was interested in them per se - but great to keep it interesting. Samosas were delicious too but I wished there was some tamarind and mint chutney to dip with it. =(
author: Jeannette L.

description: ctm burrito is amazing! the spicy option is extremely spicy, be careful!
author: Nicholas M.

description:
i had it when the  truck came to Redwood City.
the foods were quite tasty and freshed for lunch. 
i want the meats portion to be bigger though...
author: Truc N.

description: Upon my first review, Rani, the owner replied to my review and was very sympathetic of my 1st experience with my Chicken Tikka Masala burrito and actually wanted me to come again and to bring along a friend this time as well to have another go at it, but this time, lunch will be on her. She said that usually the cashier warns their customers about how spicy their burritos are when you order a spicy one and most likely it was a new worker which was one of the reasons I probably had a sub-par, dry burrito. I decided to take on that offer today and brought my cousin along since their location this time was at Burlingame along Howard/Primrose and since it was on the way to my other cousin's house where we were heading to to begin with. We got 2 MILD Chicken Tikka Masala burritos this time. I decided to buy 2 Mango Lassi's as well since I already felt bad of me getting the burritos for free. The cashier offered saying it's okay, but I insisted in paying for them. Now I can say it definitely deserves the stars that people have been rating them worth for. Our burritos were very tasty and definitely MOIST, hot, and juicy this time unlike my previous one which was dry, cold, and very spicy making it unedible. For mild, it actually has a bit of a kick. I might push my luck and try a medium next time though. The mango lassi's this time didn't have any mint leaves which I was surprised, but definitely was a plus for me and still was very refreshing, creamy, smooth and tasty. My cousin wasn't a big fan of it seeing as he has quite a sweet tooth. It was sour to him due to the yogurt in it so I gladfully drank his, lol. Rani is a very serious owner of her business who definitely cares about her customers feedback being it good OR bad. I will definitely keep coming back for more. I'm going to try the deconstructed samosas next time since my friend highly recommends it. 4 stars from a very satisfied customer.
author: Sean E.

description: I wanted to love it.. I just thought the Tikka Masala was a bit too sweet.
author: Jay R.

description: Bomb food for sure, but why does it take soooo long?  A little constructive criticism: they need an assembly line process for this. pre-make the burritos and just hand them out as people pay. they have the burritos sitting there ready to be bought, but the cashiers are sooo slow. it shouldn't take so long, they are losing a lot of business.
author: Jay D.

description: a few weeks ago, I waited for 20 minutes in the rain w/o an umbrella for a chicken tikka masala burrito, and as my reward, its spicyness churned & burned in my tummy all afternoon long. oh, for the love of a good food truck!
author: Michelle A.

description: Stopped by their truck at the Eat Real Festival in Jack London Sq. last weekend. I ordered the veggie samosas, one of my favorite Indian dishes, but found them to be disappointingly bland and crudely formed.. Way too much dough and not nearly enough spice. Really missed the cumin hit that I'm accustomed to. BUT...the sauces were FABULOUS! And what beautiful colors! I ladled on the white raita, a great green cilantro sauce, and best of all, a very bright red hot chile sauce. Man, was that good! I have not stopped thinking about it. It was really hot...burned my mouth, but I like it like that. I mopped up these excellent sauces with the potato-filled samosas and that more than made up for the bland doughiness of it all. Seems like the Chicken Tikka Burrito was the thing to order but I didn't know that. Anyway, I'm dying to find out what kind of peppers were used in their red hot sauce. That sauce alone made me a fan. Next time I'll try the burrito. I'm going to give them 4 stars based on their sauces alone.
author: Blue S.
